chunk:
Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/about](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/about)
* * *

**Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM)** is a research institute operating within the **[ University of Primorska ](https://www.upr.si/) ** . In **1999** it was registered as an independent public research institute under the name of **_Primorska Institute of Natural and Technical Sciences Koper (UP PINT)_ ** . As of 10 November 2011, UP PINT was renamed the _Andrej Marušič Institute - UP IAM_ **_._ **

Since its foundation, UP IAM has been **the backbone of development in the field of science and technology** at UP which is a strategically important area for the broader progress of the university. A distinctive feature of research excellence is that research is not limited to performance in a single discipline, but emphasises interdisciplinary performance, which means working beyond the traditional and sharp divisions between the core fields of human science (natural sciences, engineering, social sciences, humanities). To this end, since 2006, UP IAM has operated in close cooperation with the **[ UP Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Communication Technologies (UP Famnit) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en) ** . 

Research work is organised in **four interconnected research and development units** : the Department of Technology (OT UP IAM), Department of Mathematics (OM UP IAM), Department of Information Science and Technology (DIST UP IAM) and Department of Health Studies (OPZ UP IAM). 

In addition to its departments, UP IAM has also established three centres. _The Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (SCRS)_ was established in 2011; its Chair, Prof. Dr. Diego De Leo, proposed the creation of an independent unit within the Institute in memory of his late colleague, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Andrej Marušič, and with the aim of continuing his work. _The Centre for Cooperation with Industry (CSI UP IAM)_ was established in 2012 in line with UP's policy of promoting cooperation with industry on research and development projects. In 2015, _the Centre for Application Design and Development (CORA UP IAM)_ was also established as the need was recognised for an organised group of researchers to manage and work in the field of applications for both UP IAM and UP, as well as in the market.
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM), established in 1999 as the Primorska Institute of Natural and Technical Sciences Koper (UP PINT) and renamed in 2011, serves as a pivotal research hub at the University of Primorska, driving interdisciplinary science and technology development. It collaborates closely with the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Communication Technologies (Famnit) since 2006, organizing research through four departments (Technology, Mathematics, Information Science, Health Studies) and three specialized centers: the Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (2011), the Centre for Cooperation with Industry (2012), and the Centre for Application Design and Development (2015), each addressing distinct research and innovation priorities.

Key contacts include Bojan Lazar (University of Primorska) for European, African, and Asian students, and Scott Heppell (Oregon State University) for students from the Americas and Indo-Pacific region, providing email and phone details for inquiries.

summary: The document outlines a form for research organizations to apply to join a working group under the FP1407 initiative, requiring details such as the organization's name, department, contact information, research focus areas related to FP1407, available facilities, and willingness to host researchers. It also includes sections for listing members, their roles in specific working groups (e.g., Product Category Rules, Life Cycle Assessments), and personal details like email, gender, and ECI/ESR status, along with a photo upload option. The form aims to facilitate collaboration and participation in FP1407 projects through structured application and member engagement.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/international-collaboration](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/international-collaboration)

A specific strategic orientation from the very beginning, and an increasingly strong advantage of **UP IAM** , which is **particularly important in the development of young researchers** , is its **strong international presence and visibility** , which fosters guest lectures abroad, visits of international researchers, and participation in international projects and prestigious events. UP IAM is strengthening this by: 
  * ecruiting international staff, both established researchers and young researchers, 
  * successfully applying for bilateral cooperation projects with researchers from abroad, 
  * organising and attending international conferences, summer schools and other scientific meetings, 
  * participation in international associations in various scientific fields, 
  * mobility of staff, both research and professional, 
  * applying for and carrying out international research projects. 
* * *

As of **1 January 2022** , **20 international researchers are employed at UP IAM** (four have acquired Slovenian citizenship), including six young researchers. Our international employees come from _Argentina, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, France, Hungary, India, Poland, Sweden, the United Kingdom,_ and _the United States of America_ . 

**In 2022** , 8 bilateral projects with the following countries are continuing: Bosnia and Herzegovina (3), Croatia (1), Japan (1), Denmark (1), and Austria (2). In 2022, we plan to submit 8 bilateral project applications to calls for proposals that will be published or are planned to be published. Measures and constraints related to the prevention of the spread of COVID-19 are a barrier to international cooperation only in terms of the inability to organise a live itinerary, while project collaboration and joint research are carried out without distance constraints. 
* * *

_ **Key achievements in the field of international engagement in the last 5 years include:** _
  * The organisation of [ **the 8th European Congress of Mathematics - 8ECM** ](https://8ecm.si/) (20-26 June 2021 in Portorož and simultaneously online) is a great success for Slovenian mathematics and science in general, as Slovenia has never hosted such an important event before. The European Congress is organised every 4 years under the auspices of the European Mathematical Society (EMS) and in 2021 it was the largest mathematics event in the world. The Congress was also honoured by the patronage of the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Mr Borut Pahor. 
  * Development of the **Teaming project** in collaboration with the renowned Fraunhofer Institute. In 2016, the Centre of Excellence for Research and Innovation in Renewable Materials and Healthy Living Environments ( [ **InnoRenew CoE** ](https://innorenew.eu/) ) was established: seven Slovenian partners were brought together by UP IAM in a consortium with a mentoring institution, the German Fraunhofer Institute for Wood Research - Wilhelm-Klauditz-Institut, a world-class institution for R&D and transfer of innovations into industrial practice. As of 2022, the Centre is completing the construction of a building in Izola where key research will take place, thus increasing the international competitiveness of the Slovenian timber industry and related economy. 
  * Organisation of the [ **World Congress of IASP (International Association for Suicide Prevention)** ](https://www.iasp.info/) in 2023 in Piran. The World Congress is organised every two years and is a gathering of the world's most eminent experts in the field of suicide prevention. The Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research.
summary: UP IAM emphasizes its strong international presence and visibility as a key strategic advantage, fostering collaboration through hiring global staff, bilateral projects, international conferences, and participation in scientific associations. As of January 2022, 20 international researchers (including six young ones from Argentina, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, France, Hungary, India, Poland, Sweden, the UK, and the US) contribute to its efforts, with eight ongoing bilateral projects in 2022. Despite COVID-19 restrictions limiting in-person activities, remote collaboration remains uninterrupted. Notable achievements include hosting the 8th European Congress of Mathematics (2021), developing the InnoRenew CoE with Fraunhofer, and organizing the World Congress of IASP (2023), underscoring its role in advancing global research and enhancing Slovenia’s scientific competitiveness.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/vision-and-mission](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/vision-and-mission)

** VISION UP IAM  **

UP IAM focuses its development on increasing its performance, mainly through integration into the international environment through scientific excellence. 

The vision of UP IAM is to further enhance the interdisciplinary research links between all existing departments and fields, thus becoming a single interdisciplinary regional, national and global centre of science and technology, providing solutions for the local and wider environs to improve the quality of life in various fields: 
  * To further strengthen its position as one of the four leading research groups in the field of mathematics and algebraic graph theory on a global scale through the successful implementation of an event of global importance. 
  * Advance the field of cryptography to a world-class level. 
  * T  o become a recognised centre for the study of mental health and suicidal behaviour in Slovenia and one of the key centres at a global level, linking all stakeholders – institutions, NGOs, the community and students of psychology – with world-renowned experts. 
  * Establish a joint technology and development park in close partnership with industry and actively participate in the development of the Centre of Excellence for Research and Innovation in Renewable Materials and Healthy Living Environments – InnoRenew CoE. 
  * Become an important contributor in the development of e-solutions for public institutions and companies, with in-house developed and tested applications. 
  * To co-create with the local community and decision-makers a friendly environment for research and academics, with an awareness of the importance of science for prosperity. At the same time, to be an excellent and attractive working environment for both young and established researchers from Slovenia and abroad, with strong administrative support to facilitate researchers’ focus solely on their scientific work. 
  * Restructuring of the UP IAM into a Doctoral School (UP DAM) for Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Interdisciplinarity and Engineering, which will bring doctoral programmes closer to scientific research and cooperation with industry. 
* * *

**UP IAM MISSION**

The mission of UP IAM is to develop the fundamental fields of the Human Sciences (natural sciences and engineering in relation to the social sciences and humanistic studies) through close interdisciplinary cooperation at both a national and international level, with the aim of achieving scientific excellence and producing research results for a shared prosperity and development of a unified science. 

UP IAM pursues its mission through inextricably linked and intertwined key areas: research excellence, social activity, international engagement, cooperation with industry and NGOs, and the creation of a stimulating working environment. The pursuit of our mission is thus focused on: 
  * M  aintaining and further improving scientific excellence, defined by the number of publications in indexed journals, the number of citations, and the successful acquisition and implementation of research projects. 
  * I  ncreased interdisciplinarity between Mathematics and Computer Science, with a particular focus on the development of the field of cryptography, which is crucial in terms of national security. 
  * Engagement with the social environment through successful transfer of knowledge to the wider public, especially in the areas of preserving and improving (mental) health, healthy living and the environment. 
  * Strengthening young staff development, with the added advantage of strong international presence and visibility, which allows for visits abroad, visits by international researchers, and participation in internationally renowned events, and projects. 
  * Organisation of annual international conferences with the participation of the most eminent scientists in the field and other meetings aimed at transferring knowledge. 
  * Contributing to the enhancement of the international competitiveness of individual sectors of the Slovenian economy in the field of sustainable use of natural resources and sustainability in the operations of businesses and in the overall quality of users’ lives. 
  * Fostering a working environment that allows researchers to excel in administrative support and to reduce such tasks, which provides an opportunity to better focus on the pursuit of research excellence.   

_ The current vision and mission were adopted at the 1st Regular Session of the UP IAM Researchers’ Assembly on June 11  th  , 2018. 

_
summary: UP IAM's vision is to establish itself as a leading interdisciplinary center for science and technology, focusing on advancing mathematics, cryptography, mental health research, sustainable innovation, and e-solutions, while fostering global collaboration and industry partnerships. Its mission emphasizes achieving scientific excellence through interdisciplinary research, knowledge transfer, and social engagement, alongside creating a supportive environment for researchers and strengthening Slovenia's economic competitiveness through sustainable practices and academic collaboration.

chunk:
#  COST actions 
##  About COST actions 

[ COST ](http://www.cost.eu/) is an intergovernmental framework [ ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/cost-actions/logocost.png:resizebox?500x104) ](http://www.cost.eu/) for European Cooperation in Science and Technology, allowing the coordination of nationally-funded research on a European level. COST contributes to reducing the fragmentation in European research investments and to opening the European Research Area to cooperation worldwide.
summary: The University of Primorska actively participates in COST (European Cooperation in Science and Technology) actions, leading or co-leading three key initiatives: CA18201 (conserving threatened plants through interdisciplinary research), FP1303 (advancing bio-based building materials), and ModWoodLife (studying wood modification for sustainability). These actions involve collaboration with European countries and focus on ecological conservation, sustainable materials, and environmental impact reduction. chunk:
#  COST actions 
##  University of Primorska as a grant holder of COST actions [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/cost-actions#top)

The University of Primorska leads / has led three COST actions: 
  * ###  An integrated approach to conservation of threatened plants for the 21st Century 

On the 15. November 2019 doc.  dr.  Živa Fišer Pečnikar from UP FAMNIT's Department of Biodiversity became the grant holder of COST action CA18201 entitled: [ An integrated approach to the conservation of threatened plants for the 21st Century. ](https://www.cost.eu/actions/CA18201/#tabs%7CName:overview)

The main objective of the action is to improve the protection of endangered plants in Europe through the establishment of a network of researchers and other stakeholders concerned with various aspects of plant conservation, from taxonomy, ecology, conservation genetics, conservation physiology and reproductive biology to protected area managers.  Slovenia is the main initiator of the action, cooperating with representatives from Austria, Finland, France, Greece, Switzerland and the United Kingdom.    

Learn more about the action [ on the website ](https://www.cost.eu/actions/CA18201/#tabs%7CName:overview) . 
  * ###  Performance of bio-based building materials 

On 1 August 2016, [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) became a grant holder of the COST action FP1303: [ Performance of bio-based building materials ](http://www.cost.eu/COST_Actions/fps/FP1303) , 2013 - 2017. 

Members from 29 countries participated in the action. They focused on the performance of bio-based building materials, their resistance, and degradability, with the aim of maintaining and expanding the use of low-carbon building materials in Europe. 

More information is available on the [ action's webpage ](https://www.cost.eu/actions/FP1303/#tabs%7CName:overview) . 
  * ###  ModWoodLife action 

On 10 March 2015, University of Primorska was selected as a grant holder of the COST action FP1407: [ Understanding wood modification through an integrated scientific and environmental impact approach (ModWoodLife) ](http://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/) , 2015 2019. Assoc. Prof. Andreja Kutnar PhD was appointed as the chair of the action. 

Members from 23 European countries participated in the action with the aim of  characterizing the relationship between modification processing, product properties, and the associated environmental impacts. This includes the development and optimization of modified processing, and quantification of the impacts of emerging treatment technologies compared to traditional processing and alternative materials, in order to maximize sustainability and minimize environmental impacts. 

You can read more about the ModWoodLife action on the dedicated website [ here ](http://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/) .

These actions involve collaboration with European countries and focus on ecological conservation, sustainable materials, and environmental impact reduction. Additionally, the university’s faculty and researchers are engaged in thirteen ongoing COST actions, spanning fields like marine conservation, bioadhesion, kidney disease biomarkers, and social innovation, reflecting the institution’s broad commitment to international scientific collaboration and interdisciplinary research.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation) # International Cooperation ## WELCOME TO UP FAMNIT, THE FACULTY THAT BREATHES INTERNATIONALLY! International cooperation and mobility of professors, students and researchers is one of the basic policies of our faculty. 42,1 % of our students and 24,7 % of professors and researchers at UP FAMNIT are from abroad. We promote mobility within existing schemes (Erasmus+, CEEPUS) and within bilateral agreements on different levels (national, university, faculty), as well as possibilities outside formal programmes, in individual arrangements Our professors have established numerous contacts with [ professors and researchers from prestigious foreign universities, who visit us regularly. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/) We cooperate with visitors coming from neighbouring countries and with those from more distant locations: ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/incoming2.png:resizebox?700x338) ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/outgoing2.png:resizebox?2000x2000) More than 70 professors and researchers visit our faculty annually , while several hundred also attend our events. We are involved in numerous bilateral projects, both individually and in cooperation with the University of Primorska, Institute Andrej Marušič ( [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ). Additionally, we organise or co-organise [ successful international conferences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/conferences) , some of which have become traditional. Students, professors and researchers participate in international scientific conferences, meetings and summer schools in their fields worldwide. They frequently attend events as invited speakers, and give lectures to students at international universities. Our students regularly participate in international competitions in their fields.
Our cooperation with institutions from the US is especially strong; please read our latest report .
summary: UP FAMNIT actively fosters international cooperation through mobility programs like Erasmus+ and bilateral agreements, with 42.1% of students and 24.7% of professors/researchers being international. The faculty collaborates with prestigious global institutions, hosts over 70 visiting professors annually, and participates in numerous bilateral projects and international conferences. Students and researchers engage in global academic events, competitions, and exchanges, while strong partnerships with U.S. institutions are highlighted in a dedicated report.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations)

#  Donations for faculty development 

_DONATE_

_...and contribute to the internationalisation of our faculty. Our international cooperation significantly improves the standing and visibility of the University, the local community and Slovenia as a whole._

The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) was founded in 2006. Our goal is to build excellence through internationalisation of our education and research. 

The faculty hosts [ numerous world-class professors and researchers ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/gostujoci-tekst-en) , who give lectures to our undergraduate and post-graduate students. In addition, our professors and associates regularly visit prestigious foreign universities to lecture and conduct research. Each year we organise and co-organise several [ scientific meetings ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/conferences/) , [ international summer schools ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/summer-schools) and [ workshops for the general public ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/workshops) , with the aim of promoting natural sciences in the community and beyond. 

Our strategy encompasses further internationalisation of education and research. To this end, we intend to attract as many excellent foreign students as possible. 133 foreign students are currently enrolled in our faculty (in the academic year 2017/18). 17 of them achieved excellent results in national and international competitions. Due to their outstanding academic achievements, the faculty offers them scholarships and assists them with accommodation. 

We invite you to support our endeavours for our faculty’s internationalisation by becoming our donor. Donations will be used exclusively for financial incentives within UP FAMNIT’s internationalisation strategy (scholarships for the most successful students). Alternatively, you can decide to support other development and promotion activities (development of new study programmes, purchasing of equipment for lecture rooms and laboratories, promotion of the faculty, etc.). 

You can read more about our activities on our [ webpage ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en) , while a short presentation about FAMNIT, highlighting our most notable points, can be found [ here ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2015-2016) . 

You can donate as: 
  * An individual person with a [ onetime transfer ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations) or a [ standing order ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/partners)
  * A legal entity, which [ enters into a contract ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations/legal-entities) with the faculty 

For any additional clarifications, you can reach us at +386 5 611 75 78 or e-mail at [ donacije@famnit.upr.si  ](mailto:donacije@famnit.upr.si) . 

We thank you in advance for your support!
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska seeks donations to advance its internationalization strategy, aiming to enhance global visibility, research, and education. Founded in 2006, the faculty hosts world-class researchers, organizes international conferences, summer schools, and workshops, and attracts 133 foreign students, some of whom receive scholarships for academic excellence. Donations support initiatives like scholarships, new study programs, equipment purchases, and promotional activities, with options for individual or organizational contributions. The faculty invites supporters to collaborate in fostering excellence through international collaboration and academic development.

[ ![](http://eccum.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//news/dsc0306.jpg:resizeboxcropjpg?217x217) ](http://eccum.famnit.upr.si/en/news/partners-met-in-torino) [ Partners met in Torino ](http://eccum.famnit.upr.si/en/news/partners-met-in-torino)

Five universities from Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan are developing a **joint Master Programme** _**Mathematical Engineering** _ under the mentorship of University of Santiago de Compostela (Spain), Politecnico di Torino, POLITO (Italy) and University of Primorska (Slovenia). 

Partners gained project supported under ERASMUS+ programme, under which they will develop the curriculum together. The **first generations are already attending a class** . 

ECCUM = Establishment of Computing Centres and Curriculum Development in Mathematical Engineering Master Programme 

More about the programme can be seen in the video recorded by students of [ IITU ](http://eccum.famnit.upr.si/en/partnership/partners/iitu) during the last partners' meeting:
summary: The ECCUM (Establishment of Computing Centres and Curriculum Development in Mathematical Engineering Master Programme) is a joint Master’s program developed by five universities from Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan, guided by mentors from the University of Santiago de Compostela (Spain), Politecnico di Torino (Italy), and University of Primorska (Slovenia). Funded by the ERASMUS+ program, the initiative focuses on collaborative curriculum development, with the first cohort of students already enrolled. The project includes events such as training sessions, dissemination meetings, and partner gatherings, highlighting its international collaboration and educational impact.

summary: The University of Primorska's Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) offers English-taught programs at all higher education levels, emphasizing research in mathematics, computer science, and natural sciences, alongside international collaboration and a strong focus on student engagement. With over 72 international students and a diverse global network, the faculty provides scholarships, including the University of Primorska scholarship fund and opportunities for Western Balkan nationals, along with low tuition fees for EU and select countries. Students benefit from practical industry partnerships, research involvement from the start, and a supportive environment featuring discounts, cultural activities, and affordable housing, making Slovenia an attractive destination for academic and personal growth.

chunk:
#  Study at UP FAMNIT and scholarships 
##  WELCOME TO UP FAMNIT! [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/study-scholarships#top)

**Our programmes are open to all.**

Currently, **72 of our students come from abroad** . Thus, almost 10% of all our students are international. Combined with exchange students, more than 10% international staff and more than 50 visiting professors and researchers annually, you will have a chance to truly feel the international beat of UP FAMNIT. 

The Faculty offers **[ courses  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education) ** at all three levels of higher education and conducts **[ research ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research) ** in the fields of mathematics, computer science and information technology, and the natural sciences.  [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/about-faculty/welcomefamnit.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.hippocampus.si/ISBN/978-961-7023-07-7/index.html)

Click on the brochure on the right and discover what is going on in our Departments. For more detailed information about the Faculty click [ here ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty) or check out [ Quick facts about the Faculty ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2016-2017) . 

For questions about the Slovenian Educational System continue reading our [ General Information ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information) .

chunk:
#  Study at UP FAMNIT and scholarships 
##  MAIN ADVANTAGES OF STUDYING AT UP FAMNIT [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/study-scholarships#top)

###  Top 4 

We proudly rank in the top four research groups in the field of algebraic graph theory in the world and are the leading research group in the world. 

###  Horizons unlimited 

In the past several years we have welcomed students from Argentina, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Italy, Iran, Kosovo, Macedonia, Montenegro, Mexico, Poland, Russia, Serbia and Ukraine. 

###  More than numbers 

Our students greatly value a personal approach and our surveys show their high satisfaction with student-teacher relationships. 

###  Cooperation with employers 

The faculty cooperates with companies in the region, the country and beyond. Students have the chance to experience real-life situations and gain practical knowledge under the mentorship of teachers and entrepreneurs. 

###  Sharing and exchanging knowledge 

In order to share and discuss new findings in specific scientific fields, our researchers have organised [ several very successful international conferences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/conferences) . 

###  Involvement in research work from the start 

The majority of our teaching staff conducts their research work at the [ Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) ](http://www.iam.upr.si/sl/) where students from UP FAMNIT are encouraged to participate in scientific work in order to progress from theory to practice, get introduced to possible future work opportunities and develop their own research interests. 

###  SCI Journal 

University of Primorska and the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia publish the journal [ Ars Mathematica contemporanea ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/amc) which is indexed in the Science Citation Index (SCI).

chunk:
#  Study at UP FAMNIT and scholarships 
##  BEING A STUDENT ON THE SLOVENIAN COAST [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/study-scholarships#top)

Being a student in Slovenia brings you **numerous benefits,** including discounts on public transport and entrance fees to events or other activities; a special coupon system which can be used in restaurants across the country, significantly reducing the costs of living; and the possibility of working through a programme called ‘ **Student Work** ’. The latter allows temporary and part-time work for students, who can easily find a flexible job in different areas. 

Study in Slovenia is even more convenient for students from European Union Member States, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Kosovo, and the Republics of Macedonia and Serbia, since they **do not pay any tuition fees** , while part-time and PhD students pay the University tuition, which is very low in comparison to others worldwide. 

On the Slovenian coast, students can benefit from **many sports and cultural activities, parties and trips** which are organised by several student organisations. These also organise welcome or orientation weeks to help international students get to know each other and settle in. The University has a strong tutoring system, whereby students at most of the faculties assist other students in solving everyday problems. In addition, everyone can choose to stay in a student dormitory or in a private apartment, student dorms being the cheaper option. 

**For more information about general stuff or the paperwork you will need to do before or after your arrival at UP FAMNIT, please click on the links below!**

**[ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/Study-famnit/general.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/general-information/for-students) [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/Study-famnit/visas.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/general-information/for-students-papers) **

**Discover all the advantages of studying in in Slovenia at[ studyinslovenia.si ](http://studyinslovenia.si/) ! **

chunk:
Document location: [https://iam.upr.si/en/international-collaboration](https://iam.upr.si/en/international-collaboration)

A specific strategic orientation from the very beginning, and an increasingly strong advantage of **UP IAM** , which is **particularly important in the development of young researchers** , is its **strong international presence and visibility** , which fosters guest lectures abroad, visits of international researchers, and participation in international projects and prestigious events. UP IAM is strengthening this by: 
  * ecruiting international staff, both established researchers and young researchers, 
  * successfully applying for bilateral cooperation projects with researchers from abroad, 
  * organising and attending international conferences, summer schools and other scientific meetings, 
  * participation in international associations in various scientific fields, 
  * mobility of staff, both research and professional, 
  * applying for and carrying out international research projects. 
* * *

As of **1 January 2022** , **20 international researchers are employed at UP IAM** (four have acquired Slovenian citizenship), including six young researchers. Our international employees come from _Argentina, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, France, Hungary, India, Poland, Sweden, the United Kingdom,_ and _the United States of America_ . 

**In 2022** , 8 bilateral projects with the following countries are continuing: Bosnia and Herzegovina (3), Croatia (1), Japan (1), Denmark (1), and Austria (2). In 2022, we plan to submit 8 bilateral project applications to calls for proposals that will be published or are planned to be published. Measures and constraints related to the prevention of the spread of COVID-19 are a barrier to international cooperation only in terms of the inability to organise a live itinerary, while project collaboration and joint research are carried out without distance constraints. 
* * *

_ **Key achievements in the field of international engagement in the last 5 years include:** _
  * The organisation of [ **the 8th European Congress of Mathematics - 8ECM** ](https://8ecm.si/) (20-26 June 2021 in Portorož and simultaneously online) is a great success for Slovenian mathematics and science in general, as Slovenia has never hosted such an important event before. The European Congress is organised every 4 years under the auspices of the European Mathematical Society (EMS) and in 2021 it was the largest mathematics event in the world. The Congress was also honoured by the patronage of the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Mr Borut Pahor. 
  * Development of the **Teaming project** in collaboration with the renowned Fraunhofer Institute. In 2016, the Centre of Excellence for Research and Innovation in Renewable Materials and Healthy Living Environments ( [ **InnoRenew CoE** ](https://innorenew.eu/) ) was established: seven Slovenian partners were brought together by UP IAM in a consortium with a mentoring institution, the German Fraunhofer Institute for Wood Research - Wilhelm-Klauditz-Institut, a world-class institution for R&D and transfer of innovations into industrial practice. As of 2022, the Centre is completing the construction of a building in Izola where key research will take place, thus increasing the international competitiveness of the Slovenian timber industry and related economy. 
  * Organisation of the [ **World Congress of IASP (International Association for Suicide Prevention)** ](https://www.iasp.info/) in 2023 in Piran. The World Congress is organised every two years and is a gathering of the world's most eminent experts in the field of suicide prevention. The Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research.
summary: UP IAM emphasizes its strong international presence and collaboration as a key driver for fostering young researchers, achieved through recruiting global staff, bilateral projects, international conferences, and participation in scientific associations. As of January 2022, 20 international researchers (including six young ones from Argentina, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, France, Hungary, India, Poland, Sweden, the UK, and the US) contribute to initiatives like 8 bilateral projects with countries such as Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Japan, Denmark, and Austria. Despite COVID-19 constraints on in-person events, virtual collaboration remains robust. Notable achievements include hosting the 8th European Congress of Mathematics (2021), developing the InnoRenew CoE with Fraunhofer for sustainable timber research, and organizing the 2023 World Congress of IASP on suicide prevention, enhancing Slovenia’s global scientific and research competitiveness.

chunk:
Document location: [https://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/stsm](https://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/stsm)

###  **Open call for a STSM**

**The purpose of the short term scientific mission (STSM) is to support working visits to laboratories and institutions of COST Action FP1407 member countries.**

10 STSM are available for funding in the current round covering the period 1st May 2018 to 10th March 2019. Everyone is encouraged to apply, but especially PhD students and Early Stage Researchers.   
The maximum amount of funding per STSM is €2400. Please consider taking advantage of the opportunity. 

**STSMs can be from any Group/University/Institute from a country that has joined the Action to another Group/University/Institute in another member country in the Action.**

###  **Important dates**

Deadline for submission of Applications:   
No less than 4 weeks before planned start of the STSM 

Deadline for completion of the STSM:   
**March 10th, 2019.**

###  **Application Procedure**

Applications must be made online using the official COST registration tool which can be found at [ www.cost.eu/stsm ](http://www.cost.eu/stsm) . 

The information required for the application includes: dates of STSM, length of stay, title of planned scientific activity, short description of the work-plan, short CV and a budget request (to cover travel and living expenses during the STSM) 

In addition to the information required by the COST Office, applicants should also provide the following information to the Action MC Chair (Andreja Kutnar: [ Andreja.kutnar@upr.si ](mailto:Andreja.kutnar@upr.si) ) and to the STSM's Manager (Lauri Rautkari: [ lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi ](mailto:lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi) ), preferably in .pdf format: 
  * a short abstract of the scope of the STSMs (1/2 page) 
  * a plan of the work to be carried out (1 page, approx.) 
  * a covering letter stating the benefits to be obtained from the STSM 
  * full CV 
  * letter of agreement from the host institution 
  * letter of support from the home institution 

#####  Please use the the following **[ application template ](http://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files//stsm/stsm-application-templatev2.docx) ** . 

The applications will be assessed by the Action's Core Group and will be evaluated according to the following criteria: 
  * scientific quality 
  * relevance to the Action 
  * benefit to the applicant 
  * STSMs for periods of one to two weeks would be preferable and may be given priority. The final decision on the approval of the STSMs applications should be expected within 2-4 weeks of submission. 

**After the STSM**

After completing your mission, you are required to provide the following documents to the STSM's Manager (Lauri Rautkari: [ lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi ](mailto:lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi) ): 
  1. A scientific report (please use this **[ report template ](http://cost.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files//stsm/stsmscientific-reporttemplatev2.docx) ** ) 
  2. An official letter / email from a senior researcher affiliated to the Host Institution formally accepting the scientific report 

For any additional information please contact Andreja Kutnar: [ Andreja.kutnar@upr.si ](mailto:Andreja.kutnar@upr.si) ) and to the STSMs Manager (Lauri Rautkari: [ lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi ](mailto:lauri.rautkari@aalto.fi) ), Additional information on STSMs can also be obtained from your country's Management Committee members.
summary: The COST Action FP1407 open call offers 10 funded short-term scientific missions (STSMs) from May 2018 to March 2019, supporting researchers (especially PhD students and early-stage researchers) to conduct collaborative work between member countries. Applications, with a €2400 maximum funding limit, must be submitted at least four weeks before the planned start date and include details on the mission’s scope, work plan, CV, budget, and supporting documents (e.g., host/home institution letters, abstract, and work plan). Applications are evaluated based on scientific quality, relevance to the Action, and applicant benefit, with priority given to 1–2 week missions. Successful applicants must submit a scientific report and host institution endorsement post-mission.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/csi](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/csi)

**Head of Centre:** Dr. Boris Horvat 
* * *

**The Centre for Cooperation with Industry (CSI)** was established in 2012 on the initiative of UP IAM staff with the aim of increasing research and development cooperation with industry and improving knowledge transfer, which can only flourish when it goes beyond the relationship of client and contractor. A successful relationship is thus based on the partnership between UP IAM and companies on joint projects. 

In our ongoing contacts with the industry, it has become clear that they do not believe in the success of research in solving practical cases in advance, but would be willing to work together on joint development projects and to set up such cooperation for the long term. UP IAM staff often work in different departments on such cases due to the interdisciplinary nature of their work, so they saw the need for a homogeneous presentation that would also be clear to partners. On this basis, the CSI was created, which is not an independent or separate unit, but is open to all UP IAM employees who would like to have this kind of networking with business. The CSI thus functions as a departmental liaison unit within the UP IAM, and externally as a cohesive group of interdisciplinary experts who can involve other University of Primorska employees in the development of a joint project with the economic sector. 

The **key aims and objectives** guiding the Centre's activities are: 
  * Strengthening the development and technological components of UP IAM's activities, 
  * Fostering research and development cooperation with industry, 
  * Promoting knowledge transfer, 
  * Regulating intellectual property issues. 
* * *

_[ Members of the Centre for Cooperation with Industry ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/csi/members)   
[ Projects of the Centre for Cooperation with Industry ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/csi/projects) _
summary: The Centre for Cooperation with Industry (CSI), established in 2012 at the University of Primorska's UP IAM, aims to strengthen research and development collaboration with industry, promote knowledge transfer, and manage intellectual property issues. Functioning as a liaison unit within UP IAM, the CSI facilitates long-term partnerships between the university and businesses by fostering interdisciplinary projects and ensuring clear, cohesive engagement with industry partners. Led by Dr. Boris Horvat, the center supports joint initiatives that bridge academic expertise with practical applications, enhancing technological development and fostering sustainable collaboration.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/scholarships/other-scholarships](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/scholarships/other-scholarships)

#  Other scholarship schemes 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/study-scholarships/other-scholarships/screen-shot-2014-02-11-at-09.04.57.png:resizebox?1100x624)

Other scholarship opportunities exist for foreign nationals who would like to study in Slovenia: 
  * [ Scholarships for citizens of Ukraine for study in the Republic of Slovenia based on development agreements ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/calls-for-applications-and-news/front-page/call-for-application/n/scholarships-for-citizens-of-ukraine-for-study-in-the-republic-of-slovenia-based-on-development-agre/)
  * [ Scholarships for nationals of Palestine for study in the Republic of Slovenia based on development agreements ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/calls-for-applications-and-news/front-page/call-for-application/n/scholarships-for-nationals-of-palestine-for-study-in-the-republic-of-slovenia-based-on-development-a/)
  * [ Scholarships for nationals of Georgia for study in the Republic of Slovenia based on development agreements ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/calls-for-applications-and-news/front-page/call-for-application/n/scholarships-for-citizens-of-georgia-for-study-in-the-republic-of-slovenia-based-on-development-agre/)

[ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/study-scholarships/other-scholarships/sklad-kadrisekundarnaizvedba2.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/)

[ Slovene Human Resources and Development Fund ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/) is the main body in Slovenia managing scholarship funds. Monitor their website regularly and stay up to date on scholarship possibilities. [ Visit their website here ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/en/) . 

​Also monitor the news from the Slovene embassy  closest  to your town for any alternative scholarships based on bilateral agreements. The list of representations abroad is published on the [ website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs ](http://www.mzz.gov.si/en/representations_abroad/) .
summary: The document outlines additional scholarship opportunities for foreign nationals seeking to study in Slovenia, specifically for citizens of Ukraine, Palestine, and Georgia, funded through development agreements. It highlights the Slovene Human Resources and Development Fund (Sklad kadri) as the primary authority managing these scholarships, urging regular monitoring of its website for updates. Additionally, it advises checking news from the nearest Slovene embassy for bilateral agreement-based scholarships and provides a link to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs' list of overseas representations.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/partners](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/partners)

#  Become our partner 

We invite you to become our partner! You can donate each month or a few times in a year. 

You can open a standing order at your bank, where you authorise your bank to transfer the money from your bank account to our bank account monthly or otherwise specified. You can cancel the standing order at any time by notifying your bank. You can open a standing order from your on-line bank as well. 

If you will open a standing order, you will need the following information from us: 
  * address: University of Primorska, Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies, Glagoljaska 8, 6000 Koper 
  * Transaction number: SI56011006000023788 (opened at Uprava RS za javna placila) 

Please decide what you are donating for and state the corresponding payment purpose and reference: 
  * If you would like to support our endeavours for further faculty’s internationalisation, please state:   
Purpose of payment: DONATION – INTERNATIONALISATION   
Reference: **1-2015**
  * If you would like to support other faculty’s development and promotion activities (development of new study programmes, purchasing of equipment for lecture rooms and laboratories, promotion of the faculty, etc.), please state:   
Purpose of payment: **DONATION – GENERAL**   
Reference: **2-2015**

The faculty will publish a list of donors. As we have to receive consent from you before we can publish your name on the list, please also fill in the STATEMENT and send it to our address (it’s written in the statement). 

We thank you for your support!
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies at the University of Primorska invites partners to support its initiatives through monthly or annual donations via standing orders or one-time payments. Donors must provide specific banking details, including the address (Glagoljaska 8, 6000 Koper) and transaction number SI56011006000023788, along with designated payment purposes (e.g., "DONATION – INTERNATIONALISATION" with reference 1-2015 or "DONATION – GENERAL" with reference 2-2015). The faculty will publish donor names upon consent, requiring a signed statement, and thanks donors for their support.

#  Study programmes 

####  Že vključeno: Education - Programmes in English 

##  ~~Invigorate your mind and join our modern study programmes!~~

~~ Mathematics  is the only universal language of interpersonal communication which exists everywhere in the world at all levels of education. It is the foundation of all science and an indispensable tool in the social sicences and economics. ~~

~~In addition, as the theoretical core of computer science, its influence is growing in all areas of life that will decisively mark the 21st Century.~~

###  ~~NEW!**Read more about the study programmes which are taught completely in English:** ~~
  * ~~[ ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/international-students/flipbook.png:resizebox?200x264) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/files/files/mathematics/) [ Mathematics (undergraduate) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first) ~~
  * ~~[ Computer Science (undergraduate) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/cs-first/) ~~
  * ~~[ Bioinformatics (undergraduate) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/bf-first/) ~~
  * ~~[ Mathematical Sciences (master's) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/education/master/mathematical-sciences) ~~
  * ~~[ Data Science (master's) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/data-science) ~~
  * ~~[ Sustainable Built Environments (master's) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/built-environment) ~~
  * ~~[ Mathematical Sciences (doctoral) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences) ~~
  * ~~[ Computer Science (doctoral) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science/) ~~

~~[ ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/study-programmes/innorennew-logo-siv.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/built-environment) ~~

~~![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//puscici.png:resizebox?2000x2000) [ InnoRenew CoE ](https://innorenew.eu/) offers **five scholarships** for the MSc programme **[ Sustainable Built Environments ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/built-environment) ** . These scholarships will offer financial assistance for the degree programme, but will also integrate successful applicants into a vibrant, international, research institute providing many research opportunities. Send us your [ PRE-APPLICATION ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/cooperation/programmes-english/study-programmes/pre-applicationform19-20-msc-sbe.docx) ! ~~
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska offers a range of study programs taught entirely in English, including undergraduate degrees in Mathematics, Computer Science, and Bioinformatics, as well as master’s programs in Mathematical Sciences, Data Science, Sustainable Built Environments, and doctoral programs in Mathematics and Computer Science. The Sustainable Built Environments master’s program includes five scholarships funded by the InnoRenew CoE, providing financial support and research opportunities within an international, research-driven environment.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers)

#  Faculty Centers 

There are three centers at the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies, established to ensure the development of scientific research, provide know-how, and strengthen cooperation with the public. 
  * ###  [ Center for Cryptography  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers/c-cryptography)
  * ###  [ Positive Psychology Center  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers/c-positive-psychology)
  * ###  [ HICUP Lab Center  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers/hicup-lab-en)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/fakultetni-centri/centri-fakultete.png:resizebox?1200x848)
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies operates three centers dedicated to advancing scientific research, providing specialized expertise, and fostering collaboration with the public: the Center for Cryptography, the Positive Psychology Center, and the HICUP Lab Center. These institutions aim to drive innovation and strengthen academic-industry partnerships through focused research and knowledge transfer.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/scholarships/scholarship-western-balkan](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/scholarships/scholarship-western-balkan)

#  Study scholarships for nationals of Western Balkan states 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/study-scholarships/scholarship-western-balkan/06kippravicenapretorskipalacicrw5012orig.jpg:resizebox?1100x734)

Slovene Human Resources Development and Scholarship Fund publishes an open call for nationals of Western Balkan states, who plan to study in Slovenia. 

Scholarships are available  for postgraduate studies (master and doctoral)  ,  and  all programmes offered by UP FAMNIT  fall under the eligible categories. 

Citizens of the following countries are eligible to apply: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Republic of Montenegro, Republic of Kosovo, Republic of Macedonia and Republic of Serbia. 

Successful candidates will recieve 8,400 EUR for a study year (ie. 700 EUR / month). 

The Open Call for the Academic Year 2020/2021 will not be published. 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/study-scholarships/scholarship-western-balkan/javni-stipendijski-razvojni.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)
summary: The Slovene Human Resources Development and Scholarship Fund offers study scholarships for nationals of Western Balkan states (Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Kosovo, North Macedonia, and Serbia) pursuing postgraduate studies (master’s or doctoral) at UP FAMNIT in Slovenia. Recipients receive 8,400 EUR annually (700 EUR/month) for a study year, with the 2020/2021 open call not being published.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/contact](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/contact)

#  Contact 
  * ####  _International Office_

The International Office offers information and guidance to students and visiting professors and researchers. They are also in charge of establishing new bilateral agreements with foreign institutions. 

The International Office can be found on the 2nd floor of the FAMNIT building (Glagoljaška 8, 6000 Koper). 

Phone: +386 5 611 76 72   
Email address: [ international@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:international@famnit.upr.si?subject=FROM%20THE%20WEB%3A%20)   
Skype username: Famnit-international 
  * ####  _Research and Development Office_

The Research and Development Office coordinates research programs and projects. 

The Research and Development Office can be found on the ground floor of the IAM building (Muzejski square 2, 6000 Koper). 

Email address: [ projektna@iam.upr.si ](http://projektna@iam.upr.si)

_ Address:  _   
University of Primorska    
Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies    
Glagoljaška 8    
SI-6000 Koper    
Slovenia
summary: The document provides contact details for two key offices at the University of Primorska's Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT) in Koper, Slovenia. The International Office, located on the 2nd floor of the FAMNIT building (Glagoljaška 8), supports students, visiting professors, and researchers, and manages bilateral agreements, with contact via phone (+386 5 611 76 72), email (international@famnit.upr.si), or Skype (Famnit-international). The Research and Development Office, situated on the ground floor of the IAM building (Muzejski square 2), coordinates research programs and projects, reachable via email (projektna@iam.upr.si). The main university address is Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research)

#  Research 

Researchers at the Faculty [ work as part of the  UP FAMNIT Research Group  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/research-group) . Concurrently, the Faculty has established close cooperation in the field of research with the University of Primorska, Andrej Marušič Institute ( [ UP IAM  ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ), where most of the UP FAMNIT academic staff conduct their research. Some professors also conduct research as part of the Institute of Mathematics, Physics and Mechanics ( [ IMFM  ](http://www.imfm.si/) ). 

Research collaboration with UP IAM is highly developed. The members have concluded a Memorandum on mutual cooperation in areas of common interest, on the basis of which the majority of programmes, fundamental, applied and other scientific research projects are carried out at UP IAM. 

Researchers study the fields of **mathematics, computer science,** **natural science, and psychology.** More information on the fields of research is available [ here  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/research-group) . 

We like to emphasise that the UP FAMNIT research group **is one of the four leading research groups in the field of algebraic graph theory in the world.** The other three groups are located in China, Australia and South Korea. These efforts by the Faculty have helped place the University of Primorska as an internationally recognised research institution. 

The Faculty organises and co-organises [ conferences and other scientific meetings,  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/conferences) and encourages the active participation of teachers and colleagues at international conferences, and international integration in general. The Faculty in particular encourages research collaborations with foreign experts, short [ visits from abroad  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/visiting-professors/) to enhance the educational and research process of the Faculty, and sending staff on visits to prestigious foreign universities, placing young colleagues at the forefront of this effort. 

In collaboration with the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia ( [ DMFA  ](http://www.dmfa.si/) ) and the Institute of Mathematics, Physics and Mechanics in Ljubljana ( [ IMFM  ](http://www.imfm.si/) ), UP FAMNIT publishes an international mathematical journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea ( [ AMC ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/amc) ). In 2011, the journal achieved remarkable success when it was listed on the SCI, which is also a great success on the broader national scale.
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) collaborates closely with the University of Primorska’s Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Institute of Mathematics, Physics, and Mechanics (IMFM), conducting research in mathematics, computer science, natural sciences, and psychology. It is recognized as one of the four leading global research groups in algebraic graph theory, alongside institutions in China, Australia, and South Korea. The faculty actively engages in international conferences, fosters collaborations with foreign experts, and hosts visiting professors to enhance research and education. It also publishes the international journal *Ars Mathematica Contemporanea* (AMC), which gained recognition in 2011 by being listed in the SCI database, highlighting its national and international impact.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff)

#  Mobility for staff 

Sharing expertise and knowledge, exchanging novel ideas, and cooperating to strengthen bonds between academics worldwide, UP FAMNIT supports the internationalization and networking of professors and researchers.  More than 70 professors and researchers visit our faculty annually  , while several hundred also attend our events.   
We are involved in numerous bilateral projects, both individually and in cooperation with the University of Primorska Institute Andrej Marušič  (  [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ). 

At UP FAMNIT, international mobility is enabled through the ERASMUS + exchange programs, CEEPUS programme, the Slovenian EEA and NFM Scholarship Fund program, and individual bilateral agreements. 

[ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/outgoing2.png:resizebox?1000x482) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff) [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/incoming2.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff)

Additionally, we organise or co-organise [ successful international conferences ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/conferences/) , some of which have become traditional.   
Students, professors, and researchers participate in international scientific conferences, meetings and summer schools in their fields worldwide. They frequently attend events as invited speakers and give lectures to students at international universities.
summary: UP FAMNIT fosters international collaboration and knowledge exchange by supporting over 70 professors and researchers annually through programs like ERASMUS +, CEEPUS, and bilateral agreements, alongside partnerships with the University of Primorska’s UP IAM. The institution hosts and co-organizes international conferences, while staff and students actively engage in global academic events, often as invited speakers, to strengthen international ties and research networks.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/adam](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/adam)

#  The Art of Discrete and Applied Mathematics (ADAM) 

UP FAMNIT and [ S ](http://www.sdams.si/sl/o-sdams) [ lovenian Discrete and Applied Mathematics Society ](http://www.sdams.si/sl/o-sdams) publish the international mathematical journal  [ The Art of Discrete and Applied Mathematics (ADAM) ](https://adam-journal.eu/index.php/ADAM/index) . 

**The journal is platinum open access, a purely electronic journal that** publishes high-quality articles in contemporary mathematics that arise from the discrete and concrete mathematics paradigm. 

The journal is published once a year in English, with abstracts in Slovene. It favours themes from discrete and applied mathematics and welcomes original, interesting and important results in the form of articles and notes, preferably not exceeding 15 pages, as well as longer survey papers. 

Papers covering single topics such as graph theory, combinatorics, algorithmic graph theory, combinatorial optimization, and chemical graph theory that are not preferred by its sister journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea (AMC) are most welcome here. 

The papers are peer-reviewed by international experts and all published articles are under the CC copyright protection. 

The journal is published by the editorial board led by Editors in Chief [ prof. Dragan Marušič ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.marusic/) [ , PhD ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/staff/dragan.marusic/) and [ prof. Tomaž Pisanski ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/pisanski/) [ , PhD ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/staff/pisanski/) . 

The journal ADAM is available in open source on the  [ journal's website ](https://adam-journal.eu/index.php/ADAM/index) .
summary: The Art of Discrete and Applied Mathematics (ADAM) is an international, platinum open-access electronic journal published annually by UP FAMNIT and the Slovenian Discrete and Applied Mathematics Society, featuring high-quality research in discrete and applied mathematics. It publishes original articles, notes, and survey papers (up to 15 pages) in areas like graph theory, combinatorics, and algorithmic mathematics, prioritizing topics not covered by its sister journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea. All content is peer-reviewed, freely accessible under a Creative Commons license, and available on its website, edited by Prof. Dragan Marušič and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility) # UP FAMNIT, THE FACULTY THAT BREATHES INTERNATIONALLY! ## International cooperation and mobility of professors, students and researchers is one of the basic policies of our faculty. 24 % of our students and 10 % of professors and researchers at UP FAMNIT are from abroad. We promote mobility within existing schemes (Erasmus+, CEEPUS) and within bilateral agreements on different levels (national, university, faculty), as well as possibilities outside formal programmes, in individual arrangements. Our professors have established numerous contacts with [ professors and researchers from prestigious foreign universities, who visit us regularly ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/visiting-professors/) [ . ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/) We cooperate with visitors coming from neighboring countries and with those from more distant locations: ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/incoming2.png:resizebox?700x338) ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/outgoing2.png:resizebox?2000x2000) More than 70 professors and researchers visit our faculty annually , while several hundred also attend our events. We are involved in numerous bilateral projects, both individually and in cooperation with the University of Primorska, Institute Andrej Marušič ( [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ). Additionally, we organise or co-organise [ successful international conferences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/conferences) , some of which have become traditional. Students, professors and researchers participate in international scientific conferences, meetings and summer schools in their fields worldwide. They frequently attend events as invited speakers, and give lectures to students at international universities. Our students regularly participate in international competitions in their fields.
Our cooperation with institutions from the US is especially strong; please read our latest report .
summary: UP FAMNIT prioritizes international collaboration and mobility, with 24% of students and 10% of professors/researchers from abroad. The faculty actively engages in Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements, and individual arrangements, fostering partnerships with global institutions and hosting over 70 visiting professors annually. Collaborations include the University of Primorska, UP IAM, and strong ties with U.S. institutions, while students and researchers participate in international conferences, competitions, and academic exchanges, enhancing global academic and professional networks.

#  Contact 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/contact/shutterstock293396714.jpg:resizebox?800x534)
  * ###  FAMNIT International Office 

The Office for International and Interuniversity Cooperation provides information to students, professors, researchers, and administrative staff and offers support with applications, preparation, and implementation of incoming and outgoing mobilities. It coordinates Erasmus+ and other exchange programs and oversees procedures for concluding bilateral agreements with Slovenian and foreign universities. 

The International Office is located on the 2nd floor of the FAMNIT building. 

####  Email:  international@famnit.upr.si 

**Address:**   
University of Primorska   
Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies   
Glagoljaška 8   
SI-6000 Koper   
Slovenia 

**Contact Person:** Tanja Labus   
**Phone:** +386 5 61 17 675   
**Viber, WhatsApp, Telegram:** +386 51 412 630 

**Contact Person:** Ira Mešiček   
**Phone:** +386 5 61 17 594 
* * *

*** 
  * ###  FAMNIT Committee for International Mobility 

[ Session Calendar 2024/25 ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/contact/sklepkoledar-sej-kmm2023-24-2.pdf)

*** 
  * ###  FAMNIT Student Services 

The Student Services offer information and further guidance to  degree-seeking students  who are interested in enrolment at UP FAMNIT.   
The Student Services can be found next to the main entrance of the FAMNIT building (Glagoljaška 8, 6000 Koper). 

Phone: +386 5 611 75 75   
E-mail address: [ referat@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si%20)
summary: The FAMNIT International Office, located on the 2nd floor of the FAMNIT building in Koper, Slovenia, supports students, staff, and researchers with mobility programs like Erasmus+ and bilateral agreements, offering guidance on applications and coordination. Contact details include Tanja Labus (+386 5 61 17 675) and Ira Mešiček (+386 5 61 17 594), along with email international@famnit.upr.si. The FAMNIT Committee for International Mobility oversees session schedules, while Student Services, situated near the main entrance, assist degree-seeking students with enrollment inquiries via phone (+386 5 611 75 75) and email (referat@famnit.upr.si).

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students)

#  Mobility for students 

Students who want to gain valuable international experience, broaden their intellectual horizons, perfect foreign languages, learn about new cultures and make new friendships during their studies can take advantage of the opportunities offered by student mobility programs. 

At UP FAMNIT, international student mobility is enabled through the ERASMUS + exchange programs, CEEPUS programme, the Slovenian EEA and NFM Scholarship Fund program and individual bilateral agreements. 

[ INFORMATION FOR STUDENTS GOING ABROAD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si//en/mobility/students/outgoing)

[ INFORMATION FOR STUDENTS COMING TO UP FAMNIT ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming)

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/exchange/erasmus-students-outgoing/shutterstock339199217.jpg:resizebox?1100x666)

## 

##
summary: UP FAMNIT offers student mobility programs through ERASMUS +, CEEPUS, the Slovenian EEA and NFM Scholarship Fund, and bilateral agreements, enabling students to gain international experience, enhance language skills, explore new cultures, and build global networks. These initiatives support both outgoing and incoming students, fostering academic and personal growth through cross-border educational exchanges.

chunk:
Document location: [https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/travel](https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/travel) # Travel Info For questions about travel, please contact: * U.S students: Scott Heppell ( [ mail ](mailto:Scott.Heppell@oregonstate.edu?subject=isMCS) ) * Other students: Aleš Oven ( [ mail ](mailto:international@famnit.upr.si?subject=isMCS) ) **Please note that the School ends on the Island of Lošinj (Croatia) and you should plan your trip home from the city of Mali Lošinj!** ### How to get to Koper #### By Airplane There are a few airports in the vicinity of Koper, which provide good connections to Europe and beyond. Trieste (Italy), Venice (Italy), Pula (Croatia) and Ljubljana (Slovenia) airports are all relatively close by, while low-cost airlines operate on three of them (Trieste, Venice Treviso and Pula). A well organized shuttle service [ _GoOpti_ ](https://www.goopti.com/en/) operates between Koper and all airports, providing the most economic and time efficient transportation.
International Airports Distance from Koper
Trieste, Italy (airport Ronchi dei Legionari ) 65 km
Pula, Croatia (airport Pula ) 95 km
Ljubljana, Slovenia (airport Brnik ) 130 km
Venice, Italy (airport Marco Polo ) 190 km
#### By bus Koper has a central bus station and is well connected with numerous cities in Europe. You may inquire in your travel agencies on the best way to get there. Depending on your origin, if you are unable to find direct fares to Koper, you may travel through bus stations in Ljubljana (Slovenia), Trieste (Italy), or bus stations in the cities of Rijeka and Pula in Croatia. Information on bus connections may be found on the following links: If you are arriving from: * [ Ljubljana, Slovenija ](http://www.ap-ljubljana.si/en/) * [ Pula or Rijeka, Croatia ](http://voznired.akz.hr/VozniRed.aspx?lang=en) * [ Trieste, Italy ](http://arriva.si/en/naslovna/aktualni-vozni-redi-ceniki/arriva-vozni-redi/mednarodni-promet/piran-izola-trst/) A low-cost [ FLIXBUS ](https://www.flixbus.com/) also serves Koper and neighbouring towns. #### By train Koper has a [ railway station ](http://www.slo-zeleznice.si/en/) , and nearby city of Trieste (Italy) has a major train station. The Trieste station has direct connections to Venice, Vienna, and other locations. All information regarding train transfers and timetables are available _[ here ](http://reiseauskunft.bahn.de/bin/query.exe/en?/newrequest=yes) . _ #### Local transport Everything in Koper should be within easy walking distance of where you stay. For local transport city busses are available. For field trips charter bus will be provided. ### How to depart from Mali Lošinj **Please note that the School ends on the Island of Lošinj (Croatia) and you should plan your trip home from the city of Mali Lošinj!** #### By bus The primary means of transport from Lošinj to the mainland is bus. The bus will take you to Rijeka and Zagreb (Croatia) or Trieste (Italy), and from there you can plan your trip further. Mali Lošinj has everyday direct bus lines to Rijeka and Zagreb. Information regarding bus timetable is available [ _here_ ](https://www.autotrans.hr/en-us/home) . You can book the tickets in the [ tourist office of the Lošinj Island ](http://www.island-losinj.com/transport/bus/) . After the School will finish, our isMCS bus will return to Koper (Slovenia), so you can come back to Koper with us, and plan your trip back home from Koper. #### By airplane Mali Lošinj has a small charter airport. Should you decide to take a scenic ride along the Adriatic coast to any major airport (Zagreb, Pula, Trieste), you may check available flights and plane ticket prices [ _here_ . ](https://www.airportmalilosinj.hr/)
summary: The document provides travel guidance for reaching Koper, Slovenia, and departing from Mali Lošinj, Croatia, where the school concludes. For travel inquiries, U.S. students should contact Scott Heppell and others Aleš Oven. To reach Koper, options include flights from nearby airports (Trieste, Venice, Pula, Ljubljana) via the GoOpti shuttle, buses from major European cities via Ljubljana, Trieste, or Rijeka, and trains from Trieste with connections to Venice, Vienna, and beyond. Local transport in Koper is walkable, with buses and charter buses for field trips. Departing Mali Lošinj requires buses to Rijeka, Zagreb, or Trieste, with a direct isMCS shuttle back to Koper post-school, or flights from Lošinj’s small airport to major hubs like Zagreb, Pula, or Trieste. Students are advised to plan departures from Mali Lošinj, not the island itself.

#  Accomodation 

Below are given some suggestions for accommodation in Koper. 

An extensive list of other possible accommodations in Koper can be found here: [ https://visitkoper.si/en/accommodation/ ](https://visitkoper.si/en/accommodation/)

All prices prices are subject to availability, so please try to book the rooms in time. The MATCOS organisers do not take responsibility for rates, payments, conditions and/or room availability. 

###  Grand Koper Hotel**** 

Grand Koper is a newly renovated hotel in the Koper city centre. It offers an attractive modern design, top culinary experience in hotel restaurants and rooms with seaside view.   
T +386 (0)5 61 00 500   
E [ hotel@grandkoper.com ](mailto:hotel@grandkoper.com%20)   
[ www.grandkoper.com/ ](http://www.grandkoper.com/)

###  Vodišek Hotel*** 

This is a family-run hotel, situated in the business part of Koper, near the sports hall and the stadium. The hotel offers a safe and delightful temporary abode for your stay during business trips, holidays or sports events.   
T + 386 5 639 24 68   
E [ info@hotel-vodisek.com ](mailto:info@hotel-vodisek.com%20)   
[ https://www.hotel-vodisek.com/web/en/home/ ](https://www.hotel-vodisek.com/web/en/home/)

###  Hotel Bio*** 

Bio Hotel Koper boasts a long tradition of quality service, competitive prices, and satisfied guests. Their warm, welcoming atmosphere is complemented by attentive, friendly, and professional staff, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable stay.   
T +386 5 625 88 84   
E [ info@hotel-bio.com ](mailto:info@hotel-bio.com)   
[ https://hotel-bio.com/en ](https://hotel-bio.com/en)

###  Hostel Villa Domus 

Hostel Villa Domus offers air-conditioned accommodation in Koper, just 450 m from the city centre and 1 km from the nearest beach. Guests can enjoy the on-site restaurant. Free WiFi is provided in all areas.   
T +386 (0)30 468 777   
E [ hostel@villa-domus.si ](mailto:hostel@villa-domus.si)   
[ https://www.villa-domus.si/eng/hostel ](https://www.villa-domus.si/eng/hostel)

###  Hostel Museum 

Located right in the centre of Koper, directly next to UP FAMNIT and 150 m from a pebbly and stone-paved beach, Hostel Museum offers a garden with a terrace and free-to-use barbecue facilities. An on-site bar features a personal computer that guests can use for free. Free Wi-Fi access is available.   
T +386 (0)41 504 466   
E [ hostel.museum@gmail.com ](mailto:hostel.museum@gmail.com%20)   
[ hostel-museum.com/ ](http://hostel-museum.com/)
summary: The document provides accommodation suggestions for Koper, including hotels and hostels like the Grand Koper Hotel (modern design, seaside views), Vodišek Hotel (family-run, near sports facilities), Hotel Bio (budget-friendly with friendly staff), Hostel Villa Domus (air-conditioned, close to the beach), and Hostel Museum (central location with garden and free amenities). Prices are subject to availability, and organizers emphasize that they are not responsible for booking details or room availability, directing users to an external link for additional options.
