chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Study-famnit](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Study-famnit)

#  Study at UP FAMNIT 

##  WELCOME TO UP FAMNIT! 

**Our programmes are open to all.**

Currently, **more than a third of our students come from abroad** . Combined with exchange students, more than 15% international staff and more than 100 visiting professors and researchers annually, you will have a chance to truly feel the international beat of UP FAMNIT. [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/about-faculty/welcomefamnit.jpg:resizebox?388x388) ](http://www.hippocampus.si/ISBN/978-961-7023-07-7/index.html)

Click on the brochure on the right and discover what is going on in our Departments.   
For more detailed information about the Faculty click [ here ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty) or check out [ Quick facts about the Faculty ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2024-2025) . 

For questions about the Slovenian Educational System continue reading our [ General Information ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information) . 

Whether you are coming to visit us for an exchange or for full studies, you will be able to find answers to majority of your questions on the following webpage: [ http://welcome.upr.si/en/ ](http://welcome.famnit.upr.si/en/)

[ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/general-information/for-students/welcom.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://welcome.upr.si/en/)

##
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska (UP) offers internationally diverse programs, with over a third of its students and more than 15% international staff hailing from abroad, alongside visiting professors and researchers. Prospective students can explore departmental activities, faculty details, and Slovenian education system information through provided links, while a dedicated welcome page addresses questions for both exchange and full-time students, emphasizing the faculty’s global and academic support network.

chunk:
Document location: [https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/accomodation](https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/accomodation)

#  Accommodation 

Students are responsible for the costs of their accommodations. We are working to arrange facilities at subsidized rates in the area surrounding the school location in Izola. Please check back later for more information. 

For information regarding accommodation please contact Mr. Aleš Oven ( [ ales.oven@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:ales.oven@famnit.upr.si) ). 

You are of course welcome to make arrangements for your own accommodations. If you do so, we encourage you to find a place close to Koper center.  Slovenian coast offers a variety of accommodation possibilities  . With over  113,000 beds  you can  choose anything from a hostel room starting at € 17 to a room in a luxurious Kempinski Palace Portorož hotel for € 250  . 

If you prefer to stay in a **privately owned house** , pension and apartment owners offer studios and larger apartments starting at € 60. 

More information regarding accomodation can be found on the following links: 
  * [ Izola Youth hostels ](http://www.izola.eu/index.php?page=static&item=85&tree_root=4)
  * [ Koper Youth hostels ](http://www.koper.si/index.php?page=namestitev&item=237)
  * Student dormitory [ Villa Domus ](http://www.villa-domus.si/eng/student-house) in Koper 
  * Accommodation offers: [ Hostelworld ](http://www.hostelworld.com/) , [ booking.com ](http://booking.com)
  * Local tourist websites: [ Koper ](http://www.koper.si/index.php?page=minihome&item=4) , [ Izola ](http://www.izola.eu/)
  * Student housing by the University of Primorska: [ sd.upr.si ](http://sd.upr.si)
summary: Students are responsible for their accommodation costs, with the school arranging subsidized options near Izola, though details are pending. For inquiries, contact Mr. Aleš Oven. Alternatively, students may arrange their own stays, preferably near Koper center, where accommodations range from budget hostels (€17) to luxury hotels (€250) and private rentals starting at €60. Additional options include youth hostels, a student dormitory in Koper, and booking platforms like Hostelworld and Booking.com, along with local tourist resources.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses)

#  Courses offered to exchange students - 2024/25 

[ Introduction & How to choose ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses#heading0) [ List of courses offered to mobile students in 2024/25 ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses#heading1) [ Courses offered in other faculties - 2024/25 ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses#heading2)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/incoming/courses/group-multiracial-teenagers.jpg:resizebox?1200x686)

##  Introduction & How to choose 

Exchange students can choose among all subjects offered in English. 

Additionally, some professors offer the possibility for exchange students to attend their classes even when they are organized in Slovene. In this case, you will be expected to do more individual work, while professors will offer you consultations, where you will be able to discuss your progress. 

In all subjects offered to exchange students, exams are held in English. 

You can choose subjects from different departments of UP FAMNIT and faculties within the University of Primorska, though we recommend you pay attention to the recognition process at your institution. At the least, you should observe the level of studies when selecting the subject, and give special emphasis to thematic overlap. 

##  ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//puscici.png:resizebox?2000x2000) [ List of courses offered to mobile students in 2024/25 ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses#top)

The table indicates the language used for instruction and the specific semester in which each course is available. If the course is conducted in English, there is an opportunity for individual work and consultation in English. 
  * When searching through the list, we highly recommend using the search engine to filter the options according to your study program, level, and the semester of your exchange. 
  * Most courses are offered only in the autumn semester (A) or the summer semester (S), so you can only select courses available in the semester your exchange will take place. 
  * Bachelor-level students can choose either bachelor or master courses (provided they have the required prerequisite knowledge), while master students can only select master courses. 
  * To help you choose your courses appropriately, please review the course content and prerequisites under the "more" section in the rightmost column of the list. 

Academic calendar 

The academic year lasts from 1 October to 30 September. It consists of two semesters: Autumn ( _from October until mid-February_ ) and Spring ( _from mid-February until the beginning of June_ ). Each semester is divided into two academic quarters. There are three main examination periods ( _Winter, Summer, Autumn_ ). 

The academic calendar for academic year 2024/2025 is available [ ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/study-calendar) [ here ](https://www.upr.si/en/study--enrolment/86-academic-calendar/) [ . ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/study-calendar)

##  [ Courses offered in other faculties - 2024/25 ](http://google.com) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses#top)

You can combine your studies here with subjects offered by other faculties of the University of Primorska. The list of courses held in foreign  languages at the University of Primorska can be accessed on the [ University of Primorska webpage here ](https://www.upr.si/en/study--enrolment/mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/) [ . ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/)
summary: Exchange students at UP FAMNIT can enroll in courses offered in English, with some Slovene-taught courses available requiring additional individual work and consultations in English. All exams are conducted in English, and students must align course selection with their academic level (bachelor/master), study program, and semester, as most courses are offered only in autumn (A) or summer (S). The academic year runs from October to September, divided into two semesters with three examination periods (Winter, Summer, Autumn). Students may also access courses from other University of Primorska faculties via the provided webpage, ensuring compatibility with their home institution’s recognition processes.

chunk:
Document location: [https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/useful-information](https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/travel/useful-information) # Useful Information ## Before arrival ### Visas Slovenia and Italy are members of the European Union and are generally open countries, and visas are not necessary for most visitors. Citizens of EU and most neighboring countries can travel to either Slovenija, Croatia or Italy with their official, government issued passport or ID card. Citizens of USA are allowed to enter the Schengen area ( [ including Italy and Slovenija ](https://travel.state.gov/content/passports/en/go/schengen-fact-sheet.html) ) and [ Croatia ](https://travel.state.gov/content/passports/en/country/croatia.html) for a maximum stay of 90 days without a Visa. Countries request only a biometric passport, that has at least three months validity after the last intended date of departure. Certain nationals (see [ here ](http://ec.europa.eu/dgs/home-affairs/what-we-do/policies/borders-and-visas/visa-policy/apply_for_a_visa/docs/visa_lists_en.pdf) ) must hold a valid visa, in addition to a valid government-issued travel document (passport or other ID), in order to enter Slovenia, Italy or Croatia. If in doubt, please check visa requirements for your country on the web of the: * [ Slovenian Ministry of Foreign Affairs ](http://www.mzz.gov.si/en/entry_and_residence/visa_regimes_and_visas/) * [ Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs ](http://vistoperitalia.esteri.it/home/en) * [ Croatian Ministry of Foreign Affairs ](http://www.mvep.hr/en/consular-information/visas/visa-requirements-overview/) **If you need any help regarding visas, please contact UP FAMNIT International office ([ e-mail ](mailto:international@famnit.upr.si?subject=isMCS) ) for assistance. ** ### Safety Information Please note that the organizers **DO NOT** provide participants of the School with any insurance. Therefore, the travel and health insurance should be organized by participants, if needed. Slovenia is generally a safe country with low crime rate. Use common sense and take security precautions and report any incidents to the local police. As always be sure to look out for your own safety. ### Currency Slovenia uses the Euro, while Croatian Kuna (kn) is in use in Croatia. You can exchange foreign currency in any bank, exchange office or tourist office. The exchange rate between Euros and dollars varies but is typically 1 Euro for US$1.05-$1.20. A wide variety of credit cards are accepted in almost all shops, restaurants, hotels or travel agencies. ATM machines are available almost anywhere. The current exchange rate of US$ or Euro to Croatian Kuna can be found [ _here_ ](http://www.xe.com/currencyconverter/) . ### Weather Slovenia usually has warm dry weather in summer, but check the weather before you travel and plan accordingly. Detailed weather forecasts can be found [ here ](https://www.wunderground.com/global/stations/16110.html) . ## During isMCS ### Emergency contacts Students will be provided with the Instructor’s emergency contact information on the first day of class. * **Dial 112 for Emergency services** – urgent medical help, firefighters, veterinary help, and rescue teams * **Dial 113 for Police emergencies** ### Medical There is a full service hospital located in Izola, Slovenia, and various medical clinics and pharmacies in vicinity of all isMCS locations.

Izola Ospedale Generale (Izola General Hospital)
Polje 40, 6310 Isola, Slovenia
Telephone: +386 5 66 063 91
Open 24 hours.

Health centre Mali Lošinj
Priko 69, 51550 Mali Lošinj, Croatia
Telephone.: +385 51 231 824

### Embassy contacts

U.S. Embassy Ljubljana
Prešernova 31
1000 Ljubljana, Slovenia
Telephone: +(386) (1) 200-5595
Emergency: +(386) (1) 200-5556
Email: ACSLjubljana@state.gov
Website: U.S. Embassy Ljubljana

U.S. Embassy Zagreb
Ulica Thomasa Jeffersona 2
10010 Zagreb, Croatia
Telephone: +(385) (1) 661-2200
Emergency: +(385) (1) 661-2400
Email: ZagrebACS@state.gov
Website: U.S. Embassy Zagreb

U.S. Embassy Italy
Lungarno Amerigo Vespucci 38,
50123 Florence, Italy
Telephone: +(39) 055-266-951
Emergency: +(39) 055-266-951
Email: uscitizensflorence@state.gov
Website: U.S. Embassy to the Holy See
summary: The document provides essential travel information for participants attending the isMCS event in Slovenia, Croatia, and Italy, including visa requirements (EU/US citizens generally need no visa for short stays, while others must check specific regulations), safety advice (organizers do not provide insurance; Slovenia is safe but common precautions are recommended), currency details (Euro in Slovenia, Kuna in Croatia, with credit card acceptance), weather considerations (warm summers in Slovenia), emergency contacts (112 for emergencies, 113 for police), medical facilities (hospitals in Izola and Mali Lošinj), and embassy contacts for U.S. citizens in Ljubljana, Zagreb, and Florence.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/accessibility](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/accessibility)

#  Accessibility statement 

This Accessibility Statement applies to the website of the UP Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) and can be found at the following web address: https://www.famnit.upr.si/. 

To meet the accessibility requirements, the system enables the following: 
  * a user-friendly and easy to navigate website; 
  * readability, logical structuring and ease of navigation; 
  * internally and externally hyperlinked content; 
  * responsive design (layout automatically adjusted to screen resolution); 
  * appropriate colour contrast between the text and the background; 
  * predictable website performance; 
  * pages that can be enlarged up to 200%; 
  * possibility to use headings of different levels. 

UP FAMNIT continuously monitors website accessibility and improves individual accessibility features. The https://www.famnit.upr.si/ website is partially compliant with the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act. 

##  Inaccessible content 

Due to a disproportionate burden, some published content may not meet all the accessibility requirements set out in the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act. Examples of such content include: 
- scanned documents in PDF format, 
  * various complex datasheets, 
  * alternative descriptions of uploaded images, 
  * content in formats that require the use of dedicated applications, 
  * some archived materials and content. 

When major changes are made to the system in the future, we will ensure that they are accessible to vulnerable groups as much as possible. 

##  How to contact us 

This website is managed by UP FAMNIT, Glagoljaška ulica 8, Koper. 

Reports of non-compliance, requests for information and content outside the scope of the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act may be sent by email to info@famnit.upr.si. We will respond to your report or request within 8 days of its receipt. If, given the content requested, we are unable to provide an adequate response within this timeframe, we will inform you as soon as a response is provided and state the reasons for the delay in the response. 

If you find that the provisions of the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act are not being complied with, you can report this to the Information Society Inspectors by post or email to gp.ijs@gov.si. 

Ministry of Public Administration   
Public Sector Inspectorate   
Tržaška cesta 21   
1000 Ljubljana   
[ gp.ijs@gov.si ](mailto:gp.ijs@gov.si)   
[ www.ijs.gov.si ](http://www.ijs.gov.si)

The Information Society Inspectors monitor the implementation of Articles 5 to 8 of the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act. 

##  Creation of the accessibility statement 

The accessibility statement was created on 17 April 2023 on the basis of a self-assessment.
summary: The UP FAMNIT website (https://www.famnit.upr.si/) aims to meet accessibility standards by offering a user-friendly, navigable interface with responsive design, readable text, color contrast, scalable content (up to 200%), and logical structuring. While partially compliant with the Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications Act, some content—such as scanned PDFs, complex datasheets, and archived materials—remains inaccessible due to technical limitations. Users can report issues or request information via email (info@famnit.upr.si) or contact the Information Society Inspectors (gp.ijs@gov.si) for non-compliance concerns. The statement, created on April 17, 2023, reflects a self-assessment of the site’s accessibility efforts.

###  [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//arrow-firstpage.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/open-calls) [ ​ Experiences of FAMNIT students ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/Experiences)

###  [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//arrow-firstpage.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/open-calls) [ ​ Relevant documentation for the mobility ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/documents)

###  [ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images//arrow-firstpage.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/open-calls) [ ​ Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/FAQ)
* * *

Students who are interested in gaining valuable international experience, broadening their intellectual horizons, perfecting a foreign language, learning about foreign cultures, and making new friendships during their studies can take advantage of the opportunities offered by international student mobility programs. 

UP FAMNIT facilitates international student mobility through ERASMUS+ exchange programs, which encompass Erasmus+ KA131, Erasmus+ KA171, and Erasmus+ Blended Intensive Programmes (BIP), as well as individual bilateral agreements. The requirement for eligibility in each of these programs is the successful completion of a minimum of the first year of undergraduate study and either full-time or part-time student status. 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/outgoing/erasmushands-world.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

For more information, please contact our international office at  [ international@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:international@famnit.upr.si?subject=Exchange%20-%20Partner%20States) .
summary: UP FAMNIT offers outgoing students opportunities to engage in international mobility programs, including ERASMUS+ initiatives (KA131, KA171, Blended Intensive Programmes) and bilateral agreements, requiring completion of at least the first year of undergraduate study and full-time/part-time enrollment. These programs aim to enhance cultural understanding, language skills, and academic growth through exchanges, with detailed guidance available on open calls, documentation, and FAQs, and further inquiries directed to the international office at international@famnit.upr.si.

#  Other opportunities 
##  UniAdrion 

The University of Primorska is a member of the Association of Universities of the Adriatic-Ionian Region (UniAdrion), which facilitates cooperation between universities and research centers with the aim of strengthening international collaboration and revitalizing culture, science, training, and research in the countries of the Adriatic-Ionian region (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Greece, Croatia, Italy, San Marino, North Macedonia, Serbia, and Slovenia). 

More information about opportunities for international practical training, study visits, and participation in association projects is available on the [ UniAdrion website. ](https://www.uniadrion.net/uniadrion-projects/)
* * *
summary: UP FAMNIT offers students diverse international opportunities for study, internships, and research, including partnerships with UniAdrion for Adriatic-Ionian region collaboration, IAESTE Koper for STEM internships, scholarships from Slovenia’s Public Scholarship Fund for study abroad, the European University Institute (EUI) for advanced degree programs and research fellowships, DAAD scholarships for academic exchange, Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships for postgraduate researchers, UK study programs, and summer schools providing ETCS credits. These initiatives support academic growth, cultural exchange, and professional development through structured programs, funding, and institutional partnerships.

#  Other opportunities 
##  International Association for the Exchange of Students for Technical Experience: IAESTE Koper  [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/opportunities#top)

IAESTE is an international non-governmental and non-profit organization operating under the auspices of UNESCO and the United Nations. It connects local sections in over 100 countries and has been providing students in STEM fields with valuable professional experience through international internships since 1948. 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/outgoing/opportunities/iaestelc-koper.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

In Slovenia, three local committees operate in Koper, Ljubljana, and Maribor. Dedicated volunteers assist students in finding internship opportunities and organize various international events. 

More information and contact details in case of questions are available [ here. ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/students/outgoing/opportunities/prakse.pdf)

Additional information about IAESTE opportunities for students is available on the [ IAESTE website. ](https://iaeste.si/prakse/)
* * *

#  Other opportunities 
##  European University Institute (EUI) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/opportunities#top)

The European University Institute (EUI), located in Florence, Italy, offers exceptional programs for students looking to pursue advanced studies and research. Recognized for its commitment to academic excellence and European integration, the EUI provides a unique international environment for scholars. 

####  Key Opportunities for Students 
  * _**Master’s and PhD Programs** _

EUI offers PhD programs in Law, Economics, History, and Political & Social Sciences. Additionally, the **Master of Research in Economics** program provides in-depth training for students preparing for doctoral studies or careers in economics. 
  * _**Postgraduate Training** _

EUI provides a range of postgraduate training opportunities, including short-term and specialized programs. These courses offer students an excellent way to enhance their skills and knowledge in their respective fields while gaining international exposure. 
  * _**Research Fellowships** _

For aspiring researchers, EUI's fellowship programs offer unparalleled access to an extensive academic network, enabling collaboration with top scholars. The **Max Weber Programme for Postdoctoral Studies** and the **Jean Monnet Fellowships** are some of the most sought-after research opportunities for postdoctoral candidates. 
  * _**Exchange and Study Abroad Programs** _

EUI welcomes students through various exchange programs, including Erasmus and other mobility schemes. These programs allow students to immerse themselves in a multicultural academic environment while contributing to EUI’s diverse research culture. 

####  How to Apply 

Students interested in joining EUI’s vibrant academic community can explore available programs and application guidelines by visiting the official [ EUI website ](https://www.eui.eu/en/public/educational-programmes) . Scholarships and funding options are available to support students from diverse backgrounds. 
* * *

These initiatives support academic growth, cultural exchange, and professional development through structured programs, funding, and institutional partnerships.

##  Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships for Foreign Scholars and Artists  [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/outgoing/opportunities#top)

Each year the Swiss Confederation awards Government Excellence Scholarships to promote international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries.  The Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships are aimed at young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/amc](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/amc)

[ ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/amc)

#  Ars Mathematica Contemporanea (AMC) 

[ ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/gallery/bannerji/arsmat.png:resizebox?296x37) ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc) In collaboration with  [ ](http://sdams.si/sl/) the  [ Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia ](http://www.dmfa.si/) , the [ Institute of Mathematics, Physics and Mechanics in Ljubljana ](http://www.imfm.si/view?set_language=en) and  since 2018 also with the  [ Slovenian Discrete and Applied Mathematics Society, ](http://sdams.si/sl/) UP FAMNIT publishes an international mathematical journal [ _Ars Mathematica Contemporanea_ ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc%29) [ (  ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc%29) [ AMC ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc%29) [ ) ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc%29) . 

Science Citation Index for 2015  placed the journal AMC in the top quarter of scientific journals in the field of mathematics according to the journal's impact factor. The journal ranked 60th among the 312 mathematical journals included in ISI (International Science Index), with an impact factor of 0.985. AMC is the first Slovene journal to place in the top quarter of scientific magazines through its impact factor. 

[ AMC ](http:///research/amc.imfm.si/index.php//research/amc%29) was first included on the list of mathematical journals with an impact factor in 2011 (0.4). As its rankings rose (from 2012 IF 0.667 to 2014 IF 0.742), it was included twice in the third quarter and twice in the second quarter. Constant improvement of the journal's influence also demands an increase in the quality of published articles. To ensure a high standard of articles, the editorial board accepts less than a third of submitted manuscripts; with the latest success, their submission rate increased and acceptance rate further decreased. 

The journal publishes top scientific articles in modern mathematics, especially in the field of discrete mathematics. Articles in the fields of algebra, geometry, topology, theoretical computer sciences and combinatorics can also be found in the journal. 

The online version of the AMC Journal is available through open.source on the [ journal's website ](http:///research/amc-journal.eu/index.php//research/amc) . 

The publication of the journal is co-financed by the Slovenian Research Agency ( [ ARRS ](https://www.arrs.gov.si/en/novo.asp) ).
summary: The international mathematical journal *Ars Mathematica Contemporanea* (AMC), published by UP FAMNIT in collaboration with Slovenian academic institutions since 2018, is recognized for its high-quality research in discrete mathematics and related fields such as algebra, geometry, topology, and theoretical computer science. Ranked 60th among 312 mathematical journals in the 2015 Science Citation Index with an impact factor of 0.985, AMC became the first Slovenian journal to achieve a top-quarter ranking by impact factor. Its influence has grown steadily since 2011, with the editorial board maintaining rigorous standards by accepting less than a third of submissions. The journal is openly accessible online and co-financed by the Slovenian Research Agency (ARRS).

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming)

#  Mobility at UP FAMNIT 

####  Invigorate your mind and join our modern study programmes! 

International cooperation and mobility of professors and researchers are at the heart of the faculty's activities.  41.7% of our students and 22.6% of professors and researchers come from abroad  . Combined with exchange students, everyone who visits UP FAMNIT has a chance to truly feel the international beat. 

###  Applying as an Incoming Exchange Student 

UP FAMNIT dearly welcomes all exchange students who have decided to do a part of their studies with us. 

For all matters related to the exchange at UP FAMNIT, whether they concern the application, details about the university or the local environment, visas and permits as well as practical advice, please visit:   
  * ###  [ WELCOME website ](https://welcome.upr.si/student/)
  * ###  [ C ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/) [ ourses offered to exchange students in the academic year 2024/2 ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses) [ 5 ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/)
  * ###  [ Opportunities for exchange ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/open-calls)
  * ###  [ Academic Calendar 2024/2025 ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/students/incoming/upacademic-calendar2024-25-3.pdf)
  * ###  [ Tutors for International students ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/tutoring-system)
  * ###  [ Experiences of our exchange students ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/experiences)
  * ###  [ About UP FAMNIT ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty)

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/incoming/7b0b15ff-13cb-4a3f-94c7-b2116e75aa8f.jpg:resizebox?1200x676)

The main programme for exchanges at UP FAMNIT is  [ Erasmus+ ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/exchange/erasmus) . However, we also promote  [ bilateral exchange programmes ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/cooperation/exchange/bilateral-scholarships) ,  [ CEEPUS mobility ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/exchange/ceepus) as well as other types of mobility, depending on their availability (e.g. Swiss-European Mobility Programme, EEA/NFM mobility and similar). 

###  Study offer in English 

UP FAMNIT offers a number of courses and subjects in English. We offer [ eight study programmes which are taught completely in English ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/study-programmes) . Most of these courses are also included in the [ ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/) [ list of offered courses to exchange students ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses) [ . ](https://www.upr.si/en/students-up/754-international-mobility/incoming-mobility/study-offer-for-mobile-students/list-of-courses-for-mobility-students/)   
For more detailed information about the Faculty click [ HERE ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty) or check out [ quick facts about the Faculty ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2019-2020) . 

###  Contact 

For any additional questions or information please [ contact our International office ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/contact) .
summary: UP FAMNIT, a faculty with a strong international presence (41.7% of students and 22.6% of staff from abroad), welcomes incoming exchange students through programs like Erasmus+, bilateral agreements, and CEEPUS, offering eight fully English-taught study programs and numerous courses accessible via its mobility portal. Students can find application guidance, academic calendars, tutor support, and student experiences on dedicated resources, with further inquiries directed to the International Office.

chunk:
#  Opportunities for exchange 
##  Erasmus+ for EU Students 

If you come from an EU country and would like to visit us as part of your Erasmus+ exchange, please check with your International Office if your university/faculty has signed an Inter-Institutional Agreement with UP FAMNIT. The Erasmus code of the University of Primorska is _SI KOPER03_ . 

Should you consider to visit us, it might be helpful to take a look at the courses we offer. Exchange students are free to take any course from the [ list of offered courses to exchange students at UP FAMNIT ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/courses) . 

After you have fulfilled all application-related obligations at your university, they will send us a nomination for your exchange and we will contact you with a welcoming e-mail. All exchange students must then apply online to the University of Primorska online application system, which can be reached [ here ](https://vis.upr.si/studij/studexchange/) . When you access the link, you will be guided by the application tool to complete the application procedure and upload all necessary documents needed for your exchange. 

After this step, you will be ready to enjoy your exchange with us! 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/incoming/open-calls/erasmuslogo.png:resizebox?2000x2000)
* * *
* * *
summary: The University of Primorska's Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (FAMNIT) offers exchange opportunities primarily through Erasmus+ for EU students, requiring verification of institutional agreements and application via their online system, alongside non-EU students from specific countries (e.g., Brazil, Albania, China) with limited spots and deadlines (31 July 2026) for long- or short-term mobility. Additionally, bilateral scholarships provide financial support, accommodation, and insurance for selected international students, with open calls available on the CMEPIUS website, while other programs like CEEPUS and bilateral agreements also facilitate mobility.

##  Bilateral Scholarships [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/students/incoming/open-calls#top)

The Slovenian Government announces scholarships for exchanges for foreign students annually. These scholarships are based on signed agreements between the Slovene and foreign government. 

Scholarship usually include a minimum monthly income, free accommodation and basic medical insurance. 

The open calls with all relevant documentation are published on the CMEPIUS webpages [ HERE ](https://eng.cmepius.si/students/bilateral-scholarships/) .

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/gen-math](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/gen-math) # Study field General Mathematics ## Course structure 1 ST YEAR (60 ECTS-credits)
Courses ECTS
Basic Course I 6
Basic Course II 6
Basic Course III 6
Elective Course I – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course II – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course III – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course IV – External Selected 6
Elective Course V – External Selected 6
Seminar I 6
Seminar II 6
2 ND YEAR (60 ECTS-credits)
Courses ECTS
Elective Course VI – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course VII – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course VIII – Internal Selected 6
Elective Course IX – External Selected 6
Seminar III 6
Seminar IV 6
Master’s Thesis 24
## Study obligations The student has to pass: * 3 BASIC courses from the General, Theoretical and Discrete Mathematics Core; * 6 INTERNAL ELECTIVE courses (student's choice) in the amount of 36 ECTS, * 3 EXTERNAL ELECTIVE courses in the amount of 18 ECTS; * 4 SEMINARS; * prepare and defend the MASTER'S THESIS. _External elective courses_ may be chosen from the areas of social sciences, humanities and natural sciences, and from study programmes at other faculties; however, students may also select a course from internal courses as their externally elective course. ## Basic courses for the study field Basic courses for the General, Theoretical and Discrete Mathematics Core ( [ short descriptions of courses ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/rima/09mzopisipredmetovmz-18ang100418.pdf) ): * Selected Topics in Algebra (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Analysis (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Discrete Mathematics (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Functional Analysis (6 ECTS).
summary: The Master’s program in General Mathematics spans two years (120 ECTS credits), structured around core courses in algebra, analysis, discrete mathematics, and functional analysis (totaling 24 ECTS), complemented by 6 internal elective courses (36 ECTS) and 3 external electives (18 ECTS) from diverse fields like social sciences, humanities, or natural sciences. Students must complete four seminars and a 24-ECTS master’s thesis, with flexibility to select internal courses as external electives. The curriculum emphasizes theoretical depth and interdisciplinary breadth.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  General information 

Name of the programme: **Mathematical Sciences**   
Type of programme: Doctoral **, 3rd Bologna cycle**   
**Degree awarded:** “doktor znanosti” equiv. to a Doctoral degree   
Duration: **3 years** (6 semesters)   
ECTS-credits: **180**   
**Programme structure:** 2 electives, individual research work, seminars, doctoral dissertation   
Mode of study: part-time
summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **Doctoral Program in Mathematical Sciences** at **UP FAMNIT** (University of Primorska, Faculty of Information Studies), based on the provided document:

---

### **1. Program Overview**
- **Duration**: 3 years (part-time, part-time with possible full-time options).
- **Structure**:
  - **Year 1**: 2 advanced math courses (12 ECTS each), seminars, and foundational research.
  - **Year 2**: Advanced seminars, dissertation work, and publication requirements.
  - **Year 3**: Final dissertation completion and defense.
- **Focus**: Combines theoretical and applied mathematics, with optional specializations in **Algebra, Analysis, Discrete Math, Financial Math, Cryptography, Computing Methods, and Statistics**.

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**
- **Eligibility**:
  - **Master’s degree** in Mathematics (Bologna-style program).
  - **Equivalent Master’s degree** in related fields (e.g., Computer Science, Information Science, Natural Sciences) **plus** passing **differential exams** in Algebra and Analysis.
- **Transfer Students**:
  - Can enter **Year 2 or 3** if they meet:
    - Admission criteria for the program.
    - Comparable competencies from their previous program.
    - Course structure and requirements alignment.
  - **International applicants** must have their education recognized by the university.

---

### **3. Course Structure**
- **Advanced Mathematical Courses (AMC)**:
  - 12 ECTS per course, with two semesters per topic (e.g., Algebra I & II, Analysis I & II, etc.).
  - **Example Topics**: Algebra, Analysis, Discrete Math, Financial Math, Cryptography, Computing Methods, Statistics.
- **Seminars**:
  - Attend seminars on topics from the **in-depth mathematical content cluster** (2 seminars per year).
  - Present research work to faculty and peers.

---

### **4. Advancement Requirements**
- **Progression to Year 2**:
  - Earn **40 ECTS** in Year 1 and complete all Year 1 obligations.
  - Minimum **30 ECTS** for enrollment in Year 2 if not meeting full requirements.
- **Progression to Year 3**:
  - Complete Year 2 obligations and meet publication requirements (2 SCI-indexed papers).

---

### **5. Competencies Developed**
- **General Competencies**:
  - Analyze, synthesize, and predict mathematical solutions.
  - Critically assess developments in mathematics and its societal impact.
  - Work autonomously in research and integrate new knowledge.
- **Subject-Specific Competencies**:
  - Apply math and computational tools in research.
  - Engage in international mathematical communities.
  - Design problem-solving hierarchies and integrate partial solutions.

---

### **6. Employment Opportunities**
- **Academic/Research Roles**: University projects, scientific institutes, R&D organizations.
- **Industry Roles**: Insurance, banking, financial services, statistical offices, economic analysis.
- **Skills Required**: Rational thinking, in-depth analysis, decision-making in competitive markets.

---

### **7. Tuition and Funding**
- **Tuition Fees**:
  - Annual fees are outlined in the **UP FAMNIT Price List** (link provided).
- **Co-Funding Opportunities**:
  - Available to students meeting criteria from the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.
  - Application details and eligibility criteria are available [here](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).

---

### **8. Key Notes**
- **Application Process**: Check the official website for deadlines, required documents, and application procedures.
- **Transfer Students**: Contact the **Study Committee** for individual transfer evaluations.
- **International Applicants**: Ensure education recognition before enrollment.

---

### **Next Steps for Prospective Students**
1. **Verify Eligibility**: Confirm your Master’s degree meets the program’s requirements.
2. **Contact the Faculty**: Reach out to UP FAMNIT for application guidance, co-funding details, or transfer evaluations.
3. **Review the Price List**: Access tuition fee information for the current academic year.
4. **Prepare for Exams**: If applying from a non-Math background, prepare for differential exams in Algebra and Analysis.

For further details, visit the [UP FAMNIT Doctoral Program page](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences).

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  About the programme [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

[ Welcome to Famnit  ](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dg_ocsS3mrU)

The study programme is primarily intended for prospective researchers, professors and other academic staff. Each student has a supervisor, who is ordinarily selected before the student’s enrolment. One of the key roles of the supervisor is to present a relevant open problem (or open problems) to the student. While the student is trying to solve the problem (or problems), the supervisor helps, informs the student of similar problems already solved and introduces appropriate techniques from relevant mathematical fields. The solution to these open problems and its publication in the relevant international journals must be a primary goal of each student. 

In the first year, there are two elective courses - Advanced Mathematical Course I and Advanced Mathematical Course II. Their purpose is to acquaint students with topics with which they did not become familiar during lower-level studies, but which are indispensable for research in their field. Courses are often suggested by the supervisor and are usually individual to the student. Students regularly present their current research work at research seminars. 

**The aim of the programme is to encourage students to do the research, and not to burden them with course exams that are not directly related to their research area** (the latter is probably a special feature among Slovenian universities). Faculty members are aware of the fact that nowadays Ph.D. students must have some research results immediately after finishing their studies if they want to stay in academia – whether that be abroad or at home. 

During their studies, Ph.D. students usually attend various international conferences and conduct research visits, where they present their research results. Often they are involved in the organization of the conferences, summer schools, etc., organized by the Faculty or [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) , which is directly connected with the faculty. To a lesser extent, students are also involved in teaching students at lower levels. 

Educational and professional goals 
  * After (or during) the study programme, the student is capable of independent, internationally competitive research work. 
  * The student publishes articles in reputable international journals listed on the Science Citation Index Expanded. This is also a prerequisite for a successful dissertation defence. 
  * The student knows his/her research area thoroughly, having the latest information on open problems or the problems that have already been solved. 
  * During the study programme, the student becomes familiar with the career of a researcher (active participation in international conferences, research visits, etc.).

chunk:
# Mathematical Sciences ## Course structure [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top) The doctoral degree study is provided on an individual basis. The main components of the study programme are the following: * Advanced mathematical courses covering the research topic chosen by the candidate together with the supervisor * Research by the candidate * Seminar presentations * A minimum of two scientific articles in SCI journals * Doctoral dissertation and defence All these activities must add up to 180 ECTS. Advanced Mathematical Courses (AMC I and AMC II) are the basis of the doctoral student’s Individual Research work and introduce the candidate to problems associated with each of the following fields of Mathematics: Analysis, Algebra, Discrete Mathematics, Financial Mathematics, Cryptography, Computing Intensive Methods Applications, and Statistics. Students select a supervisor with research interests similar to their own, who mentors their chosen AMC I or AMC II courses and doctoral dissertation. The choice of courses is usually made in consultation with the student’s supervisor. Similar study programmes, within the field of natural sciences, either inside or outside the university, may also be chosen. The University of Primorska provides one such option within their Information Technologies Doctoral programme. In studying these courses, with the benefit of their supervisor’s input and direction, students acquire the necessary skills to enable them to perform individual research work in any of the above-mentioned fields of Mathematics. Candidates' Individual Research work is shared with their supervisor during their consultations; it is also introduced to teachers, students and others during seminars and concluded by their doctoral dissertation. A doctoral dissertation represents an original contribution to science and, consequently, has to conform to University rules and regulations on doctoral dissertations. The procedure for preparing a doctoral dissertation is regulated by the [ Rules on the preparation and defence of the doctoral dissertation at the University of Primorska ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/doctoral-dissertation/) . As part of their studies, students are required to write a doctoral dissertation, which must represent a new and important contribution to the body of knowledge in the field of mathematics. Prior to the thesis defence (viva voce), their research must be published (or accepted for publication) in international journals in the field of mathematics, in at least two articles in journals from the SCI list. Detailed criteria are established by the Department of Mathematics of UP FAMNIT.

---

### **1. Program Overview**
- **Duration**: 3 years (part-time, part-time with possible full-time options).
- **Structure**:
  - **Year 1**: 2 advanced math courses (12 ECTS each), seminars, and foundational research.
  - **Year 2**: Advanced seminars, dissertation work, and publication requirements.
  - **Year 3**: Final dissertation completion and defense.
- **Focus**: Combines theoretical and applied mathematics, with optional specializations in **Algebra, Analysis, Discrete Math, Financial Math, Cryptography, Computing Methods, and Statistics**.

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**
- **Eligibility**:
  - **Master’s degree** in Mathematics (Bologna-style program).
  - **Equivalent Master’s degree** in related fields (e.g., Computer Science, Information Science, Natural Sciences) **plus** passing **differential exams** in Algebra and Analysis.
- **Transfer Students**:
  - Can enter **Year 2 or 3** if they meet:
    - Admission criteria for the program.
    - Comparable competencies from their previous program.
    - Course structure and requirements alignment.
  - **International applicants** must have their education recognized by the university.

---

### **3. Course Structure**
- **Advanced Mathematical Courses (AMC)**:
  - 12 ECTS per course, with two semesters per topic (e.g., Algebra I & II, Analysis I & II, etc.).
  - **Example Topics**: Algebra, Analysis, Discrete Math, Financial Math, Cryptography, Computing Methods, Statistics.
- **Seminars**:
  - Attend seminars on topics from the **in-depth mathematical content cluster** (2 seminars per year).
  - Present research work to faculty and peers.

---

### **4. Advancement Requirements**
- **Progression to Year 2**:
  - Earn **40 ECTS** in Year 1 and complete all Year 1 obligations.
  - Minimum **30 ECTS** for enrollment in Year 2 if not meeting full requirements.
- **Progression to Year 3**:
  - Complete Year 2 obligations and meet publication requirements (2 SCI-indexed papers).

---

### **5. Competencies Developed**
- **General Competencies**:
  - Analyze, synthesize, and predict mathematical solutions.
  - Critically assess developments in mathematics and its societal impact.
  - Work autonomously in research and integrate new knowledge.
- **Subject-Specific Competencies**:
  - Apply math and computational tools in research.
  - Engage in international mathematical communities.
  - Design problem-solving hierarchies and integrate partial solutions.

---

### **6. Employment Opportunities**
- **Academic/Research Roles**: University projects, scientific institutes, R&D organizations.
- **Industry Roles**: Insurance, banking, financial services, statistical offices, economic analysis.
- **Skills Required**: Rational thinking, in-depth analysis, decision-making in competitive markets.

---

  - Annual fees are outlined in the **UP FAMNIT Price List** (link provided).
- **Co-Funding Opportunities**:
  - Available to students meeting criteria from the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.
  - Application details and eligibility criteria are available [here](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).

---

### **8. Key Notes**
- **Application Process**: Check the official website for deadlines, required documents, and application procedures.
- **Transfer Students**: Contact the **Study Committee** for individual transfer evaluations.
- **International Applicants**: Ensure education recognition before enrollment.

---

### **Next Steps for Prospective Students**
1. **Verify Eligibility**: Confirm your Master’s degree meets the program’s requirements.
2. **Contact the Faculty**: Reach out to UP FAMNIT for application guidance, co-funding details, or transfer evaluations.
3. **Review the Price List**: Access tuition fee information for the current academic year.
4. **Prepare for Exams**: If applying from a non-Math background, prepare for differential exams in Algebra and Analysis.

For further details, visit the [UP FAMNIT Doctoral Program page](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences).

#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Admission requirements [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

Admission to the 1  st  year shall be granted to applicants having: 
  * A Master's degree in Mathematics (“Bologna” study programme); _or_
  * A Master's degree in studies similar to Mathematics (Computer and Information Sciences, Information Science and Mathematics, Natural Sciences) who have met the necessary additional requirements (i.e. passed differential exams in Algebra and Analysis). 

In the case of enrolment limitations, applicants shall be selected on the basis of their performance demonstrated in Master's studies (average grade, Master’s thesis grade). 

Admission may also be gained by an applicant having completed a comparable study abroad. Prior to enrolment the applicant must apply for recognition of completed education.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Continuation of studies according to the transfer criteria [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

Transfers between study programmes are possible on the basis of the Higher Education Act, Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes and in accordance with other regulations of this field. 

The transition between study programmes is the enrolment in the higher year of the study programme, in case of leaving the education at the initial study programme and continuing the study process at another study program of the same degree. The transition takes into account the comparability of the study programmes and the completed study obligations of the candidate in the initial study program. 

Access to year 2 or year 3 of the doctoral degree programme of Mathematical Sciences on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is open to candidates of a related third-cycle doctoral degree programme, provided that the following conditions have been met: 
  * the candidate fulfils the requirements for admission to the study programme of Mathematical Sciences; 
  * completion of the first study programme which the candidate is transferring from ensures the acquisition of comparable competencies as those envisaged by the study programme of Mathematical Sciences; and 
  * other conditions in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes have also been met (a comparable course structure, course requirements completed). 

Entry into Year 2 of the doctoral degree programme of Mathematical Sciences on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is also open to graduates of a related pre-Bologna reform Master’s degree programme. 

Individual applications for transfer shall be considered by the relevant committee of UP FAMNIT. Apart from comparability between both fields of study, the committee shall also consider comparability between the study programmes, in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes. The applicant may also be required to complete differential exams as defined by the relevant Faculty committee. 

Enrolment on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is also open to candidates of a related study programme abroad who have been, in the process of recognition of their studies abroad, legally granted the right to continue their educational training in the study programme of Mathematical Sciences. 

In the case of limited enrolment, applicants shall be selected on the basis of the average grade obtained during the study programme they are transferring from.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Advancement requirements [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

Students may advance to the higher year upon acquiring 40 ECTS-credits in the current study year and to fulfil all the study obligations for the previous study year. The Study Committee of the Faculty may permit a student who has not fulfilled all study obligations for the particular year to enrol in the next year, but a student has to acquire at least 30 ECTS-credits. 

In the 1  st  year, students complete two courses within the cluster of _in-depth mathematical contents_ which they select in consultation with their supervisor. 

The two courses above provide the basis for individual research work (2  nd  and 3  rd  year) on which students are to report to their supervisor. Individual research work is presented at department seminars attended by students, teachers and other interested persons. The contents of the seminars (two each year) relate to the above-mentioned courses from the cluster _in-depth mathematical contents_ . Individual research work is completed through the preparation of the Doctoral dissertation, presenting an authentic contribution to science. 

Prior to the thesis defence (viva voce), the student's research must be published (or accepted for publication) in international journals in the field of mathematics, in at least two articles in journals from the SCI list. Detailed criteria are established by the Department of Mathematics of UP FAMNIT.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Graduates' competencies [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

###  General competencies 
  * The ability to analyze, synthesize and predict solutions and consequences of the factors related to the discipline of mathematics. 
  * The ability to place mathematics into a broader social context. 
  * The ability to critically reflect on social events in general. 
  * The ability to critically assess the developments in the field of mathematics. 
  * The ability to work within a wider social community. 
  * The ability to autonomously search for and acquire professional knowledge and to integrate it with the existing knowledge. 
  * Autonomy in professional and scientific research. 

###  Subject-specific competencies 
  * The ability to apply the mathematical and computer apparatus in concrete research. 
  * The ability to place mathematics into a broader social context. 
  * The ability of autonomous engagement in international mathematical circles. 
  * The ability of in-depth analysis of the development of their area of ​​expertise. 
  * The ability to communicate within a global mathematical science and society. 
  * The ability to design a hierarchy enabling decomposition of a problem into sub problems and engineering of the integration of partial solutions.

#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Graduate employment opportunities [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/#top)

Graduates are equipped for either independent research or other development projects demanding exacting knowledge, at the national or international level, and are also capable of working on university projects, in scientific institutes or in other research and development organisations. The in-depth knowledge acquired in both theoretical and applied mathematics also enables graduates to seek employment outside the academic environment, i.e. in insurance companies, banks, stockbroking agencies, statistical offices, and in economic environments where the need for survival and development in competitive market economies requires people capable of rational thinking, in-depth analysis and substantial decision making skills - in short, mathematicians.

  - **Example Topics**: Algebra, Analysis, Discrete Math, Financial Math, Cryptography, Computing Methods, Statistics.
- **Seminars**:
  - Attend seminars on topics from the **in-depth mathematical content cluster** (2 seminars per year).
  - Present research work to faculty and peers.

---

### **4. Advancement Requirements**
- **Progression to Year 2**:
  - Earn **40 ECTS** in Year 1 and complete all Year 1 obligations.
  - Minimum **30 ECTS** for enrollment in Year 2 if not meeting full requirements.
- **Progression to Year 3**:
  - Complete Year 2 obligations and meet publication requirements (2 SCI-indexed papers).

---

### **5. Competencies Developed**
- **General Competencies**:
  - Analyze, synthesize, and predict mathematical solutions.
  - Critically assess developments in mathematics and its societal impact.
  - Work autonomously in research and integrate new knowledge.
- **Subject-Specific Competencies**:
  - Apply math and computational tools in research.
  - Engage in international mathematical communities.
  - Design problem-solving hierarchies and integrate partial solutions.

---

### **6. Employment Opportunities**
- **Academic/Research Roles**: University projects, scientific institutes, R&D organizations.
- **Industry Roles**: Insurance, banking, financial services, statistical offices, economic analysis.
- **Skills Required**: Rational thinking, in-depth analysis, decision-making in competitive markets.

---

### **7. Tuition and Funding**
- **Tuition Fees**:
  - Annual fees are outlined in the **UP FAMNIT Price List** (link provided).
- **Co-Funding Opportunities**:
  - Available to students meeting criteria from the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.
  - Application details and eligibility criteria are available [here](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).

---

### **8. Key Notes**
- **Application Process**: Check the official website for deadlines, required documents, and application procedures.
- **Transfer Students**: Contact the **Study Committee** for individual transfer evaluations.
- **International Applicants**: Ensure education recognition before enrollment.

---

### **Next Steps for Prospective Students**
1. **Verify Eligibility**: Confirm your Master’s degree meets the program’s requirements.
2. **Contact the Faculty**: Reach out to UP FAMNIT for application guidance, co-funding details, or transfer evaluations.
3. **Review the Price List**: Access tuition fee information for the current academic year.
4. **Prepare for Exams**: If applying from a non-Math background, prepare for differential exams in Algebra and Analysis.

For further details, visit the [UP FAMNIT Doctoral Program page](https://www.famnit.upm.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences).

  - **Year 3**: Final dissertation completion and defense.

- **Transfer Students**:
  - Can enter **Year 2 or 3** if they meet:
    - Admission criteria for the program.
    - Comparable competencies from their previous program.
    - Course structure and requirements alignment.
  - **International applicants** must have their education recognized by the university.

## Study obligations The student has to pass: * 3 BASIC courses from the General, Theoretical or Discrete Mathematics core; * 3 INTERNAL ELECTIVE courses from the Discrete Mathematics core in the amount of 18 ECTS; * 3 INTERNAL ELECTIVE courses (student's choice) in the amount of 18 ECTS, * 3 EXTERNAL ELECTIVE courses in the amount of 18 ECTS; * 4 SEMINARS; * prepare and defend the MASTER'S THESIS. _External elective courses_ may be chosen from the areas of social sciences, humanities and natural sciences, and from study programmes at other faculties; however, students may also select a course from internal courses as their externally elective course. ## Basic and internal selective courses for the study field Basic courses for the General, Theoretical and Discrete Mathematics Core ( [ short descriptions of courses ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/rima/09mzopisipredmetovmz-18ang100418.pdf) ): * Selected Topics in Algebra (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Analysis (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Discrete Mathematics (1) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Functional Analysis (6 ECTS). Internal elective courses for the Discrete Mathematics ( [ short descriptions of courses ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/rima/09mzopisipredmetovmz-18ang100418.pdf) ): * Algebraic Combinatorics (6 ECTS), * Groups, Covers and Maps (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Discrete Mathematics (2) (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Theory of Association Schemes (6 ECTS), * Selected Topics in Theory of Finite Geometries (6 ECTS), * Symmetry and Traversability in Graphs (6 ECTS), * Theory of Finite Fields (6 ECTS).
summary: The Master’s program in Discrete Mathematics spans two years (120 ECTS credits), combining foundational courses in algebra, analysis, and discrete mathematics with specialized electives. First-year students take three 6-ECTS basic courses, six internal elective courses (18 ECTS), two external electives (18 ECTS), and four seminars. Second-year students complete three more internal electives, two seminars, and a 24-ECTS master’s thesis. Obligations include passing three core courses, 18 ECTS of internal electives, 18 ECTS of external electives (from diverse fields like social sciences or natural sciences), and four seminars, culminating in a thesis defense. Internal electives focus on topics like algebraic combinatorics, finite fields, and graph theory, while external electives allow interdisciplinary exploration.

summary: The Master’s program in Financial Mathematics spans two years (120 ECTS credits), combining foundational courses in mathematics (e.g., algebra, analysis, discrete math) with specialized financial mathematics topics and electives. Students must complete 2 basic courses from general/theoretical math, 1 from financial mathematics, 3 internal electives (18 ECTS) in financial math, 3 external electives (18 ECTS) from diverse fields, and 4 seminars. The program culminates in a 24-ECTS master’s thesis, with internal electives including topics like mathematical statistics, modeling, and game theory, while external electives may come from social sciences, humanities, or other faculties.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  General information 

Name of the programme: **Mathematical Sciences**   
Type of programme: Master's **, 2nd Bologna cycle**   
**Degree awarded:** "magister matematike" equiv. to Master's degree in Mathematics   
Duration: **2 years** (4 semesters)   
ECTS-credits: **120**   
**Programme structure:** 12 courses (72 ECTS), 4 seminars (24 ECTS), Master's Thesis (24 ECTS)   
Mode of study: full-time   
Language of study: Slovene, English (in English from 2016/17)
summary:
The **Master's Programme in Mathematical Sciences** at UP FAMNIT (University of Primorska, Faculty of Information Studies) is structured to provide advanced training in mathematics and its applications. Below is a concise summary of key aspects of the program, based on the provided document:

---

### **1. Study Fields (Specializations)**
Students choose one of **eight study fields** upon enrollment, each focusing on distinct areas of mathematics and its applications:
- **Computer Intensive Methods and Applications**  
- **Cryptography**  
- **Discrete Mathematics**  
- **Financial Mathematics**  
- **General Mathematics**  
- **Geometry and Applications**  
- **Probability and Statistics**  
- **Theoretical Mathematics**  

Each field includes **basic courses**, **internal elective courses** (related to the chosen field), and **external electives** (to expand knowledge in Social Sciences, Humanities, or Natural Sciences).

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**
- **Eligibility**:  
  - Completion of a **first-cycle (Bachelor's) program** in any mathematical field.  
  - Or, completion of a **non-mathematical program** with **at least 30 ECTS credits** in essential mathematics courses (can be fulfilled during undergraduate studies or via exams).  
  - Equivalent qualifications from abroad (recognized under Slovenian education regulations).  
- **Transfer to Year 2**:  
  - Applicants with a **four-year mathematics-related degree** may enroll directly in Year 2.  
  - The Faculty Senate may impose **mandatory courses** based on prior qualifications.

---

### **3. Program Structure**
- **ECTS Credits**:  
  - Total: **120 ECTS** (including the Master's Thesis).  
  - **Annual Requirement**: At least **42 ECTS** per year (or 18 ECTS to repeat a year).  
- **Master's Thesis**:  
  - Must align with the chosen study field.  
  - Requires **public presentations** (verbal and written) and a **final defense**.  
  - Demonstrates expertise, critical analysis, and originality in applying mathematical knowledge.

---

### **4. Competencies Developed**
- **General Competencies**:  
  - Analytical and problem-solving skills.  
  - Communication, teamwork, and project management.  
  - Autonomy in learning and professional development.  
- **Subject-Specific Competencies**:  
  - Mastery of mathematical notation and concepts.  
  - Use of technology for problem-solving.  
  - Algorithmic thinking and numerical/graphical analysis.  
  - Logical reasoning and critical evaluation of mathematical theories.

---

### **5. Career Opportunities**
Graduates are prepared for roles in:
- **Computer/Information Science** (e.g., tech companies, research institutions).  
- **Statistics** (e.g., Statistical Office, insurance, banking).  
- **Financial Mathematics** (e.g., banks, stock exchanges, fintech).  
- **Gambling Theory** (e.g., lottery, sports betting).  
- **Education/Research**.  
- **Non-Mathematical Careers**: Skills in logical reasoning, analytical thinking, and problem-solving are transferable to fields like management, consulting, and policy analysis.

---

### **6. Resources**
- **Study Field & Elective Details**: [PDF Link](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/mz-07smerien0708-1718.pdf)  
- **Course Catalog**: [Table of Courses](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/mz-07smerien0708-1718.pdf)  
- **Admission Guidelines**: [Official Website](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/)

---

### **Key Notes**
- **Transfers**: Students from other programs must meet **comparability criteria** (e.g., equivalent coursework) and may need to take **differential exams**.  
- **Enrollment Limits**: Priority is given to applicants with **higher undergraduate grades** in case of limited spots.  
- **Language**: The program is likely conducted in **Slovene**, though some courses may be in English (check official details).

For specific course details or application procedures, refer to the provided PDFs or contact UP FAMNIT directly.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  About the programme [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#top)

[ Welcome to Famnit  ](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dg_ocsS3mrU)

The master’s programme is intended for those students who want to further their knowledge of mathematics acquired at the undergraduate level. 

The courses are designed in such a way that, upon completion of the degree, students have several opportunities to choose from: continuation with doctoral studies, employment in industry or the public sector, or switching to other sciences, well equipped with the knowledge they have gained. 

The courses are mostly elective and cover various topical mathematical areas. Of course, detailed understanding of these topics requires a certain knowledge of basic mathematical concepts that students learn at the undergraduate level (see [ Admission requirements ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#heading7) below). Depending on the students' enthusiasm, skills, interests and ambitions/plans for the future, they can be introduced to research mathematics. The latter mainly depends on the help of a supervisor for the master's thesis. There are also some courses offered in applied mathematics which are particularly suitable for students interested in the financial sector and the secondary sector (manufacturing and industry).
summary:
The **Master's Programme in Mathematical Sciences** at UP FAMNIT (University of Primorska, Faculty of Information Studies) is structured to provide advanced training in mathematics and its applications. Below is a concise summary of key aspects of the program, based on the provided document:

---

### **1. Study Fields (Specializations)**
Students choose one of **eight study fields** upon enrollment, each focusing on distinct areas of mathematics and its applications:
- **Computer Intensive Methods and Applications**  
- **Cryptography**  
- **Discrete Mathematics**  
- **Financial Mathematics**  
- **General Mathematics**  
- **Geometry and Applications**  
- **Probability and Statistics**  
- **Theoretical Mathematics**  

Each field includes **basic courses**, **internal elective courses** (related to the chosen field), and **external electives** (to expand knowledge in Social Sciences, Humanities, or Natural Sciences).

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**
- **Eligibility**:  
  - Completion of a **first-cycle (Bachelor's) program** in any mathematical field.  
  - Or, completion of a **non-mathematical program** with **at least 30 ECTS credits** in essential mathematics courses (can be fulfilled during undergraduate studies or via exams).  
  - Equivalent qualifications from abroad (recognized under Slovenian education regulations).  
- **Transfer to Year 2**:  
  - Applicants with a **four-year mathematics-related degree** may enroll directly in Year 2.  
  - The Faculty Senate may impose **mandatory courses** based on prior qualifications.

---

### **3. Program Structure**
- **ECTS Credits**:  
  - Total: **120 ECTS** (including the Master's Thesis).  
  - **Annual Requirement**: At least **42 ECTS** per year (or 18 ECTS to repeat a year).  
- **Master's Thesis**:  
  - Must align with the chosen study field.  
  - Requires **public presentations** (verbal and written) and a **final defense**.  
  - Demonstrates expertise, critical analysis, and originality in applying mathematical knowledge.

---

### **4. Competencies Developed**
- **General Competencies**:  
  - Analytical and problem-solving skills.  
  - Communication, teamwork, and project management.  
  - Autonomy in learning and professional development.  
- **Subject-Specific Competencies**:  
  - Mastery of mathematical notation and concepts.  
  - Use of technology for problem-solving.  
  - Algorithmic thinking and numerical/graphical analysis.  
  - Logical reasoning and critical evaluation of mathematical theories.

---

### **5. Career Opportunities**
Graduates are prepared for roles in:
- **Computer/Information Science** (e.g., tech companies, research institutions).  
- **Statistics** (e.g., Statistical Office, insurance, banking).  
- **Financial Mathematics** (e.g., banks, stock exchanges, fintech).  
- **Gambling Theory** (e.g., lottery, sports betting).  
- **Education/Research**.  
- **Non-Mathematical Careers**: Skills in logical reasoning, analytical thinking, and problem-solving are transferable to fields like management, consulting, and policy analysis.

---

- **Study Field & Elective Details**: [PDF Link](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences-copy/mz-07smerien0708-1718.pdf)

- **Enrollment Limits**: Priority is given to applicants with **higher undergraduate grades** in case of limited spots.

chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Educational and professional goals [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#top)
  * Students gain and consolidate an in-depth knowledge of the special mathematical areas. 
  * Students who intend to continue their studies in the doctoral programme are gradually introduced to research mathematics. 
  * Students interested in financial mathematics gain some specific knowledge of applied mathematics. For example, probability and statistics courses are particularly important for those interested in the finance, insurance or banking sectors. 
  * Students are provided with a thorough understanding of mathematics and taught the importance of analytical thought and argumentation, as well as the usefulness of various mathematical problem-solving methods. 
  * Students develop and learn to employ mathematical thinking, reasoning and argumentation in diverse mathematical areas. 
  * Students learn to recognise the connections between different mathematical theories and other natural and social sciences. 
  * Students develop the capacity to analyse given data in the sense of both reaching new conclusions and of teamwork in problem-solving. 
  * Students learn to employ modern technological tools (e.g. calculators, PCs, graphoscopes, projectors) in solving and demonstrating mathematical problems and concepts.

# Mathematical Sciences ## Course structure [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#top) The study programme lasts two years (120 ECTS), comprising courses, seminars and preparation and defence of the master’s thesis. Courses are divided into basic courses, internal elective and external elective courses (Table 1). During their studies, students must take 3 basic courses, 6 internal elective courses and 3 external elective courses. The Seminar (study obligation in the 1 st and 2 nd year of study) contains the following obligations: in the 1 st year, students must deliver at least one lecture or presentation, while in the 2 nd year they attend lectures at the Mathematical Research Seminar of the faculty. Students choose the [ study field ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#heading6) by enrolling. Students choose basic courses and internal elective courses related to their selected study field. [ Short descriptions of courses are available here ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/mathematical-sciences/21mzopisipredmetovmz-07ang110820.pdf) . chunk:
#  Mathematical Sciences 
##  Elective courses [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/#top)

The elective courses are divided into internal and external elective courses: 
  * INTERNAL elective courses are courses from the mathematical field of expertise and are presented in the Table 3; 
  * EXTERNAL elective courses may be chosen from the areas of social sciences, humanities and natural sciences, and from study programmes at other faculties; however, students may also select a course from internal elective courses as their external elective course. 

Every academic year, the Faculty offers a different selection of elective courses from the internal elective courses listed. The Faculty tries to meet student interests within the limits of the Faculty’s resources. The final selection of elective courses for the next academic year is published in July. The coordinator will help guide students when choosing their study field and elective courses after the second year.
