chunk:
#  ERASMUS+ 
##  TRANFORM4EUROPE (T4EU) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff#top)

University of Primorska is proud to be part of [ **Transform4Europe (T4EU)** ](https://transform4europe.eu/) , an alliance of 11 universities from different countries that have come together to form a unique European University. These institutions are located in liminal regions undergoing significant transformation, where universities play a crucial role in driving innovation, growth, and social change. 

Together, we represent a community of over **150,000 students** and **10,000 researchers** , creating a dynamic, multilingual, and cross-border campus. Through this alliance, we offer joint study programs, collaborative courses, research projects, and events that take place across all partner institutions. This provides our students and staff with diverse opportunities for academic and cultural exchange, fostering a truly European educational experience. 

The T4EU initiative also promotes numerous other activities aimed at building a more integrated and transformative higher education environment across Europe. 

**Among these, we highlight the following opportunities:**
  * [ Outgoing mobility of academic staff in the T4EU Chair Programme ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu-/t4eu-opportunities/for-staff/applications-for-outgoing-mobility-of-academic-staff-in-the-t4eu-chair-programme)
  * [ Incoming Visiting Professorship for the Academic Years 2024/2025 and 2025/2026 ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu-/t4eu-opportunities/for-staff/the-university-of-primorska-and-the-university-of-trieste-announce-a-joint-call-for-applications-for)

Further information about the upcoming T4EU events and opportunities for staff mobility is available on the [ UP webpage. ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu/t4eu-dogodki-)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/transform4europecvi-3internet-1-600x161.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

The map below shows which universities have an agreement with UP FAMNIT, permitting you to do an Erasmus exchange on their faculty (filters apply to study programmes): 

###  Erasmus charter of the University of Primorska 

Only universities holding an Erasmus charter are eligible to participate in the Erasmus+ programme. You can check University of Primorska's charter below. 

[ ![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/exchange/erasmus/untitled.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/exchange/erasmus/echeup.pdf)

###  [ Erasmus Policy Statement ](https://www.upr.si/en/international-/international-mobility/erasmus/eps/erasmus-policy-statement)
* * *
summary: UP FAMNIT facilitates international staff mobility through programs like ERASMUS+ (EU and partner countries), T4EU (a European University alliance with over 150,000 students and 10,000 researchers), CEEPUS (Central European exchange for 15+ countries), and the Norwegian/EEA Slovene scholarship fund (supporting mobility to Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein). Additionally, staff can engage in mobility outside formal programs or through projects funded by entities like the Slovene Research Agency, with opportunities for collaborative research and academic exchange.

chunk:
#  ERASMUS+ 
##  CEEPUS [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff#top)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/outgoing/mobility-programmes/ceepus-logorgbweb.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

CEEPUS is a Central European exchange program for students and professors involving higher education institutions from the following countries from the Baltic to the Black sea: Albania, Austria, Bulgaria, Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Czech Republic, Montenegro, Croatia, Kosovo, Hungary, Macedonia, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Serbia. The aim of the program is to establish and promote the mobility of students and professors between the participating countries and to take advantage of friendly connections and opportunities to design joint study programs. 

There are two options for mobility under CEEPUS: 
  * NETWORK  :  Universities and faculties form networks. Within each network, students and staff can attend exchanges. In the case of mobility within the CEEPUS network, of which UP FAMNIT is a part, it is necessary to check the possibilities at the UP FAMNIT International Office. UP FAMNIT is currently involved in the network BA-1403:  _Managing forests for climate change._
  * FREEMOVER  :  Students can also participate in exchanges as freemovers, if their faculty is not involved in any network. In the case of a so-called  _free mover_ exchange, it is first necessary to obtain permission for mobility at the foreign institution of your choice, followed by an application for a  _free mover_ scholarship. The CEEPUS program is coordinated by the national agency CMEPIUS, which also updates exchange opportunities under the CEEPUS  _free mover_ program. Please contact the UP FAMNIT International Office for more information on applying to the  _free mover_ exchange. 
* * *
summary: UP FAMNIT facilitates international staff mobility through programs like ERASMUS+ (EU and partner countries), T4EU (a European University alliance with over 150,000 students and 10,000 researchers), CEEPUS (Central European exchange for 15+ countries), and the Norwegian/EEA Slovene scholarship fund (supporting mobility to Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein). Additionally, staff can engage in mobility outside formal programs or through projects funded by entities like the Slovene Research Agency, with opportunities for collaborative research and academic exchange.

#  ERASMUS+ 
##  Norwegian and EEA Slovene scholarship fund [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff#top)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/students/outgoing/mobility-programmes/eealogo.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

Norwegian and EEA financial mechanisms support the project _Slovene scholarship fund_ . The fund supports outgoing mobility of students and staff to Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein. 

A few students and employees visit these countries each year. 

The project finished by the end of April 2016, however, the Norwegian government announced that it will continue to support the mobilities and the project is likely to be launched again in the future. 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/aurora-borealis-10325231920.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)
* * *

Additionally, staff can engage in mobility outside formal programs or through projects funded by entities like the Slovene Research Agency, with opportunities for collaborative research and academic exchange.

#  ERASMUS+ 
##  Mobility outside programmes [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff#top)

Mobility is also possible outside formal programmes. Arrangements are agreed on an individual basis. In particular, outgoing mobility of professors and researchers often takes place outside of programmes. 
* * *

#  ERASMUS+ 
##  Project support  [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff#top)

Some mobilities are a part of projects. Staff exchanges especially are often financed through projects. In the past, UP FAMNIT has obtained support for international mobility within [ Bilateral projects financed by the Slovene Research Agency ](https://www.arrs.gov.si/sl/medn/dvostr/) ( [ see the list of current projects on Slovene pages here ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/raziskovanje/programi-in-projekti) ) or under structural funds. An example is the project [ Mobility of higher education teachers of the UP ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/cooperation/projects/mobile-teachers) .

summary: Dr. Vito Vitrih is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) in Koper, Slovenia, affiliated with the Department of Mathematics. His research focuses on numerical mathematics, including multivariate polynomial interpolation, computer-aided geometric design (CAGD), geometric interpolation of curves and surfaces, multidimensional numerical integration, and splines. He teaches courses such as "Selected Topics in Numerical Mathematics" and "Introduction to Numerical Calculations" and serves as the coordinator for the Master's Study Programme in Mathematical Sciences. Her work focuses on coastal marine ecosystems and their conservation challenges.

summary: Dr. Jure Jugovic is an Associate Professor at the University of Primorska, Faculty of Natural Sciences and Mathematics, affiliated with the Department of Biodiversity. His research focuses on speleobiology and the taxonomy and ecology of crustaceans. He teaches courses such as "Biology and Diversity of Vertebrates," "Ecology of Terrestrial Ecosystems," "Evolutionary Biology," and "Quantitative Methods in Systematics and Ecology," among others. His contact details include a phone number (+386 5 66 35 807) and email (jure.jugovic@upr.si).

She teaches courses such as Biopsychology of Motivation and Emotions, Psychometrics, and Developmental Psychology, and coordinates the Biopsychology study program at both undergraduate and master's levels. She also serves as Deputy Chair of the Psychology Department and holds a research focus on smartphone use impacts and psychological characteristics of human development.

summary: Dr. Štefko Miklavič is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) in Koper, Slovenia, specializing in Algebraic Graph Theory, Distance-Regular Graphs, Association Schemes, and Group Actions on Graphs. He serves as the Coordinator for the Doctoral Study Programme in Mathematical Sciences and teaches courses such as Algebra I, Abstract Algebra, Number Theory, and Topology. His office is located at II/09 (Kettejeva 1, Koper), with contact details including phone +386 5 611 76 57 and email stefko.miklavic@upr.si.

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **Student Tutor Program** at UP FAMNIT, based on the provided information:

---

### **How to Become a Student Tutor**  
1. **Eligibility**:  
   - Must be a **BSc, MSc, or PhD student** at UP FAMNIT.  
   - Must have **successfully completed their first year** of study.  

2. **Application Process**:  
   - Submit an **application form** to the **Office of Student Services**.  
   - Selected candidates will receive a **formal appointment** as student tutors.  
   - The **term of office** is **one academic year**.  

3. **Open Call for Tutors**:  
   - Published **at least once a year**, no later than **1 March**.  
   - Rules are outlined in the [**Rules on the Tutoring System**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/rules-on-the-tutoring-system-at-up2022.pdf) (adopted in 2022).  

---

### **Key Responsibilities of Student Tutors**  
- **Support Students**: Assist with academic challenges, study planning, and personal growth.  
- **Submit Work Reports**:  
  - By **10 October** each academic year, submit a **work report** using the prescribed [form](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/porocilostudenttutoreng.docx).  
  - The report must be **co-signed** by the **faculty student tutors coordinator**.  
- **Collaborate with Coordinators**:  
  - The **faculty student tutors coordinator** submits a report to the **teacher tutors coordinator** by **15 October**.  
  - The teacher tutors coordinator reviews reports and proposes confirmation to a committee.  

---

### **Training and Resources**  
- **Workshops and Training**:  
  - Tutors participate in **continuing education sessions** (see [training framework](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/sistem-permanentnega-izobrazevanja-tutorji-22.6.2015.pdf)).  
  - A short video about past training is available [here](http://youtu.be/BP3F2Z1yFeM).  
- **Guides for Tutors**:  
  - [**Tutor Handbook**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---22.6.-2015.pdf) (general).  
  - [**Special Needs Students**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-studenti-s-posebnimi-potrebami-).  
  - [**Foreign Students**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-tujimi-studenti--22.6.-2015.pdf).  

---

### **Teacher Tutors (Available for Academic Guidance)**  
- **Role**: Advise students on course selection, progression, and final projects.  
- **Special Focus**: Support students with **special needs** by creating individualized study plans.  
- **Contact List (2023/2024 Academic Year)**:  
  - **Biopsychology (BSc/MSc)**: Vesna Jug, Urša Mars Bitenc, Tina Tinkara Peternelj, Tjaša Ogrizek.  
  - **Conservation Biology (BSc/MSc/Doctoral)**: Vladimir Ivović, Katja Adam, Sara Zupan.  
  - **Mathematics (BSc/MSc)**: Nina Chiarelli.  
  - **Computer Science (BSc/MSc)**: Branko Kavšek, Matjaž Kljun.  
  - **Data Science (MSc)**: Marko Tkalčič.  
  - **Sustainable Built Environments (MSc)**: Matthew Schwarzkopf.  
  - **Renewable Materials (Doctoral)**: Matthew Schwarzkopf.  
  - **Suicidology and Mental Health (Doctoral)**: Vesna Jug, Urša Mars Bitenc, Tina Tinkara Peternelj, Tjaša Ogrizek.  

---

### **Why Become a Tutor?**  
- **Impact Students**: Directly support academic and personal growth.  
- **Develop Skills**: Improve **organizational, communication, and leadership abilities**.  
- **Sense of Fulfillment**: Gain satisfaction from helping students succeed and seeing their progress.  

---

### **Key Deadlines**  
- **Open Call Publication**: By **1 March** annually.  
- **Work Report Submission**: By **10 October** for student tutors.  
- **Faculty Coordinator Report**: By **15 October**.  

---

For more details, visit the [UP FAMNIT Tutoring System Page](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/tutoring-system). Let me know if you need further clarification! 😊

chunk:
#  Student tutors 
##  Academic year 2024/25 student tutor coordinator about tutoring 

_![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/tutoring-system/slikanovicnik.jpg:resizebox?600x752) Tutoring at FAMNIT is crucial for students' success, providing individual support and mentorship often unavailable during regular lectures. _

_Additionally, we actively collaborate with professors and academic staff to ensure that tutoring effectively aligns with the curriculum and subject goals. We regularly communicate with professors to understand students' needs and coordinate our activities with the schedule of lectures and exam dates._

_Special attention is given to assisting foreign students facing linguistic, cultural, and academic challenges. We strive in various ways to provide equal opportunities for success to both foreign and domestic students, fostering open dialogue, exploration, and trust._

_Of course, we also encounter various challenges, primarily time limitations, as tutors are usually students involved in many extracurricular activities. We must be attentive to individual student needs and, most importantly, offer guidance and direction towards independent work._

_Tutors are dedicated to creating a supportive environment where students feel encouraged and motivated to learn._

_ As  the  coordinator  of  tutors  , I  play  a  crucial  role in  informing  ,  guiding  ,  and  supporting  tutors  in  their  work  .  I  ai  m  to  enc  oura  ge  collab  o  ration  among  s  tuden  t  s  ,  tutor  s  ,  and  p  ro  fes  s  ors  ,  creat  in  g  an  env  i  ro  n  ment  that  f  o  ster  s  open  d  ialogu  e  ,  explo  ra  tion  ,  and  l  ea  rni  n  g  .  _

_Tutoring satisfies me because it allows me to directly impact the student's experience and assist students in their academic and personal growth. It also allows me to develop organisational and communication skills and collaborate on various projects. Through tutoring, I am constantly learning and growing, where every day brings new challenges and encounters opportunities to improve study environment._

_ The tutor role is important and valuable because we can directly contribute with our efforts and encouragement to students' well-being and help them tackle everyday academic challenges. Every success, every moment when we see how a student develops their abilities and pushes their limits, reminded us why we choose to become tutors. The biggest accomplishment of our work is the satisfaction and fulfilment that we feel in the gratitude of the students. Therefore, we are happy that the faculty allows us to be part of this and that we insist and continuing our mission with passion and optimism because every smile, step, and encouragement from us can make someone's day brighter.  -EVA KREBL, UP FAMNIT STUDENT TUTORS COORDINATOR-  _

chunk:
#  Student tutors 
##  How do I become student tutor? 

It's easy! Student tutor can be any student who successfully completed their first year and is enrolled as a BSc, MSc or PhD student at UP FAMNIT. Tutor candidate should fill in the application form and deliver it to the Office of Student Services. Applicants who meet the conditions of the call for applications and are selected will receive a formal decision on their appointment as student tutors. The term of office of a student tutor is one academic year. 

###  The Senate of the University of Primorska at its 26th regular session on 23. 3. 2022 adopted the [ new Rules on the tutoring system at the University of Primorska ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/rules-on-the-tutoring-system-at-up2022.pdf) , which came into force on 9 May 2022. 

The Rules stipulate that the  Open Call for tutors is published  at least once a year,  no later than 1 March.

chunk:
#  Student tutors 
##  Tutor work report 

By October 10, the student tutor must submit a work report for each academic year to the coordinator of faculty student tutors on the prescribed [ form ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/porocilostudenttutoreng.docx) . Student tutor must ensure that the report is (co)signed by the coordinator of the student tutors at the faculty. 

The coordinator of faculty student tutors  submits a report on the work of the tutors to the coordinator of teacher tutors of the faculty by October 15 at the latest. 

The coordinator of faculty teacher tutors reviews the report of student tutors and proposes to the competent committee the confirmation of the report.

chunk:
#  Student tutors 
##  Useful information 

The tutors have some useful materials available to help them with their work. 

You can read everything about the tutoring system in the _[ Priročniku za tutorje Univerze na Primorskem ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---22.6.2015.pdf) _ .Tutoring guides for [ students with special needs ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-studenti-s-posebnimi-potrebami-) and for [ foreign students are also available ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-tujimi-studenti--22.6.-2015.pdf) .
summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **Student Tutor Program** at UP FAMNIT, based on the provided information:

---

### **How to Become a Student Tutor**  
1. **Eligibility**:  
   - Must be a **BSc, MSc, or PhD student** at UP FAMNIT.  
   - Must have **successfully completed their first year** of study.  

2. **Application Process**:  
   - Submit an **application form** to the **Office of Student Services**.  
   - Selected candidates will receive a **formal appointment** as student tutors.  
   - The **term of office** is **one academic year**.  

3. **Open Call for Tutors**:  
   - Published **at least once a year**, no later than **1 March**.  
   - Rules are outlined in the [**Rules on the Tutoring System**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/rules-on-the-tutoring-system-at-up2022.pdf) (adopted in 2022).  

---

### **Key Responsibilities of Student Tutors**  
- **Support Students**: Assist with academic challenges, study planning, and personal growth.  
- **Submit Work Reports**:  
  - By **10 October** each academic year, submit a **work report** using the prescribed [form](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/tutoring-system/porocilostudenttutoreng.docx).  
  - The report must be **co-signed** by the **faculty student tutors coordinator**.  
- **Collaborate with Coordinators**:  
  - The **faculty student tutors coordinator** submits a report to the **teacher tutors coordinator** by **15 October**.  
  - The teacher tutors coordinator reviews reports and proposes confirmation to a committee.  

---

### **Training and Resources**  
- **Workshops and Training**:  
  - Tutors participate in **continuing education sessions** (see [training framework](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/sistem-permanentnega-izobrazevanja-tutorji-22.6.2015.pdf)).  
  - A short video about past training is available [here](http://youtu.be/BP3F2Z1yFeM).  
- **Guides for Tutors**:  
  - [**Tutor Handbook**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---22.6.-2015.pdf) (general).  
  - [**Special Needs Students**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-studenti-s-posebnimi-potrebami-).  
  - [**Foreign Students**](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/prirocnik-za-tutorje-up---delo-s-tujimi-studenti--22.6.-2015.pdf).  

---

### **Teacher Tutors (Available for Academic Guidance)**  
- **Role**: Advise students on course selection, progression, and final projects.  
- **Special Focus**: Support students with **special needs** by creating individualized study plans.  
- **Contact List (2023/2024 Academic Year)**:  
  - **Biopsychology (BSc/MSc)**: Vesna Jug, Urša Mars Bitenc, Tina Tinkara Peternelj, Tjaša Ogrizek.  
  - **Conservation Biology (BSc/MSc/Doctoral)**: Vladimir Ivović, Katja Adam, Sara Zupan.  
  - **Mathematics (BSc/MSc)**: Nina Chiarelli.  
  - **Computer Science (BSc/MSc)**: Branko Kavšek, Matjaž Kljun.  
  - **Data Science (MSc)**: Marko Tkalčič.  
  - **Sustainable Built Environments (MSc)**: Matthew Schwarzkopf.  
  - **Renewable Materials (Doctoral)**: Matthew Schwarzkopf.  
  - **Suicidology and Mental Health (Doctoral)**: Vesna Jug, Urša Mars Bitenc, Tina Tinkara Peternelj, Tjaša Ogrizek.  

---

### **Why Become a Tutor?**  
- **Impact Students**: Directly support academic and personal growth.  
- **Develop Skills**: Improve **organizational, communication, and leadership abilities**.  
- **Sense of Fulfillment**: Gain satisfaction from helping students succeed and seeing their progress.  

---

### **Key Deadlines**  
- **Open Call Publication**: By **1 March** annually.  
- **Work Report Submission**: By **10 October** for student tutors.  
- **Faculty Coordinator Report**: By **15 October**.  

---

For more details, visit the [UP FAMNIT Tutoring System Page](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/tutoring-system). Let me know if you need further clarification! 😊

chunk:
# Student tutors ## Training of student tutors Tutors have the opportunity for education and training in various workshops and sessions. These are conducted within the [ framework of Continuing Education for tutors. ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/files/studenti/tutorstvo/sistem-permanentnega-izobrazevanja-tutorji-22.6.2015.pdf) [ Here ](http://youtu.be/BP3F2Z1yFeM) you can watch a short video about the training of tutors during past academic years. **Teacher tutors** advise mainly individually. They help students with their studies with the aim of improving their academic achievements in individual fields of study, advise on the choice of elective courses and answer questions about progression to a higher year, completion of studies, and the choice of mentor in the final work. In particular, teacher tutors are available to students with the status of a student with special needs and together they create an individualized study plan. In the academic year 2023/2024, UP FAMNIT students can turn to the following teacher tutors:

summary: Dr. Jernej Vičič is an Associate Professor at the Faculty of Information Sciences and Technologies (Oddelek za informacijske znanosti in tehnologije) at the University of Primorska (UPR), based in Koper. He can be contacted via email at jernej.vicic@upr.si, phone at +386 5 611 76 50, or in person at office I/02-3 (Kettejeva 1, Koper). His personal website provides additional details about his work.

##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election of its new director in May 2025, with Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih confirmed as the candidate after submitting his work program and CV by July 16. The process involved four candidacy proposals and two scientific council sessions to finalize procedures. Concurrently, the institute and affiliated faculty advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory/permutation groups and Galois geometry/group actions, funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). Key upcoming events in 2025 include conferences on applied theoretical computer science, Slovenian mathematics, and PhD summer schools in discrete mathematics.

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election process for its new director in May 2025, with Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih as the proposed candidate who submitted his work program and CV by July. Four candidates were nominated, and two postdoctoral positions were advertised in algebraic graph theory and Galois geometry, funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency. Concurrently, the institute organized several scientific conferences and events in 2025, including the Middle-European Conference on Applied Theoretical Computer Science and the InnoRenew CoE International Conference, highlighting its active engagement in academic and research collaborations.

summary: The Faculty Senate of Famnit has appointed coordinators for each study program across undergraduate, master's, and doctoral levels (Bologna cycles), with faculty members overseeing implementation. Undergraduate programs include coordinators like Prof. Marko Orel (Mathematics) and Assoc. Prof. Branko Kavšek (Computer Science), while master's programs feature leaders such as Prof. Vito Vitrih (Mathematical Sciences) and Assoc. Prof. Mihael Perman (Mathematics with Financial Engineering). Doctoral programs, such as Mathematical Sciences and Renewable Materials, are managed by professors like Štefko Miklavič and Andreja Kutnar, with some roles having deputy coordinators.

summary: Dr. Patricija Mozetič is an Associate Professor at the Department of Biodiversity, Faculty of Natural Sciences and Engineering, University of Primorska, specializing in marine ecology, phytoplankton ecology, harmful algal blooms, and marine eutrophication. She teaches courses such as Marine Ecology, Marine Botany, and Processes, Changes, and Protection of Marine Ecosystems, and serves as a deputy coordinator for the Master’s program in Nature Conservation. Her research focuses on coastal marine ecosystems and their ecological dynamics, with a strong emphasis on environmental pollution and biodiversity conservation. Contact: patricija.mozetic@famnit.upr.si.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations/legal-entities](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations/legal-entities)

#  Donations by legal entities 

With legal entities, we enter into a contract on donations. 

To prepare a contract, we need contact information from your organisation (the form can be found below). We will prepare the contract at the faculty and send it to your address within a few days. 

For more information, please contact us at [ donacije@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:donacije@famnit.upr.si) . 

(Fields marked with * are obligatory) 

Name* 

Surname* 

Company* 

Address* 

Post number* 

Town* 

Telephone* 

Email* 

I would like to support (please choose one of the options):* 

Further development of the faculty’s internationalisation 

The faculty’s development and promotion activities 

Choose the amount 

UP FAMNIT can publish our company/organisation's name on the list of donors on the faculty’s webpage. 

Your suggestions, questions: 

By filling in this form, I agree that the faculty can use my personal data to notify me about faculty activities, send me invitations to events and invite me to participate in electronic surveys until I revoke my consent in writing. I am aware that I can be removed from the mailing list by sending an e-mail to [ donacije@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:donacije@famnit.upr.si) . UP FAMNIT commits to keep, use, safeguard and protect personal data in line with the Act on Protecting Personal Data (ZVOP-1). We will not send your data to third parties. 

Send
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) accepts donations from legal entities through a formal contract, requiring mandatory contact details such as name, company, address, and email. Donors can specify the purpose of their contribution, such as supporting internationalization or development activities, and may request public recognition on the faculty’s website. The institution assures data privacy in line with the Act on Protecting Personal Data, and donors can contact donacije@famnit.upr.si for further information or to manage their data preferences.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff)

#  Incoming Staff 

UP FAMNIT is proud of its international staff and visiting professors and researchers from all around the world.  More than 70 professors and researchers visit our faculty annually  , while several hundred also attend our events.  Our professors have established numerous contacts with  [ professors and researchers from prestigious foreign universities, who visit us regularly. ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/gostujoci-tekst-en) We cooperate with visitors coming from neighboring countries as well as with those from more distant locations. 

The University of Primorska each year welcomes also administrative and teaching staff from partner universities during International Week. 

[ Find out more about the UP International week 2024! ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/international-week)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/img9721.jpg:resizebox?1100x734)

At UP FAMNIT, international mobility is enabled through the ERASMUS + exchange programs, CEEPUS programme, the Slovenian EEA and NFM Scholarship Fund program, individual bilateral agreements, and outside programmes. 

[ Exchange opportunities for visiting staff ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/opportunities)

##  TRANFORM4EUROPE (T4EU) 

University of Primorska is proud to be part of [ Transform4Europe (T4EU) ](https://transform4europe.eu/) , an alliance of 11 universities from different countries that have come together to form a unique European University. These institutions are located in liminal regions undergoing significant transformation, where universities play a crucial role in driving innovation, growth, and social change. 

Together, we represent a community of over  150,000 students  and  10,000 researchers  , creating a dynamic, multilingual, and cross-border campus. Through this alliance, we offer joint study programs, collaborative courses, research projects, and events that take place across all partner institutions. This provides our students and staff with diverse opportunities for academic and cultural exchange, fostering a truly European educational experience. 

The T4EU initiative also promotes numerous other activities aimed at building a more integrated and transformative higher education environment across Europe. 

Among these, we highlight the following opportunity for incoming teaching staff: 
  * [ Incoming Visiting Professorship for the Academic Years 2024/2025 and 2025/2026 ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu-/t4eu-opportunities/for-staff/the-university-of-primorska-and-the-university-of-trieste-announce-a-joint-call-for-applications-for)

Further information about the upcoming T4EU events and opportunities for staff mobility is available on the [ UP webpage. ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu/t4eu-dogodki-)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/transform4europecvi-3internet-1-600x161.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

##  Project Guest UP 

** The project  _[ Hosting foreign experts and professors at the University of Primorska (GUEST UP) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/projects/gostup) _ provides co-financing for hosting foreign experts.  ** Visiting professors generally come from the USA, Switzerland, Chile, Japan, Serbia and China. The main objective of the project is to enhance the internationalization of the study and research processes of the faculty and open itself to the international higher education and research sphere.
summary: UP FAMNIT fosters international collaboration through visiting professors and researchers, welcoming over 70 annually and hosting hundreds at events, while partnering with global and regional institutions. The university supports mobility via ERASMUS +, CEEPUS, and bilateral agreements, and is part of the Transform4Europe (T4EU) alliance, a European University network of 11 institutions with over 150,000 students and 10,000 researchers, offering joint programs and cross-border opportunities. T4EU also promotes incoming teaching staff roles, such as the 2024/25 Visiting Professorship. Additionally, the GUEST UP project funds hosting foreign experts from countries like the U.S., Japan, and China, enhancing the faculty’s international research and educational engagement.

chunk:
##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election process for its director in May 2025, with the Scientific Council adopting resolutions to formalize the procedure and correct earlier decisions. Four candidates, including Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted their work programs and CVs by July, with Vitrih’s submission confirmed by the Electoral Commission. Concurrently, the institute advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory and Galois geometry, funded by Slovenian research grants. Additionally, UP IAM organized or participated in several academic conferences and events in 2025, including the Middle-European Conference on Applied Theoretical Computer Science and the InnoRenew CoE International Conference.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations)

#  Transferring donations 

You can make your donation to the below-mentioned bank account. If you would prefer to receive a money order form, please contact us at [ donacije@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:donacije@famnit.upr.si) and send us your contact details (name and surname, address, postcode). We will send the completed money order form to your address. 

**Address and bank account for donations:**

University of Primorska   
Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies 

Glagoljaška 8 

SI-6000  Koper    
Slovenia 

**SI56011006000023788 (opened at Uprava RS za javna placila)**

Please decide where you would like your donation to be directed and state the corresponding payment purpose and reference: 
  * If you would like to support our endeavours for further internationalisation of our faculty, please state:   
Purpose of payment: **DONATION – INTERNATIONALISATION**   
Reference: **1-2015**
  * If you would like to support other development and promotion activities within our faculty (development of new study programmes, purchasing of equipment for lecture rooms and laboratories, promotion of the faculty, etc.), please state:   
Purpose of payment: **DONATION – GENERAL**   
Reference: **2-2015**

The faculty will publish a list of donors. As we have to receive consent from you before we can publish your name on the list, please also fill in the [ STATEMENT ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/about-faculty/donations/transferring-donations/statement.pdf) and send it to our address (found in the statement). 

We thank you for your support!
summary: To donate to the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies at the University of Primorska, you can transfer funds to the bank account SI56011006000023788 (opened at Uprava RS za javna placila) or request a money order form by emailing donacije@famnit.upr.si with your contact details. Specify the donation purpose and reference: "DONATION – INTERNATIONALISATION" (ref: 1-2015) for internationalization efforts or "DONATION – GENERAL" (ref: 2-2015) for general development. Donors wishing to have their names published must submit a statement of consent.

chunk:
##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election process for its director in May 2025, with Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih confirmed as the candidate after submitting his work program and CV by July 15. The election commission received four candidacy proposals, while the institute also advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory and Galois geometry, funded by Slovenian research grants. Concurrently, UP IAM organized several scientific conferences and events in 2025, including the Middle-European Conference on Applied Theoretical Computer Science and the InnoRenew CoE International Conference, highlighting its active engagement in academic and research activities.

His office is located at Livade 1.0, first floor, with contact details including phone +386 5 66 35 811 and email matjaz.hladnik@upr.si. His work bridges applied natural sciences with interdisciplinary research and education.

summary: The document outlines three committees for an academic or organizational event: the Steering Committee, Program Committee, and Organizing Committee. The Steering Committee includes five members (Andrej Brodnik, Gabor Galambos, Gabriel Istrate, Miklos Kresz, and Gerhard Reinelt) with affiliations across Slovenia, Hungary, Romania, Germany, and Austria. The Program Committee, chaired jointly by Andrej Brodnik and Gabor Galambos, features 14 members from diverse locations, including experts in computer science and operations research. The Organizing Committee consists of four individuals, led by Rok Požar as chair, responsible for logistical coordination.

summary: Dr. Štefko Miklavič is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) in Koper, Slovenia, affiliated with the Department of Mathematics. His research focuses on algebraic graph theory, distance-regular graphs, association schemes, and group actions on graphs. He teaches courses such as Algebra I, Abstract Algebra, Number Theory, and Topology, and serves as the coordinator for the Doctoral Study Programme in Mathematical Sciences. Contact details include his office at II/09 (Kettejeva 1, Koper), phone +386 5 611 76 57, and email stefko.miklavic@upr.si.

##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election process for its new director in May 2025, with the Scientific Council adopting resolutions to formalize and correct the procedure. Four candidates submitted their applications, and Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih finalized his work program and CV by July 15. Concurrently, the institute and affiliated faculty advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory/permutation groups and Galois geometry/group actions, funded by Slovenian research grants. The document also highlights upcoming academic events, including conferences and a PhD summer school, underscoring UP IAM's active engagement in research and collaboration.

summary: Dr. Andreja Kutnar is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Applied Natural Sciences, University of Primorska, specializing in Wood Science and Environmental Impact Assessment. She teaches courses such as Forest and Wood Management, Wood Modification, and Scientific Writing, and serves as Coordinator for the Doctoral Study Programme "Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments" and Deputy Coordinator for the Master's Programme "Sustainable Built Environment." Her contact details include an email address (andreja.kutnar@upr.si) and a personal website.

summary: Dr. Štefan Bojnec is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Natural Sciences and Engineering (FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska, affiliated with the Department of Applied Natural Sciences. His research focuses on structural changes, specialisation patterns, sustainable development, comparative analysis of agricultural factor markets in EU member states, food pricing transparency, and household income dynamics during financial crises. He teaches the course "Forest Products Value Chain" and can be contacted via email at stefan.bojnec@upr.si.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/international-week](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/international-week)

#  University of Primorska International Staff Week 2024 

Discover the 2024 University of Primorska International Staff Week—an immersive dive into making our international community thrive! 

###  Let's talk about   
WELCOME SERVICES AND SUPPORT FOR INTERNATIONAL INCOMING STUDENTS AND STAFF. 

The International Staff Week for 2024 is scheduled to take place in historically rich town of Koper, in charming coastal region of Slovenia,  from March 5th to March 7th, 2024. 

We want to engagee a diverse group of university teams—whether you’re in HR, student services, or International Office. 

_Throughout the staff training week, our focus will be on exploring these topics:_
  * Welcome services for international students – best practices and areas for improvement. 
  * How to engage all international students (degree seeking and exchange students). 
  * Effective communication strategies for international students (utilizing various communication channels and overcoming language barriers). 
  * Welcome services for incoming international staff, including visa assistance, housing, family placements, and overall integration. 

_For this staff training we would like to welcome all university staff members who are:_
  * Assisting international incoming students and staff across International Offices, Student Services, HR, Welcome Centres, Career Centres, Student Housing, PR and Communication Offices. 
  * Facilitating intercultural orientation. 
  * Contributing to the field of intercultural and international communication. 

Complete and submit the application form by January 22, 2024. 
  * Application form is available here: [ 2024 University of Primorska Staff Week ](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=p-khtNHk-0ux6O_maY-5e13HDbMtidtGrhqsFH-zjZhURjJVRDlKNkkwMTFGOVJXQlVPMDRYRE4ySy4u)
  * We'll evaluate based on your field experience, motivation, and work context, inviting 30 participants (with a maximum of 2 per institution) to join the UP Staff Week. Selection results will be shared by January 26. 
  * Please h  old off on booking flights or hotels until  you've  received a confirmation email from us. 

More information is available in [ this flyer ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/international-week/international-week-2024-flyer.pdf) . A detailed program will follow in February.
summary: The University of Primorska International Staff Week 2024, held in Koper, Slovenia, from March 5–7, 2024, aims to enhance support for international students and staff through workshops on welcome services, engagement strategies, communication, and integration. Targeting university staff in HR, student services, international offices, and related departments, the event invites 30 participants (max 2 per institution) to share experiences and improve intercultural practices. Applications, due by January 22, 2024, will be evaluated based on experience and context, with selections announced by January 26. Travel arrangements should await confirmation.

chunk:
##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska initiated the election of its new director in May 2025, with the Scientific Council adopting resolutions to formalize the process and correct earlier decisions. Four candidates were proposed, including Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, who submitted his work program and CV by July 15, 2025. Concurrently, the institute and its affiliated faculty advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory/permutation groups and Galois geometry/group actions, funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS).

summary: Dr. Alenka Baruca Arbeiter is a Docentka (Assistant Professor) at the University of Primorska, Faculty of Applied Natural Sciences, based in Koper (office I/06, phone +386 5 66 35 815, email alenka.arbeiter@upr.si). Her research focuses on molecular genetics and agronomy, while her teaching includes courses such as agroecology, genetics, horticulture, and aromatic plants production. She serves as a deputy coordinator for the Mediterranean Agriculture study programs (undergraduate and higher education professional) and contributes to practical training and plant protection diagnostics.

chunk:
#  ERASMUS+ 
##  OPEN CALL FOR INTERNATIONAL STAF MOBILITIES FOR TRAINING UNDER ERASMUS+ KA131 PROGRAMME [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities#top)

On January 21, 2025, [ the Open Call for International Staff Mobility for Training within the Erasmus+ program ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/callerasmusstafftrainingenjanuary-2025.pdf) was published on the [ UP website. ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-the-university/686-work-at-up/803-staff-mobility/outgoing-mobility/) This program enables employees to visit partner universities in other countries to gain insight into their processes and work methods, as well as to participate in training at any public or private organization active in the labor market or the field of education. 

Opportunities for training at higher education institutions can be found on the [ iMotion website ](http://staffmobility.eu/staff-week-search) , while training programs offered by partner institutions are also available under [ FAMNIT News: Mednarodno. ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/mednarodno)

UP supports two types of training mobility: 
  * General mobility 
  * Mobilities of strategic importance (in the framework of T4EU Alliance) 

The minimum duration of physical mobility is 2 days, while the maximum duration is 2 months, with financial support from the university covering up to 1 month. 

####  There is no final application deadline, but applicants are advised to apply at least 3 weeks before their planned mobility. 
  * Applicants can apply for co-funding as soon as they have arranged their mobility with the host institution. The Selection Committee at the university will review applications at its next meeting (typically held weekly). 
  * Applications for mobility approval and funding allocation can be submitted via [ the university’s website. ](https://vis.upr.si/studij/izmenjavazaposleni/prof_izmenjava_prva.asp)
  * ####  Candidates must attach a mobility program proposal and a cost estimate ( [ Annex 1 ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/annex-1.xlsx) ) to their application. 

For further inquiries, please contact the FAMNIT International Office at international@famnit.upr.si. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/erasmus-banner-2.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)
summary: The document outlines Erasmus+ mobility opportunities for staff, including two key programs: KA131 for training (2–2 months, up to €13,590 co-funding) and KA171 for teaching/training (max 5 days, with travel included). Both programs require proposals, cost estimates, and adherence to deadlines, with KA131 emphasizing 8 hours of weekly teaching and KA171 specifying destinations like Israel, Kenya, South Africa, and the USA. Applications must be submitted via the university’s portal, with rolling deadlines and financial support covering up to 1 month for KA131. Past calls and detailed guidelines are available for further information, with inquiries directed to the FAMNIT International Office.

#  ERASMUS+ 
##  ERASMUS+ KA171 CALL FOR STAFF EXCHANGE FOR TEACHING AND TRAINING AT PARTNER UNIVERSITIES [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities#top)

Published on August 30, 2023, the [ ERASMUS+ KA171 CALL ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/engcalleka171-outgoing-staff.pdf) is now open for employee mobility, focusing on both teaching and training purposes. These mobility opportunities must be concluded by the project's completion date, which is July 31, 2026. 

The duration of mobility is capped at a maximum of 5 days. This allows for an allocation of up to two (2) days for travel, or up to four (4) days for environmentally-friendly travel. For teaching-focused mobility, a minimum requirement of 8 teaching hours per week must be fulfilled. 

For further information on mobility period, conditions, and the application process, all pertinent details are available within the text of the official call and on [ UP webpage ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/686-work-at-up/803-staff-mobility/outgoing-mobility/) . Should you have any additional questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at international@famnit.upr.si. 

###  MOBILITIES FOR TEACHING 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to ISRAEL 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to KENYA 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to SOUTH AFRICA 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to USA 

###  MOBILITIES FOR TRAINING 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to ISRAEL 
  * ####  2 outgoing mobilities to SOUTH AFRICA 
  * ####  1 outgoing mobility to KENYA
