#  ERASMUS+ 
##  Past Open Calls  [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities#top)

####  OPEN CALL FOR INTERNATIONAL STAF MOBILITIES FOR TRAINING UNDER ERASMUS+ KA131 PROGRAMME 

[ The Open Call for the Erasmus+ KA131 Programme ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/callerasmusstafftrainingen-1.doc) was published on April 20th, 2023, offering staff the opportunity to visit partner universities in different countries to gain insights into their processes and working methods. 

UP will support two types of mobilities: 
  * general mobilities 
  * mobilities of strategic importance 

Mobilities can be impemented at the institution with which university has an agreement. The list of agreements can be found on the map of agreements under Erasmus+ page of the university [ here. ](https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=1PL2uppCLBY8lh8lpSYfh9ZsNIUYJizpZ&ll=53.699172204189146%2C10.520276599999997&z=3)

Minum duration of physical mobilities is 2 days. Maximum duration is 2 motnhs, of which the university will financially support a maximum 1 month. 

There is a rolling deadline without a final application deadline. Candidates can apply for funding as soon as they arrange their mobility with the host institution. 

Additional details can be found on the [ UP webpage ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/686-work-at-up/803-staff-mobility/outgoing-mobility/) . If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to contact us at  [ international@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:international@famnit.upr.si) . 

####  ERASMUS+ OPEN CALL KA131 FOR APPLICATIONS FOR CO-FINANCING OF THE MOBILITY FOR TEACHING 

Based on the approved funding from the European Commission, the Center of the Republic of Slovenia for Mobility and European Education and Training Programs (CMEPIUS) has granted the University of Primorska (UP) funding for co-financing staff mobility for teaching purposes amounting to €13,590.00. In accordance with the approved funds, open call for applications for co-financing of the mobility for teaching within Erasmus+ (KA131) program in the contract year 2023 was announced on October 25, 2024. 

Mobilities must be carried out by July 31, 2025, and can take place _in program countries_ , specifically in all member states of the European Union, Liechtenstein, Turkey, Serbia, North Macedonia, Norway, and Iceland, _at higher education institutions with which UP or its individual members have established an Erasmus+ bilateral agreement._

Physical mobility can last from a minimum of 2 days to a maximum of 2 months, not including travel (up to 2 days can be added for the return journey). Teaching during the mobility must involve at least 8 hours of teaching per week (or for any shorter period of stay). 

####  The application deadline for mobility is November 18, 2024. 

Only complete applications will be accepted, meaning those that include: 
  * A completed online application form. 
  * A proposal for the mobility program for teaching purposes in English (Mobility Agreement for Staff Mobility), for which a signature is not required at the application stage. 

An individual may only apply for one Erasmus+ KA131 mobility for teaching purposes based on this call. 

The call and its attachments include: 
  * [ Erasmus+ KA131 Call ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/calleka1312023teaching.docx)
  * [ Attachment No. 1 - List of Erasmus+ bilateral agreements by UP faculties ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/priloga1eka131bs202127upunik.xlsx)
  * [ Attachment No. 2 - Online application form ](https://vis.upr.si/studij/izmenjavazaposleni/prof_izmenjava_prva.asp)
  * [ Instructions for submitting the online application form ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/instructions-for-submitting-the-applicationstaff-mobility.doc)
  * [ Attachment No. 3 - Mobility Agreement for Staff Mobility for Teaching ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/priloga-st.-3program-za-mobilnostpoucevanjee-ka131z.docx)

More detailed information about the duration and conditions of mobility, mobility grants, and the application procedure can be found in the text of the call and [ UP website ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/686-work-at-up/803-staff-mobility/outgoing-mobility/) . 

For any additional questions, the UP FAMNIT International Office is available at international@famnit.upr.si. 

####  ERASMUS+ OPEN CALL KA131 FOR APPLICATIONS FOR CO-FINANCING OF THE MOBILITY FOR TEACHING 

We are excited to announce the publication of the ERASMUS+ KA131 call for co-financing staff mobility for teaching, released on September 11, 2023. 

The mobility period must be completed by July 31, 2024. The participants can undergo the mobility in the Program countries, i.e. all EU member states, Liechtenstein, Turkey, Serbia, the Republic of North Macedonia, Norway, and Iceland, at the higher education institutions with which UP or UP FAMNIT has an Erasmus+ bilateral agreement. 

Physical mobility can range from a minimum of 2 days to a maximum of 2 months, excluding travel (an additional 2 days are allocated for the return journey). During the mobility, a minimum of 8 hours of teaching per week (or a proportionate amount for shorter stays) must be conducted. 

The deadline for mobility applications is September 25, 2023. 

Only complete applications will be considered valid. These applications must include: 
  * An Application form 
  * A proposal for the mobility program for teaching in English (Mobility Agreement for Teaching.  In the application phase the mobility program does not have to be signed. 

An individual may apply for only one ERASMUS+ KA131 mobility for the purpose of teaching. 

Open Call and Attachments: 
  * [ Erasmus+ KA131 Open Call ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/calleka1312022teaching-1.docx)
  * [ E+ Bilateral Agreements by UP Faculties ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/priloga-st.1annex-n.1fakultete-upfaculties-upeka131bauppoucevanj)
  * [ Online Application ](https://vis.upr.si/studij/izmenjavazaposleni/prof_izmenjava_prva.asp)
  * [ Instructions for submitting the online application ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/instructions-for-submitting-the-applicationstaff-mobility-1.doc)
  * [ Mobility Agreement for Teaching ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/opportunities/annex-n.3mobility-agreement-for-teachinge-ka131.docx)

For more information, including specific details about the mobility period, conditions, mobility grants, and the application process, please refer to the official call. 

If you have any additional questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us at international@famnit.upr.si. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/mednarodno-sodelovanje/studijske-izmenjave/razpis-erasmuszaposleni-ka107/erasmusflag.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

His work combines environmental monitoring, technological innovation, and interdisciplinary scientific education.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/how-to-reach-us](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/how-to-reach-us) # How to reach us University of Primorska Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies Glagoljaška 8 SI-6000 Koper Slovenia
+ 386 (5) 611 75 70 (Administration)
+ 386 (5) 611 75 75 (Student Services)
+ 386 (5) 611 75 71
info@famnit.upr.si
referat@famnit.upr.si
The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) is located in Koper. [ View Larger Map ](http://maps.google.com/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&t=h&msa=0&msid=100093291041901410107.0004622daf5a0d919b202&ll=45.548694,13.726612&spn=0.004786,0.007489&source=embed) #### By plane Nearest airports are: * Ljubljana Jože Pučnik airport (125 km away from Koper) * Aeroporto Ronchi dei Legionari Trieste (66 km away from Koper) * Aeroporto Venezia-Marco Polo (176 km away from Koper) #### By car You can reach Slovenia and Koper via major highways from Italy, Austria, Hungary, and Croatia. Visit the following website for route planners and traffic reports: [ www.viamichelin.com ](http://www.viamichelin.com) . Route directions for Glagoljaška 8, Koper, Slovenia. #### By train Slovenia can be reached by train as there are regular connections with Italy, Austria, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium, Hungary, and Croatia. There are no direct lines to Koper but you have to get to Ljubljana or Trieste (Italy) from where you can reach Koper by local train or bus. #### By bus It is also possible to reach Slovenia and Koper from neighbouring countries by bus. Internal bus transport is well organized and relatively inexpensive. #### By sea An alternative way of getting to Koper from Venice, Italy is by boat. Between late March and October the Prince of Venice, a catamaran, sails between Portorož and Venice (2,5 hours).
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) is located at Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia, with contact details including phone numbers (+386 5 611 75 70–75, 75 71) and emails (info@famnit.upr.si, referat@famnit.upr.si). To reach Koper, travelers can fly into nearby airports (Ljubljana, Trieste, Venice), drive via major highways from neighboring countries using route planners like ViaMichelin, take trains to Ljubljana or Trieste followed by local transport, use buses from neighboring regions, or sail via the Prince of Venice catamaran between Portorož and Venice (seasonal).

##  [ News ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/about-up-iam/employees/en/institut/news)

Tuesday, 27 May 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

[ Election of the Director of UP IAM – 2025 ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 9th regular session held on May 26, 2025, adopted a Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. The Scientific Council of UP IAM, at its 1st extraordinary session held on July 14, 2025, adopted a resolution on the correction of a decision of Resolution to Initiate the Procedure for the Election of the Director of the Andrej Marušič Institute, University of Primorska. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/election-of-the-dire)

Tuesday, 1 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/election-of-the-dire/upogled-600-x-400-px-3.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

[ Candidacy for Director and the Candidate's Work Program ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

The Election Commission for the election of the Director of UP IAM (hereinafter: the Election Commission) has received four proposals for candidacy. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/candidacy-for-direct)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2/objavpostdocs.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

[ Postdoc position in Permutation groups and graph symmetries ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

The Departments of Mathematics of Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of algebraic graph theory and permutation groups, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, titled Extensions of Erdos-Ko-Rado theorem to transitive permutation groups funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-2)

Thursday, 10 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3/objavanovopostd.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

[ Postdoc position in Galois Geometry and Group Actions ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

The Departments of Mathematics of the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies ( _FAMNIT_ ) and Andrej Marušič Institute (IAM) of the University of Primorska are seeking a top early-career researcher for a postdoctoral position in the area of Galois geometry and group actions, in connection with the research grant of Prof. Dr. Michel Lavrauw, titled High-Dimensional Actions of Classical Groups in Galois Geometry funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/postdoc-position-in-3)

Tuesday, 15 July 2025 __

[ ![](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/resources/images//institute/news/work-program-and-the/untitledeng.png:resizeboxcropjpg?198x145) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

[ Work Program and List of Candidates ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)

At its second regular meeting held on July 16, 2025, the Electoral Commission confirmed that the proposed candidate for Director of UP IAM, Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, submitted his Work Program and Curriculum Vitae (CV) within the required deadline. [ Read more ](https://www.iam.upr.si/ en/institute/news/work-program-and-the)
summary: In July 2025, the Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) initiated the election of its new director, with the Scientific Council and Election Commission overseeing the process, including the submission of candidate work programs and the receipt of four candidacy proposals. Two postdoctoral positions were advertised in algebraic graph theory and Galois geometry, funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). The institute also organized several academic conferences and events throughout the fall of 2025, including the Middle-European Conference on Applied Theoretical Computer Science and the InnoRenew CoE International Conference.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming staff](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming staff)

#  Incoming Staff 

UP FAMNIT is proud of its international staff and visiting professors and researchers from all around the world.  More than 70 professors and researchers visit our faculty annually  , while several hundred also attend our events.  Our professors have established numerous contacts with  [ professors and researchers from prestigious foreign universities, who visit us regularly. ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/gostujoci-tekst-en) We cooperate with visitors coming from neighboring countries as well as with those from more distant locations. 

The University of Primorska each year welcomes also administrative and teaching staff from partner universities during International Week. 

[ Find out more about the UP International week 2024! ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/international-week)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/img9721.jpg:resizebox?1100x734)

At UP FAMNIT, international mobility is enabled through the ERASMUS + exchange programs, CEEPUS programme, the Slovenian EEA and NFM Scholarship Fund program, individual bilateral agreements, and outside programmes. 

[ Exchange opportunities for visiting staff ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/mobility/staff/Incoming%20staff/opportunities)

##  TRANFORM4EUROPE (T4EU) 

University of Primorska is proud to be part of [ Transform4Europe (T4EU) ](https://transform4europe.eu/) , an alliance of 11 universities from different countries that have come together to form a unique European University. These institutions are located in liminal regions undergoing significant transformation, where universities play a crucial role in driving innovation, growth, and social change. 

Together, we represent a community of over  150,000 students  and  10,000 researchers  , creating a dynamic, multilingual, and cross-border campus. Through this alliance, we offer joint study programs, collaborative courses, research projects, and events that take place across all partner institutions. This provides our students and staff with diverse opportunities for academic and cultural exchange, fostering a truly European educational experience. 

The T4EU initiative also promotes numerous other activities aimed at building a more integrated and transformative higher education environment across Europe. 

Among these, we highlight the following opportunity for incoming teaching staff: 
  * [ Incoming Visiting Professorship for the Academic Years 2024/2025 and 2025/2026 ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu-/t4eu-opportunities/for-staff/the-university-of-primorska-and-the-university-of-trieste-announce-a-joint-call-for-applications-for)

Further information about the upcoming T4EU events and opportunities for staff mobility is available on the [ UP webpage. ](https://www.upr.si/en/about-university/t4eu/t4eu-dogodki-)

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/mobility/staff/Outgoing%20staff/transform4europecvi-3internet-1-600x161.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

##  Project Guest UP 

** The project  _[ Hosting foreign experts and professors at the University of Primorska (GUEST UP) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/projects/gostup) _ provides co-financing for hosting foreign experts.  ** Visiting professors generally come from the USA, Switzerland, Chile, Japan, Serbia and China. The main objective of the project is to enhance the internationalization of the study and research processes of the faculty and open itself to the international higher education and research sphere.
summary: UP FAMNIT fosters international collaboration through annual visits by over 70 professors and researchers, partnerships with global universities, and programs like ERASMUS +, CEEPUS, and the T4EU alliance, which unites 11 European universities to create a cross-border academic community of 150,000 students and 10,000 researchers. The university also hosts international staff during events like the International Week and supports initiatives such as the GUEST UP project, which funds visits by foreign experts to enhance global research and education ties.

summary: Dr. Vito Vitrih is a Full Professor at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences (FAMNIT) in Koper, Slovenia, affiliated with the Department of Mathematics. His research focuses on numerical mathematics, including multivariate polynomial interpolation, computer-aided geometric design (CAGD), geometric interpolation of curves and surfaces, multidimensional numerical integration, and splines. He teaches courses such as "Selected Topics in Numerical Mathematics" and "Introduction to Numerical Calculations" and serves as the coordinator for the Master's Study Program in Mathematical Sciences. His contact details include an email at vito.vitrih@upr.si and a personal website.

summary: The Institute of Mathematics, Physics, and Mechanics (IAM) at the University of Primorska is led by Director Dr. Vito Vitrih, supported by Institute Secretary Lara Gorela and Assistants to the Director, including Dr. Klavdija Kutnar (Science and Research), Dr. Andreja Kutnar (International Cooperation), and Dr. Marko Orel (Finance). Department heads include Dr. Tomaž Pisanski (Information Sciences and Technologies), Dr. Klavdija Kutnar (Mathematics), Dr. Jure Pražnikar (Technology), and Dr. Dragan Marušič (Health Studies). Key roles also encompass Dr. Diego De Leo (Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research), Dr. Jernej Vičič (Centre for Application Design and Development), and Dr. Matjaž Kljun (deputy head of the latter). The structure emphasizes academic leadership, research, and administrative coordination across specialized departments and centers.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  General information 

Name of the programme: **Psychology**   
Type of programme: Master's degree programme **, 2nd Bologna cycle**   
**Degree awarded:** “magister psihologije” equiv. to a Master’s degree in Psychology   
Duration: **2 years** (4 semesters)   
ECTS-credits: **120**   
**Programme structure:** 15 courses (90 ECTS), practical training (15 ECTS), Master’s Thesis (15 ECTS)   
Mode of study: full-time   
Language of study: Slovene
summary:
The provided document outlines a comprehensive **Master's Program in Psychology** with detailed information on **curriculum structure**, **competencies**, **employment opportunities**, and **program objectives**. Below is a structured summary of the key points:

---

### **1. Program Structure**
- **Core Courses**:  
  - Advanced statistical methods (e.g., multivariate analysis, inferential statistics).  
  - Research design (quantitative/qualitative methods).  
  - Neuroscience, genetics, and behavioral biology.  
  - Psychological assessment, intervention planning, and ethical practices.  
  - Specialized areas: organizational psychology, health psychology, educational psychology, and clinical practice.  

- **Electives/Optional Tracks**:  
  - Focus areas like **clinical psychology**, **organizational psychology**, **health psychology**, or **educational psychology**.  
  - Opportunities for **interdisciplinary research** (e.g., genetics, ethology, social sciences).  

- **Practical Components**:  
  - **Training in psychological interviews** and **intervention planning**.  
  - **Internships** or **practical projects** in healthcare, education, social care, or corporate settings.  
  - **Thesis or research project** (optional, depending on program requirements).  

- **Competency Development**:  
  - Emphasis on **critical thinking**, **research methodology**, **ethical decision-making**, and **practical application** of psychological theories.  

---

### **2. Competencies Developed**
#### **General Competencies**:
- **Professional Development**: Commitment to lifelong learning and self-reflection.  
- **Interdisciplinary Skills**: Ability to integrate research and professional findings across disciplines.  
- **Critical Thinking**: Analyze complex problems, design interventions, and evaluate outcomes.  
- **Communication**: Present research findings, collaborate in teams, and engage with stakeholders.  
- **Ethical Practice**: Develop ethical responsibility in counseling and research.  

#### **Subject-Specific Competencies**:
- **Research Skills**: Design and execute quantitative/qualitative studies, use statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R).  
- **Genetic and Behavioral Analysis**: Understand genetic-environmental interactions, behavioral disorders, and biomarkers.  
- **Clinical and Organizational Psychology**:  
  - Diagnose and treat central nervous system disorders.  
  - Apply organizational psychology to improve workplace dynamics, innovation, and management.  
- **Health and Educational Psychology**:  
  - Design interventions for behavioral/learning difficulties.  
  - Develop educational programs and assess academic achievement.  
- **Public Health and Social Impact**:  
  - Lead interdisciplinary teams in public health interventions.  
  - Advocate for policy and community-based solutions.  

---

### **3. Employment Opportunities**
- **Public Sector**:  
  - Healthcare (e.g., mental health services, hospitals).  
  - Education (with additional pedagogical training).  
  - Social care, justice, and defense sectors.  
  - Non-profit organizations (e.g., rehabilitation, psychosocial support).  

- **Private Sector**:  
  - Corporate roles in **human resources**, **marketing**, **public relations**, and **coaching**.  
  - Therapy and counseling services.  

- **Other Fields**:  
  - Research and administration in social sciences.  
  - Policy development in politics, media, or public health.  

---

### **4. Program Objectives**
- Prepare graduates for **professional practice** in diverse settings (clinical, organizational, educational, etc.).  
- Foster **interdisciplinary expertise** to address complex societal and health challenges.  
- Equip students with **research and analytical skills** to contribute to scientific and practical advancements.  
- Align with **current and future workforce needs** in both public and private sectors.  

---

### **5. Key Takeaways**
- The program emphasizes **theoretical depth** combined with **practical application**.  
- Graduates are trained to work in **multidisciplinary teams** and address **real-world problems** (e.g., mental health, organizational behavior, public health).  
- **Employment versatility** is highlighted, with opportunities in clinical, corporate, educational, and policy domains.  

If you need further details on specific courses, career paths, or program requirements, feel free to ask!

#  Psychology 
##  About the programme [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

The purpose of the programme is to train and develop top-level professional psychologists, whose knowledge, skills and proficiencies will enable them to work independently in fields that require familiarity with the complex determination of individual and group behaviour, and the ability to apply this knowledge to solve contemporary problems in society, groups and individuals, specifically in the fields of (mental) health, a healthy work environment, education, individual development, etc.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Educational and professional goals [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

The main objectives of the programme are: 
  * To educate Master’s-level psychologists whose qualifications will be in compliance with the EuroPsy Certificate. This objective is met by developing professionals whose knowledge, skills and proficiencies (upon the fulfilment of other conditions) will qualify them to work independently in psychological practice. As part of the Master's degree programme, students gain in-depth knowledge and develop advanced skills that enable them to understand, interpret and tackle various issues and problems in contemporary applied fields of psychology. The Master’s degree programme provides its graduates with the knowledge that will qualify them to engage in research and to transfer their findings into practice. 
  * To provide students with in-depth knowledge and skills in the field of psychology and the ability to apply these in various domains. Students will gain an understanding of the functioning of an individual and the impact of various kinds of interventions on an individual, understand the functioning of the brain, the nervous system and their associated pharmacology, and become familiar with cutting-edge diagnostic procedures, which will allow graduates to have a deeper and clearer insight into the determinants of human behaviour. Graduates will be able to participate in fields such as promotion of a healthy and productive way of life and work, prevention of mental disorders, strengthening of (especially) mental health as well as in all other professional and technical areas that are of interest to psychologists. These issues are relevant in the context of influencing individuals, groups and society as a whole. Graduates will acquire the knowledge, skills and proficiencies that will enable them to participate in interdisciplinary planning for prevention, treatment and rehabilitation in various risk groups. Graduates of the Master’s degree programme will be able to actively participate in the creation of policies and practices in the field of mental health. 
  * To familiarise students with findings from various fields of applied psychology, neuroscience, behavioural genetics and psychotherapy, and consequently to enable them to further develop their knowledge in the wider European and global research area and thus engage directly in current multi- and interdisciplinary challenges pertaining to interpretation and prediction of the behaviour of individuals and groups. It is this objective that gives the study programme a competitive advantage and makes it particularly attractive to students. 
  * To develop graduates’ fundamental knowledge, skills and proficiencies in a way that will enable them to engage in lifelong learning and critical thinking, to adopt a problem-solving approach and to use basic methodological and subject-specific knowledge and skills in dealing with various social science and interdisciplinary problems. The programme also stresses ethical responsibility and ethical conduct of graduates.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Admission requirements [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

Admission to the Year 1 of the programme shall be granted to applicants who: 
  * have completed a Bachelor’s (first-cycle) degree programme in the field of psychology or biopsychology that complies with the requirements of the EuroPsy Certificate, earning at least 180 ECTS credits; or 
  * have completed a first-cycle degree programme of at least 180 ECTS credits from the field of biopsychology, having also completed academic requirements of 10 to 42 ECTS credits that are deemed essential for the continuation of their studies, namely from the list of courses in the following subdisciplines: educational psychology, work and organizational psychology, developmental psychology, clinical psychology, research methods, differential psychology and (bio)psychology of motivation and emotions. Upon examination of the candidate’s previous study programme, the competent academic committee of UP FAMNIT shall define each candidate’s additional academic requirements on a case-by-case basis. The additional study requirements may be completed during the candidate’s undergraduate studies, in training programmes or by passing exams before enrolling in the Master's degree programme; or 
  * have completed another first-cycle (Bachelor’s) degree programme, provided that the programme covered at least 120 ECTS credits in topics from the field of psychology and that prior to enrolment the candidate has completed additional academic requirements essential for further studies to the total of 30 to 60 ECTS credits. Suitability of the completed study programme, and consequently the possibility of enrolment in the present programme, is decided upon by the competent academic committee of UP FAMNIT, which reviews the submitted undergraduate study programme the candidate has completed and any other evidence of the proficiencies the candidate has acquired. Having established that the completed study programme potentially allows the candidate to enrol in the Master’s degree programme, the committee then determines the additional academic requirements the candidate must complete, depending on the disciplinary field of the candidate's previous studies. Candidates may complete these additional academic requirements during their undergraduate studies, in training programmes, or by taking exams before enrolling in the Master's degree programme; or 
  * have completed an equivalent training abroad and have been, in the process of recognition of their qualification and in line with the Recognition and Evaluation of Education Act, granted the right to continue their studies at the Master’s degree programme in Psychology. 

In the case of enrolment limitations, applicants shall be selected on the basis of: 
  * success in the selection exam (30 %), 
  * the average grade obtained in their undergraduate study programme (70 %). All study obligations from the undergraduate study programme, including the Final Project Paper, is included in the average grade. The grade-point average of applicants who have completed a study programme under Paragraph 2 or 3 of the conditions for admission to the programme also includes the grades of their additional academic requirements (bridge exams). 

The method of conducting the selection exam will be determined by the committee at UP FAMNIT.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Continuation of studies according to the transfer criteria [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

Transfers between study programmes are possible on the basis of the Higher Education Act, Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes and in accordance with other regulations of this field. 

The transition between study programmes is the enrolment in the higher year of the study programme, in case of leaving the education at the initial study programme and continuing the study process at another study program of the same degree. The transition takes into account the comparability of the study programmes and the completed study obligations of the candidate in the initial study program. 

Access to Year 2 of the Master’s programme of Psychology on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is granted to candidates, provided that the following conditions have been met: 
  * the candidate fulfils the requirements for admission to the study programme of Psychology; 
  * completion of the first study programme which the candidate is transferring from ensures the acquisition of comparable competencies as those envisaged by the study programme of Psychology; and 
  * other conditions in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes have also been met (a comparable course structure, course requirements completed). 

Individual applications for transfer shall be considered by the relevant committee of UP FAMNIT. Apart from comparability between both fields of study, the committee shall also consider comparability between the study programmes, in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes. The applicant may also be required to complete differential exams as defined by the relevant Faculty committee. 

Enrolment on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is also open to candidates of a related study programme abroad who have been, in the process of recognition of their studies abroad, legally granted the right to continue their educational training in the study programme of Psychology. 

In the case of limited enrolment, applicants shall be selected on the basis of the average grade obtained during the study programme they are transferring from.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Advancement requirements [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

Advancement Requirements: To progress to the next year of study it is necessary to earn at least 48 ECTS credits from the courses and exams in the current year of study. 

In exceptional cases, the academic committee of the Faculty may permit students who have not fulfilled all their academic requirements for the current year to enrol in the next year of study. The student must submit a formal written request to the academic committee. Advancement to the next year may be approved if there are justifiable reasons for not completing all academic requirements. 

Students may repeat a year only once during the study period. 

To obtain a Master’s degree, students must successfully complete all the required elements of the programme and defend their Master’s thesis. In order to register their Master’s thesis, students must fulfil all the academic requirements of Year 1 of the programme. Students must complete the remaining academic requirements prior to the submission of the thesis. Students write their Master’s thesis under the guidance of their supervisor (thesis advisor). The thesis must demonstrate the candidate’s expertise in the chosen field, a critical understanding of the related theories and specialized concepts and principles, as well as originality and creativity in the application of knowledge and an ability to tackle a specific problem and to propose appropriate solutions.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Elective courses [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

The elective courses are divided into internal and external elective courses. 

Students choose their **internal elective courses** from those offered by the programme. The list of internal elective courses is outlined in the Course Structure section. Within the scope of internal elective courses, students may also choose other courses from the disciplinary fields of biopsychology and neuroscience. Internal elective subjects are worth 3 or 6 ECTS credits. 

Students can choose their **external elective courses** from those offered by accredited study programmes of higher education institutions in Slovenia or abroad, namely, depending on the student’s previous study programme, from the fields of biopsychology, psychology and science. One elective course can be chosen from the field of humanities (especially anthropology, philosophy and cultural studies). Detailed provisions regarding elective courses are adopted by the Senate of UP FAMNIT. 

Students may also choose a course from the set of internal elective courses as an external elective course. 

In the chapter Course Structure you can only find the elective courses that are offered in the last two academic years. The list of all elective courses is available in the chapter Course Structure - short description of courses. 

Every academic year, the Faculty offers a different selection of elective courses from the internal elective courses listed. The Faculty tries to meet student interests within the limits of the Faculty’s resources. The final selection of elective courses for the next academic year is published in July. The coordinator will help guide students when choosing their elective courses.

chunk:
#  Psychology 
##  Employment opportunities for graduates **** [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/psychology#top)

The Master's degree programme follows the guidelines of current and future recruitment needs in the professional practice of psychologists, both in the private and public sector. 

The graduates – holders of a Master’s degree in Psychology – will be qualified for employment as psychologists in the public sector, in particular in health care, education (upon the fulfilment of additional requirements, namely a completed pedagogical training for learning and adult learning worth 60 ECTS credits, upon harmonization of the legal bases in the field of education and training), social care, justice, defence etc. They will also be able to seek employment in all other areas of the public sector, where psychologists have long been one of the key professional members, for example in non-profit organizations (e.g. in the fields of psychological prevention, rehabilitation, surface treatment, psychosocial care) and in the private sector (e.g. in therapy, counselling). 

Within business enterprises, holders of a Master’s degree in psychology are qualified to work in the fields of human resources, marketing, and public relations, especially in the field of work with human resources, and in the fields of coaching, psychological counselling and work with teams. 

In addition to these areas of employment, graduates of the Master’s degree programme in psychology will also have employment opportunities in other posts that are not specifically related to psychology, but require a broader education in the social sciences (e.g. in the fields of politics, media, research, administration).

Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/%20health-studies](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/%20health-studies)

**Department Head:** Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič 
* * *

**The Department of Health Studies (OPZ)** has excellent experience in the fields of mental health research (suicidology, psychology), kinesiology and e-health. It is involved in a number of local and national health protection, mental health promotion and kinesiology research projects. 

_ Within the department there is also the [ Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (SCRS) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr) , which acts externally as an independent unit. The Centre is especially important in the visibility of work in the field of suicide research, which at the global level is usually academically embedded in special centres.  _

Key **research areas** of the department: 
  * Mental disorders and Mental health, 
  * Suicidology, 
  * Improving the work environment, 
  * Ergonomics and worker health protection, 
  * The effects of different regenerative and therapeutic approaches, 
  * Health protection in the workplace. 

Key **achievements** of the department in the last five years: 
  * Organisation of an annual conference on ergonomics and health for different groups, 
  * Organisation of the annual Triple i Conference - Intuition, Imagination and Innovation in Suicidology, __
  * Obtaining the organisation of the World Congress on [ International Association for Suicide Prevention ](https://www.iasp.info/) in 2023, 
  * Successful training of young researchers, 
  * Prometheus of Science Award 2020, Zois Award 2021. 

In addition to the above achievements, the Department has also produced important publications, which are presented in the section [ publications and books ](https://www3.iam.upr.si/en/events-and-publications/publications-and-books) . 

Key **objectives** of the Department for the next five years: 
  * Organisation of traditional international conferences, 
  * Organisation of the World Congress of the International Association for Suicide Prevention in 2023  , 
  * Successful training of young researchers. 

**Science promotion activities** abound, with staff working with various media to promote the importance of a healthy working environment and the importance of maintaining mental health. The [ zivziv.si ](https://zivziv.si/) website has also been awarded the Prometheus of Science 2020 prize. 
* * *

_[ Researchers from the Department of Health Studies ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies/researchers)   
[ Projects of the Department of Health Studies ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies/projects) _
summary: The Department of Health Studies (OPZ) at IAM, led by Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič, specializes in mental health research (including suicidology and psychology), kinesiology, and e-health, with a focus on mental disorders, workplace health, ergonomics, and therapeutic approaches. It hosts the independent Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (SCRS), enhancing global suicide prevention efforts. Over the past five years, the department has organized key conferences like the Triple i Conference and hosted the 2023 World Congress of the International Association for Suicide Prevention, while earning accolades such as the Prometheus of Science Award (2020) and Zois Award (2021). Its future goals include sustaining international conferences, training young researchers, and promoting science through initiatives like the award-winning zivziv.si platform.

chunk:
Document location: [https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/en/konferenca/impressions](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/en/konferenca/impressions)

#  Impressions 
* * *

###  **Matija Zagoranski** , participant 

![](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images//konferenca/vtisi-mnenja/matija-zagoranski-2.jpg:resizebox?250x176.25)

The Biological-Psychological Student Conference is a great opportunity for every enthusiastic student, to present their work, meet new people who share the same interests and to get familiar with the conference experience. 

Last year’s conference was in my opinion well organized, had a good atmosphere and a varied and interesting program. It was interesting to observe the variety of presentations and how each of them was unique in it’s own way. 
* * *

###  **Hana Hanžek-Turnšek** , participant 

![](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images//konferenca/vtisi-mnenja/img0801lukakostadinovski-2.jpg:resizebox?250x176.25)

I am very happy to have attended the first biological-psychological conference, which allowed me, as a naturalist, to get acquainted with some of the social sciences. At such events, we also meet people outside our bubbles and thus build bridges between seemingly opposing disciplines (“naturalists versus social scientists”). 

I believe such collaborations between students of different programs are crucial for addressing current social issues and I wish there will be more interdisciplinary events in Koper. At the same time, I look forward for the next implementation of this conference. 
* * *

###  **Mojca Pungerčar** , conference co-chair 

![](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images//konferenca/vtisi-mnenja/img0301lukakostadinovski.jpg:resizebox?250x176.25)

I am Mojca Pungerčar. Last year I was one of the two presidents of the student conference. I am very proud and happy that we held a student conference for the first time at the University of Primorska last year! 

There is a lack of such events where students can present their research work in public, especially in their mother tongue, so it is important that we preserve this story and proudly pass it on to future generations. 
* * *

###  **Larisa Lara Pohorec** , participant 

![](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images//konferenca/vtisi-mnenja/img0953lukakostadinovski-2.jpg:resizebox?250x176.25)

Student conferences encourage the integration of knowledge and skill, acquired during college studies. They represent a bridge from student to researcher as they bring the first taste of such responsibility. The conference offers a network of likeminded people, allowing us to broaden our horizons. 

The first conference was elegantly organized and it would be my wish for it to become and stay a tradition. 
* * *

###  **Ines Knežević** , organizer & participant 

![](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images//konferenca/vtisi-mnenja/img0965lukakostadinovski-2.jpg:resizebox?250x176.25)

My primary role working for the conference was organization, which proved to be a big challenge for me. I had no previous experience and learned along the way which was exciting. Seeing my hard work come to life, not only that but seeing it succeed and get a positive feedback was as rewarding as can be. 

As a team we felt even more connected and proud seeing the conference succeed. 

Last minute i decided to join as a speaker as well as organizer, which was a big step for me, but I am proud of it and do not regret a thing. the whole experience gave me a feeling of competence and pride that I can now carry into new exciting projects.
summary: The Biological-Psychological Student Conference at the University of Primorska was praised by participants and organizers for its successful organization, engaging atmosphere, and interdisciplinary focus, fostering collaboration between naturalists and social scientists. Attendees highlighted the event’s role in bridging academic disciplines, providing students with a platform to present research, gain experience, and build networks, while organizers expressed pride in creating a meaningful tradition that empowers students to transition from learners to researchers.

Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies)

**Department Head:** Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič 
* * *

**The Department of Health Studies (OPZ)** has excellent experience in the fields of mental health research (suicidology, psychology), kinesiology and e-health. It is involved in a number of local and national health protection, mental health promotion and kinesiology research projects. 

_ Within the department there is also the [ Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (SCRS) ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr) , which acts externally as an independent unit. The Centre is especially important in the visibility of work in the field of suicide research, which at the global level is usually academically embedded in special centres.  _

Key **research areas** of the department: 
  * Mental disorders and Mental health, 
  * Suicidology, 
  * Improving the work environment, 
  * Ergonomics and worker health protection, 
  * The effects of different regenerative and therapeutic approaches, 
  * Health protection in the workplace. 

Key **achievements** of the department in the last five years: 
  * Organisation of an annual conference on ergonomics and health for different groups, 
  * Organisation of the annual Triple i Conference - Intuition, Imagination and Innovation in Suicidology, __
  * Obtaining the organisation of the World Congress on [ International Association for Suicide Prevention ](https://www.iasp.info/) in 2023, 
  * Successful training of young researchers, 
  * Prometheus of Science Award 2020, Zois Award 2021. 

In addition to the above achievements, the Department has also produced important publications, which are presented in the section [ publications and books ](https://www3.iam.upr.si/en/events-and-publications/publications-and-books) . 

Key **objectives** of the Department for the next five years: 
  * Organisation of traditional international conferences, 
  * Organisation of the World Congress of the International Association for Suicide Prevention in 2023  , 
  * Successful training of young researchers. 

**Science promotion activities** abound, with staff working with various media to promote the importance of a healthy working environment and the importance of maintaining mental health. The [ zivziv.si ](https://zivziv.si/) website has also been awarded the Prometheus of Science 2020 prize. 
* * *

_[ Researchers from the Department of Health Studies ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies/researchers)   
[ Projects of the Department of Health Studies ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/health-studies/projects) _
summary: The Department of Health Studies (OPZ) at IAM, led by Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič, specializes in mental health research (suicidology, psychology), kinesiology, and e-health, with a focus on mental disorders, workplace health, ergonomics, and therapeutic approaches. It hosts the independent Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research (SCRS), enhancing global suicide prevention visibility. Key achievements include organizing annual conferences, hosting the 2023 World Congress of the International Association for Suicide Prevention, and winning awards like the Prometheus of Science (2020) and Zois Award (2021). The department aims to sustain international conferences, train young researchers, and promote science through media and initiatives like the award-winning zivziv.si website.

summary: The Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM) at the University of Primorska announced the initiation and correction of the director election process in May and July 2025, with four candidates submitting their applications, including Prof. Dr. Vito Vitrih, who submitted his work program and CV by deadline. The institute also advertised two postdoctoral positions in algebraic graph theory/permutation groups and Galois geometry/group actions, funded by the Slovenian Research and Innovation Agency (ARIS). Concurrently, UP IAM and affiliated departments hosted several academic events in 2025, including conferences on applied theoretical computer science, Slovenian mathematics, and discrete mathematics, as well as the GAP Days Summer 2025 workshop.

#  Welcome to the fourth edition of the Biological-Psychological Student Conference 
* * *

This is a conference made by students for students. Our goal is to gather as many people as possible regardless of their age, gender or nationality in order to promote science in all forms. If you are interested in broadening your knowledge about biology and psychology, upgrading your presentation skills or you just enjoy meeting new people and expanding your connections, this is the perfect event for you. 
* * *

The Biological-Psychological Student Conference is divided in two modules which will run in parallel: 
  * Biological module 
  * Psychological module 

The biological module refers to study programmes in the field of biology, environmental science, nature protection and similar study programmes. 

The psychological module refers to study programmes in the field of psychology, biopsychology, psychotherapy and neuroscience. Psychological works will be divided into three parts: as an empirical work, a systematic literature review or as a presentation of an interesting topic / project / seminar. 

Students from other study programmes (e.g. pedagogic study programmes) can also participate if they are applying with a research based on a biological or psychological topic. 

The contributions can be in Slovenian or English. 
* * *

Each individual can participate by presenting: 
  * Bachelor, master and doctorate thesis 
  * Research work 
  * Group projects ( **but presented by an individual*** ) 
  * Seminars 
  * Interesting topics 

in form of **oral presentations** or **posters** . 

Besides, anyone is welcomed to join the conference as a listener without any kind of presentation. 
* Presentations can also be part of group work, but only one student can represent at the conference!!!! Other members can, of course, register for the conference as passive participants. 
* * *

The scientific committee will review the abstracts, oral presentations and posters, and at the end of the conference, the best contributions will be awarded. The abstracts will be included in the book of abstracts, which will be uploaded on the Slovenian library information system (COBISS). 

The scientific works will be divided in two categories, according to the level of study during which the work was prepared: 
  * Undergraduate study 
  * Master and doctoral studies 
* * *

#####  The conference will take place in Koper, from September 18th to 20th 2025. 
* * *

This event will be enhanced with interesting lectures by our guest speakers and social program. 
* * *

#####  REGISTRATIONS FOR PASSIVE PARTICIPATION WILL BE OPEN IN AUGUST! 

Conference fee for passive participation is 15 euros. 

It is also possible to register as a passive participant who would like to attend student presentations and lectures by guest speakers, with the possibility of participating in the social program. 

Registration fee for passive participants is 15 euros. 

The number of participants is limited, so don't hesitate to register!
summary: The fourth edition of the Biological-Psychological Student Conference, held in Koper from September 18–20, 2025, is a student-led event aimed at fostering scientific exchange across biology, psychology, and related fields. Participants can present research, theses, group projects, or seminars (as oral presentations or posters) in Slovenian or English, with submissions divided into undergraduate and graduate categories. The conference features parallel modules for biology and psychology, with the latter including empirical work, literature reviews, or topic presentations, and allows interdisciplinary participation for students from other programs. Passive attendees can join for lectures, social activities, and networking, with a registration fee of €15. The scientific committee will evaluate submissions, award top contributions, and publish abstracts in a COBISS catalog.

chunk:
Document location: [https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/en/](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/en/)

#  Welcome to the fourth edition of the Biological-Psychological Student Conference 
* * *

BY STUDENTS FOR STUDENTS 
* * *

The student conference is organised by us, students of the Department of Biodiversity and Department of Psychology at the Faculty for Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technoies (University of Primorska). This event is intended for students of biological and psychological sciences, who have done various research or have written final thesis during their studies and would like to share their acquired knowledge with an audience and a scientific committee, which will review their work. As a presenter at the Biological-Psychological Student Conference, you will get your certificate of participation and a reference in COBISS. Such kind of reference will be useful when applying for a job in your scientific field or applying for a scholarship. 

You can also attend the conference as a listener and broaden your knowledge in the field of science! 

As students, we are aware that there are just few opportunities to share our knowledge and experience, that is why we want to organise such scientific event, where students can prove themselves! The aim of our conference is to bring together students and enable them to present their own scientific work and thus promote science in all its forms. If you are interested in spreading knowledge about biology and psychology, upgrading your presentation skills or you would like to meet new people and expand your connections, this event is ideal for you. 
* * *

#####  REGISTRATIONS FOR ACTIVE PARTICIPATION ARE OPEN! 
* * *

Find out more in the tab “ [ About conference ](https://bio-psi-konferenca.famnit.upr.si/en/konferenca) ”. 

[ CONFERENCE STARTS IN ](https://logwork.com/countdown-xoys)
summary: The fourth edition of the Biological-Psychological Student Conference, organized by students from the Faculty for Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies at the University of Primorska, invites biology and psychology students to present their research or thesis work to a scientific audience. Participants receive participation certificates and COBISS references, enhancing their academic and career prospects, while attendees gain insights into scientific advancements. The event aims to foster knowledge sharing, skill development, and networking among students, with active participation registrations now open.

Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr)

**Head of Centre** **:** Prof. Dr. Diego de Leo 

**Deputy Head** **:** Prof. Vita Poštuvan 
* * *

**The Slovene Centre for Suicide Research (SCSR)** was established in 2011. This special unit within UP IAM address a specific research area related to the study and prevention of suicidal behaviour. The vision of the Centre is to provide high quality research to better understand and explain suicidal behaviour, which will contribute to both suicide prevention and support for loved ones bereaved by suicide.   
To raise awareness of suicide among the general public, the Centre has launched an online platform, [ Živ? Živ! ](https://zivziv.si/slovene-centre-for-suicide-research/) , where you can find out more about our work and projects. 

Key **areas** of the Centre's research: 
  * Studying suicidal behaviour, 
  * Prevention of suicidal behaviour, 
  * Psychological interventions, 
  * Mental health, 
  * Loneliness, 
  * Loved ones after suicide, 
  * Grieving, 
  * Social perceptions, attitudes, 
  * Human rights, 
  * Ethics, 
  * Qualitative and Quantitative research, 
  * Behavioural-cognitive therapy, 
  * Crisis interventions. 

Key **achievements** of the Centre over the last five years: 
  * Publications in prestigious journals (such as [ The Lancet ](https://www.thelancet.com/) ), 
  * Mental health interventions, 
  * Obtaining the organisation of the World Congress of the International Association for Suicide Prevention [ (IASP) ](https://www.iasp.info/) in Slovenia in 2023, 
  * Prometheus of Science Award 2020, Zois Award 2021. 

Key **objectives** of the Centre for the next five years: 
  * Reducing the suicide rate in Slovenia; 
  * Using a wide range of high-quality research methods to better understand and explain suicidal behaviour; 
  * Providing effective interventions and treatment options to prevent suicide and the  support to loved ones after suicide; 
  * Working to tackle the stigma associated with suicidal behaviour; 
  * Providing education and training for university students and other interested members of the public; 
  * Participation in national and international associations. 

The Centre's key **annual event** is the organisation of the international conference [ TRIPLE i - Intuition, Imagination, and Innovation in Suicidology ](https://zivziv.si/triple-i/) .   
All key **publications** are also available at the [ Živ? Živ! website ](https://zivziv.si/publikacije/) . 

Science promotion activities: [ Živ? Živ! ](https://zivziv.si/) platform, [ iŽiv ](https://zivziv.si/iziv/) web app, [ media publications ](https://zivziv.si/mediji/) , and interventions to promote mental health. 
* * *

_[ Researchers at the Slovene Centre for Suicide Research ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr/researchers)   
[ Slovene Centre for Suicide Research projects ](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/departments-and-centres/scsr/projects) _
summary: The Slovene Centre for Suicide Research (SCSR), established in 2011 at UP IAM, focuses on understanding and preventing suicidal behavior through high-quality research, aiming to enhance suicide prevention and support for bereaved families. Led by Prof. Dr. Diego de Leo and Prof. Vita Poštuvan, the Centre addresses areas such as mental health, loneliness, crisis interventions, and social perceptions, while promoting awareness via its platform Živ? Živ! and initiatives like the TRIPLE i international conference. Over the past five years, it has achieved notable milestones, including publications in top journals, hosting the IASP World Congress in 2023, and receiving prestigious awards. Its five-year objectives include reducing Slovenia’s suicide rate, combating stigma, and advancing education and training, alongside participation in global associations and science promotion through media and digital tools.

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/electiveness](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/electiveness)

#  Electiveness 

##  Electiveness at UP FAMNIT 

Elective courses are divided into _internal electives_ and _external electives_ . All courses are evaluated according to the European Credit Transfer System (ECTS). 

INTERNAL electives are chosen by the student within the study programme; the set of internal electives is presented in the Course structure of each study programme. 

EXTERNAL elective courses may be chosen by the student within the framework of accredited study programmes of higher education institutions in Slovenia or abroad. Within the framework of external electives, the student may choose courses from the study programmes listed in the Electives courses section of each study programme. Some study programmes also offer the possibility to choose from study programmes in other fields of study or from a range of internal electives. 

##  Electiveness at the University of Primorska 

The University of Primorska offers students elective courses from various fields. The Rules of electiveness at the University of Primorska enables students to select courses at other faculties of the University of Primorska. Students can complete their study obligations at other faculties and collect credit points that will be recognized as completed study obligations at UP FAMNIT. 

Students must carefully read the content restrictions of elective courses of their study programme. Content for each study programme is available on the UP FAMNIT website: 
  * Undergraduate study programmes: [ https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate)
  * Master's study programmes: [ https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master)

More detailed information on the electivness procedure is provided in t  he [ Rules of electiveness at the University of Primorska ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/elective-courses/p01pravilnik-izvajanje-izbirnsoti-med-clanicami-up.pdf) _(only in Slovene)_ . 

Call for applications, application form and the list of offered courses are available on the University of Primorska [ website. ](https://www.upr.si/en/study--enrolment/88-elective-courses/)

Academic Year 2025/26: The deadline for the submission of the application for the electiveness at the University of Primorska is _Monday**, 6 October 2025.** _

##  Electiveness at other institutions of higher education in Slovenia 

Students may, within the National Mobility Program, also complete a part of their study obligations in a similar study programme at other Slovenian universities. Mobility should not last less than 3 months and not more than 12 months and must be evaluated with at least 15 ECTS per semester. 

Students who meet the following conditions may apply: 
  * have completed at least the first year of study at the Undergraduate or Master’s study programme; 
  * are regular students at the home university in the time of the mobility. 

The Student Exchange Agreement is available [ here ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/elective-courses/sporazum-o-izmenjavistudentov.pdf) (in Slovenian language). 

Students can submit the application at the faculty of their home university (the university where they are enrolled) by the 15  th  of May for the winter semester and by 15  th  of November for the spring semester. The application includes the following documentation: 
  * [ Application Form ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/elective-courses/prijavniobr.pdf) (in Slovenian language), 
  * [ Study agreement ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/elective-courses/studijskisporazum.pdf) (in Slovenian language), 
  * and the certificate of passed exams (home university).
summary: The document outlines electiveness policies at UP FAMNIT and the University of Primorska, distinguishing between internal electives (chosen within the study program) and external electives (from accredited Slovenian or international institutions). Students can fulfill study obligations through cross-faculty courses at the University of Primorska, with specific deadlines and content restrictions outlined. Slovenian mobility programs allow students to complete study obligations at other universities, requiring at least 3 months of stay and 15 ECTS per semester, with applications due by May 15th (winter) or November 15th (spring). All processes involve ECTS evaluation, Slovene-language forms, and adherence to institutional rules.

summary:
The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska for the 2010/11 academic year had **417 students**, comprising **234 freshmen**, **136 undergraduates**, **57 master’s students**, and **30 doctoral candidates**. The student-to-faculty ratio was **4.81**, with a gender split of **53% female** and **47% male**. International students accounted for **13** individuals. The faculty offered **8 undergraduate programs** (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Biodiversity), **3 master’s programs**, and **2 doctoral programs**, all following the **ECTS system**. 

Staff included **101 employees** (69 teaching/research, 10 administrative), with **68.3% male** and **31.7% female** among teaching staff. Financial resources totaled **€1.8 million**, primarily from education funds (**€1.536 million**) and research grants (**€177,723**). Leadership was headed by **Dean Prof. Dragan Marušič**, with **Vice-Deans** for Science/Research and Education, and department chairs overseeing specialized areas like Mathematics, Information Sciences, and Biodiversity. 

Located in Koper, Slovenia, FAMNIT provided contact details for administration and student services, emphasizing its role in education and research across **life sciences, mathematics, computing, engineering, agriculture, and environmental protection**. The faculty also highlighted its international collaborations and contributions to academic journals like *Ars Mathematica Contemporanea*. 

*(Word count: 150)*

summary:
The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska for the 2010/11 academic year had **417 students**, comprising **234 freshmen**, **136 undergraduates**, **57 master’s students**, and **30 doctoral candidates**. The student-to-faculty ratio was **4.81**, with a gender split of **53% female** and **47% male**. International students accounted for **13** individuals. The faculty offered **8 undergraduate programs** (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Biodiversity), **3 master’s programs**, and **2 doctoral programs**, all following the **ECTS system**. 

Staff included **101 employees** (69 teaching/research, 10 administrative), with **68.3% male** and **31.7% female** among teaching staff. Financial resources totaled **€1.8 million**, primarily from education funds (**€1.536 million**) and research grants (**€177,723**). Leadership was headed by **Dean Prof. Dragan Marušič**, with **Vice-Deans** for Science/Research and Education, and department chairs overseeing specialized areas like Mathematics, Information Sciences, and Biodiversity. 

Located in Koper, Slovenia, FAMNIT provided contact details for administration and student services, emphasizing its role in education and research across **life sciences, mathematics, computing, engineering, agriculture, and environmental protection**. The faculty also highlighted its international collaborations and contributions to academic journals like *Ars Mathematica Contemporanea*. 

*(Word count: 150)*

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers/c-positive-psychology](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/faculty-centers/c-positive-psychology)

#  Positive Psychology Center 

The Positive Psychology Center at UP FAMNIT is the first Slovenian center in this field, founded in 2017. 

Positive psychology is a modern psychological field that has proved in the last 20 years as one of central major directions in psychology, with its presence in many research and application fields. 

Its beginnings date back to the 1950s, but it is considered that the research field began officially in 1998, when an American psychologist dr. Martin Seligman chose positive psychology as the theme of his presidency the American Psychological Association. According to Seligman, psychology should focus not only on problem-solving but also on developing positive emotions that lead to personal happiness. Positive thinking is more likely to lead to problem solving, better quality of life and an overall better immune system, and consequently health. 

#  Vision and mission 

Although Positive Psychology is one of the more influential directions in psychology in the last 20 years, there were no research centers in Slovenia from this field. Nevertheless, due to the vast scope of applied knowledge of positive psychology, the need for further development within psychology is undeniable. The vision of the center is to become one of the most important and central Slovenian research and professional centers in the field of psychology. 

The Center establishes an opportunity for additional research and professional networking of members of the Department of Psychology at UP FAMNIT and connects other centers and individuals, both within the University of Primorska and in Slovenia, as well as beyond. 

In addition, it offers the possibility of professional and scientific participation of students in the programs Biopsychology (1st and 2nd level) in Psychology (2nd level), and the possibility of additional development of competencies, both for students and faculty graduates. 

#  Head of the Positive Psychology Center 

The head of the Center is doc. dr. Kristijan Musek Lešnik, a psychologist with twenty years of experience in the field of education and management. 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/fakultetni-centri/c-pozitivna%20psihologija/musek-lesnik.png:resizebox?440x440)
summary: The Positive Psychology Center at UP FAMNIT, established in 2017, is Slovenia’s first dedicated center in this field, founded on the principles of positive psychology—a modern psychological discipline that gained prominence in the 1990s through Martin Seligman’s advocacy, emphasizing well-being, resilience, and positive emotions as pathways to personal happiness and health. The center aims to become a leading Slovenian research and professional hub, fostering collaboration among faculty, students, and external partners, while offering opportunities for academic and professional development in psychology programs. Led by doc. dr. Kristijan Musek Lešnik, a seasoned psychologist with extensive experience in education and management, the center bridges research, application, and interdisciplinary networking to advance positive psychology’s impact in Slovenia and beyond.

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the key information from the document about the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska**:

---

### **Key Highlights**
1. **Leadership**  
   - **Dean**: Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Science and Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Education**: Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD  
   - **Departments' Chairs**:  
     - Department of Mathematics: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
     - Department of Information Sciences and Technologies: Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD  
     - Department of Biodiversity: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
     - Department of Applied Natural Sciences: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
     - Department of Psychology: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  

2. **Notable Projects**  
   - **GReGAS Project**:  
     - First European mathematical project coordinated from Slovenia.  
     - Focus: Geometric representations and symmetries of graphs, maps, and discrete structures with applications in science.  
     - Partners: Croatia, Germany, Slovakia, Turkey, and associated institutions in Austria, Israel, New Zealand, UK, and the US.  
     - Funded under the Eurocordes/Eurogiga program.  
   - **ARS MATHEMATICA CONTTEMPORANEA (AMC)**:  
     - International journal co-created by the University of Primorska and the Slovenian Mathematical Society.  
     - Included in the **Science Citation Index (SCI)** in 2011, a milestone for Slovenian mathematics.  
     - Editors-in-Chief: Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD.  

3. **International Collaborations & Events**  
   - **SYGN III Workshop**:  
     - Third international workshop on "Symmetries of Graphs and Networks" (24–30 June 2012, Rogla).  
     - 68 participants (28 Slovenian, 40 international) including 30 doctoral students and 9 invited speakers.  
   - **Bioinformatics Workshop**:  
     - "Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics" (13–14 September 2012, Koper).  
     - Organized with the University of Bielefeld, Germany.  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - Hosted events like the **Trilateral Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics**.  

4. **Academic Achievements**  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - FAMNIT collaborates with institutions in Slovenia, Germany, and other European countries.  
   - **Research Impact**:  
     - Contributions to discrete mathematics, bioinformatics, and geometric representations of graphs.  

---

### **Contact Information**  
**University of Primorska**  
**Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
**Glagoljaška 8**  
**SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  

- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 70 (Administration)  
- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 75 (Student Services)  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Email**: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si) | [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Additional Resources**  
- **GReGAS Project Website**: [http://www.gregas.eu](http://www.gregas.eu)  
- **AMC Journal**: [http://amc.imfm.si](http://amc.imfm.si)  
- **FAMNIT Events Archive**: [http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference)  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT's academic strengths, collaborative projects, and international engagement. For specific details about a project, event, or publication, further exploration of the provided links or direct contact with the faculty is recommended.

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the key information from the document about the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska**:

---

### **Key Highlights**
1. **Leadership**  
   - **Dean**: Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Science and Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Education**: Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD  
   - **Departments' Chairs**:  
     - Department of Mathematics: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
     - Department of Information Sciences and Technologies: Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD  
     - Department of Biodiversity: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
     - Department of Applied Natural Sciences: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
     - Department of Psychology: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  

2. **Notable Projects**  
   - **GReGAS Project**:  
     - First European mathematical project coordinated from Slovenia.  
     - Focus: Geometric representations and symmetries of graphs, maps, and discrete structures with applications in science.  
     - Partners: Croatia, Germany, Slovakia, Turkey, and associated institutions in Austria, Israel, New Zealand, UK, and the US.  
     - Funded under the Eurocordes/Eurogiga program.  
   - **ARS MATHEMATICA CONTTEMPORANEA (AMC)**:  
     - International journal co-created by the University of Primorska and the Slovenian Mathematical Society.  
     - Included in the **Science Citation Index (SCI)** in 2011, a milestone for Slovenian mathematics.  
     - Editors-in-Chief: Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD.  

3. **International Collaborations & Events**  
   - **SYGN III Workshop**:  
     - Third international workshop on "Symmetries of Graphs and Networks" (24–30 June 2012, Rogla).  
     - 68 participants (28 Slovenian, 40 international) including 30 doctoral students and 9 invited speakers.  
   - **Bioinformatics Workshop**:  
     - "Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics" (13–14 September 2012, Koper).  
     - Organized with the University of Bielefeld, Germany.  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - Hosted events like the **Trilateral Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics**.  

4. **Academic Achievements**  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - FAMNIT collaborates with institutions in Slovenia, Germany, and other European countries.  
   - **Research Impact**:  
     - Contributions to discrete mathematics, bioinformatics, and geometric representations of graphs.  

---

- **AMC Journal**: [http://amc.imfm.si](http://amc.imfm.si)
