##  Research Information [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2012-2013#top)

UP FAMNIT has established close cooperation in the field of research with the University of Primorska, Andrej Marušič Institute ( [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ), where most of the UP FAMNIT academic staff conduct their research. Some professors also conduct research as part of the Science and Research Centre at the University of Primorska ( [ UP ZRS ](http://www.zrs.upr.si/en) ) and the Institute of Mathematics, Physics and Mechanics ( [ IMFM ](http://www.imfm.si/) ). 

Original Scientific Articles of the UP FAMNIT research group ("Raziskovalna skupina UP FAMNIT") _**in 2012** _ (1.1.2012-31.12.2012) (source: [ Sicris ](http://sicris.izum.si/search/grp.aspx?lang=eng&id=3598&opt=1) ): 
  * SCI Expanded: 89 (32/27/15/15) 
  * A&HCI and SSCI: 0 
  * Other: 6 
  * _Altogether:_ 95 

Original Scientific Articles of the UP IAM research group ("Raziskovalna skupina UP IAM") _**in 2012** _ (1.1.2012-31.12.2012) (source: [ Sicris ](http://sicris.izum.si/search/grp.aspx?lang=eng&id=2468&opt=1) ): 
  * SCI Expanded: 83 (18/29/20/16) 
  * A&HCI and SSCI: 0 
  * Other: 6 
  * _Altogether:_ 89 

Total research expenditures of UP FAMNIT and UP IAM **_in 2012_ : ** 1.420.556 EUR

chunk:
#  Quick Facts about Famnit 2012/13 
##  Highlights from 2012 [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2012-2013#top)

Below are  some of the key achievements of the Faculty in 2012. 

####  The 2012 Zois Award goes to Assoc. Prof. Štefko Miklavič  , PhD 

** On 23 November 2012, Assoc. [ Prof. Štefko Miklavič, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/stefko.miklavic/) , lecturer and researcher at FAMNIT UP and [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) and Vice Rector for Science and Research at the University of Primorska, received the prestigious Zois Award in recognition of his scientific achievements in mathematics. This is one of the most prestigious awards for achievements in science, research and development activities, conferred by the Republic of Slovenia to researchers within the Republic of Slovenia for their outstanding achievements and lasting contribution to science, research and development.  **   
For further information on the  Zois  Awards, visit [ > ](http://www.arhiv.mvzt.gov.si/en/areas_of_work/science_and_technology/activity/awards_and_certificates_of_recognition_conferred_for_outstanding_achievements_in_scientific_research_and_development_activities/)

[ ![Assoc. Prof. Štefko Miklavič, PhD at the Zois Award Ceremony \(Nova Gorica, 23 November 2012\)](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/miklaviczoisovopriznanje-23112012fotosta.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/miklaviczoisovopriznanje-23112012fotosta.jpg) Assoc. Prof. Štefko Miklavič, PhD at the Zois Award Ceremony (Nova Gorica, 23 November 2012) 

####  Prof. Andrej Brodnik, PhD is the recipient of the Award of the Republic of Slovenia in the field of education for 2012 

On 4 October 2012, [ **Prof. Andrej Brodnik, PhD** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/andrej.brodnik/) , lecturer and researcher at UP FAMNIT and [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) , received the prestigious Award of the Republic of Slovenia in the field of education for 2012. The award  is conferred in recognition of  outstanding achievements and lifetime achievement in the field of education. For further information on the Awards of the Republic of Slovenia for the field of education, visit  [ > ](http://www.mizks.gov.si/si/medijsko_sredisce/nagrade_in_priznanja/nagrade_rs_na_podrocju_solstva/#c635)

[ ![Minister of Education, Science, Culture and Sport, Dr. Žiga Turk, presenting the award to Prof. Andrej Brodnik, PhD \(Ljubljana, 4 October 2012\)](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/fotobrodnikministerturk.jpg:resizebox?462x298) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/fotobrodnikministerturk.jpg) Minister of Education, Science, Culture and Sport, Dr. Žiga Turk,  presenting  the award to Prof. Andrej Brodnik, PhD (Ljubljana, 4 October 2012) 

####  Teachers and researchers of UP FAMNIT, recipients of University awards 

Each year, the University of  Primorska honours its best teachers and researchers with various awards and prizes. In 2012, the winners included the lecturers and researchers of UP FAMNIT who had demonstrated outstanding achievements in teaching and/or research in 2011. Award recipients in 2012 were: 
  * [ **Assoc. Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/bojan.kuzma/) received the "Zlata plaketa Univerze na Primorskem / Golden Prize of the University of Primorska" award, 
  * [ **Assist. Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/martin.milanic/) received an award from the Fund for Scientific Excellence of the University of Primorska, 
  * [ **Assist. Prof. Branko Kavšek, PhD** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/branko.kavsek/) and [ **Boštjan Frelih, MSc** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/bostjan.frelih/) , received an award from the Fund for Educational Excellence of the University of Primorska. 

[ ![Recipient of the Golden Prize of the University of Primorska, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Bojan Kuzma](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3154w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3154w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for Scientific Excellence Award, Assist.Prof. Dr. Martin Milanič](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3044w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3044w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for Scientific Excellence Award, Assist.Prof. Dr. Martin Milanič](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3049w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3049w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the Golden Prize of the University of Primorska, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Bojan Kuzma](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3165w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3165w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for  Educational Excellence Award, Assist. Prof. Dr. Branko Kavšek](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3015w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/5.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for  Educational Excellence Award, Assist. Prof. Dr. Branko Kavšek](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3010w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3010w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for Educational Excellence Award, Bostjan Frelih, MSc](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3023w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3023w.jpg) [ ![Recipient of the University of Primorska Fund for Educational Excellence Award, Bostjan Frelih, MSc](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3026w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3026w.jpg) View photos from the award ceremony...   

####  Enrolment of first-rate international students 

The degree programmes offered by UP FAMNIT have proven to be increasingly attractive to students from abroad. UP FAMNIT is enrolling students from Belgium, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Croatia, Italy, Macedonia, Mexico, Poland, Russia, Serbia and Ukraine. In the last two academic years, the Faculty has recorded a growing number of international students with excellent track records in national and international mathematics competitions. In the 2012/13 academic year, a total of 6 international students with excellent secondary-school records enrolled in Year 1 of the undergraduate programmes of Mathematics and Mathematics in Economics and Finance (as compared to 2 students enrolling in 2011/12). For these students, the Faculty offers certain courses also in English. 

[ ![Six international students enrolled in the programme of Mathematics in the 2012/13 academic year at a formal reception hosted by the Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD \(first left\). Also in this photo, the Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assist. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD \(second left\). The gathering was held at the University Rectorate on 22 October 2012.](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/img5498.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/img5498.jpg) Six international students enrolled in the programme of Mathematics in the 2012/13 academic year at a formal reception hosted by the Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD (first left). Also in this photo, the Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assoc. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD (second left). The gathering was held at the University Rectorate on 22 October 2012. 

####  Nastja Cepak is the recipient of the University of Primorska Srečko Kosovel Award 

Each year, the University of Primorska presents its best students with the Srečko Kosovel Award. Nastja Cepak, a graduate of the Bachelor’s degree programme of [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) , received this award for her final thesis entitled "Rubik's Cube". Her excellent thesis exceeds the requirements of undergraduate study and demonstrates the graduate’s creative and innovative skills in solving mathematical problems within a complex context, while also showing her great potential for competitive independent scientific research in the wider field of mathematical science. In the 2012/13 academic year, Nastja Cepak is continuing her studies at the Master’s degree programme of [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) at UP FAMNIT. 

[ ![Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, and Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assist. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD, presenting the Srečko Kosovel Award to graduate Nastja Cepak.](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/nastja1.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc3177w.jpg) Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, and Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assoc. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD, presenting the Srečko Kosovel Award to graduate Nastja Cepak. 

####  UP FAMNIT is actively involved in various activities aimed at promoting natural sciences 

In 2012, the Faculty hosted two national competitions for secondary school pupils. Having participated for the first time in organising national mathematical competitions for secondary school pupils in 2011, the Faculty enhanced its involvement in 2012 by hosting the **12th national biology competition** (24 March 2012) and the **56th national mathematics competition** (20 April 2012).   
The mathematics competition saw the participation of 171 pupils (and their mentors), who had achieved top results at regional competitions. Organised by the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia (DMFA), the competition was held on the premises of Gimnazija Koper. Apart from UP FAMNIT, it was also hosted by [ UP PEF ](http://www.pef.upr.si/eng/) and Gimnazija Koper.   
At the national competition in biology, organized by the Association for Technical Culture of Slovenia in cooperation with the Natural History Society of Slovenia, a total of 284 pupils competed for silver and golden Proteus Awards and for the titles of national champions. The competition was judged by a panel of assessors, which included students of the UP FAMNIT undergraduate [ Biodiversity ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/biodiv-first/) programme. 

[ ![Students of UP FAMNIT participating as assessors at the 12th national biology competition](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc5222.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc5222.jpg) Students of UP FAMNIT participating as assessors at the 12th national biology competition 

####  The Trimo Research Award goes to Irman Abdić, graduate of UP FAMNIT 

Irman Abdić, graduate of the [ Computer Science Bachelor’s programme ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/cs-first/) , received the Trimo Research Award for his final thesis entitled "Audio toolkit for displaying a spectrogram in real time in the open-source system Sphinx-4 ", which he completed under the supervision of our Faculty’s lecturer and researcher, [ Assoc. Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/janez.zibert/) .   
[ Trimo ](http://www.trimo.eu/) ,  a successful Slovenian company, has been granting prizes for the best Bachelor’s and Master's theses for many years, with a focus on specialist papers and doctoral dissertations that are in some way related to the company’s activities. With their call for applications to the Trimo Research Awards, the company invites ambitious young researchers and their mentors, professors and scholars to compete, connecting them with companies which could make  use of  their knowledge. For further information about Trimo Research Awards, visit  [ > ](http://www.trimo.eu/work-with-us/competitions/trimo-research-awards/)

[ ![After the Trimo Awards ceremony: Irman Abdić \(far right\) with his mentor, Assist. Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD, and Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assist. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD \(second right\).](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/fotopodelitev.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/fotopodelitev.jpg) After the Trimo Awards ceremony: Irman Abdić (far right) with his mentor, Assoc. Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD, and Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assoc. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD (second right). 

####  Master's degree graduate in Mathematics Peter Muršič accepted to Rutgers University 

The students of UP FAMNIT are encouraged to actively participate in international exchanges during their studies. Peter Muršič is a first-generation graduate of the Bachelor’s degree programme [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) at UP FAMNIT. Having obtained his Bachelor’s degree in 2010, he enrolled in the Master's Study Programme [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) , which he successfully completed in 2012. He then successfully competed for a grant to study at the prestigious American Rutgers University (http://www.rutgers.edu/), which was ranked 61st in the Shanghai Academic Ranking of World Universities for 2012. Since September 2012, Peter Muršič has been a doctoral student at [ Rutgers University ](http://www.rutgers.edu/) . 

[ ![Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, at the UP FAMNIT graduation ceremony \(Koper, 12 June 2012\)](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/h4.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/h4.jpg) Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, at the UP FAMNIT graduation ceremony (Koper, 12 June 2012) 

####  Hosting high-profile international guest lecturers and researchers 

Despite being a young faculty, UP FAMNIT is  heavily  involved  in international higher education. Each year, the faculty hosts many prominent international teachers and researchers.  Likewise  , the teachers and researchers of UP FAMNIT are also themselves active participants in international scientific symposiums, conferences and summer schools on their fields of expertise.   
Among the 2012 events that deserve special mention are the visit of Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry, **Prof. Sir Harold Kroto** , PhD, and the visit of **Prof. Patrick William Fowler, PhD** from the Department of Chemistry, University of Sheffield UK, who is also member of [ The Royal Society ](http://royalsociety.org/) .   
Prof  .  Kroto  visited  the University of Primorska  on 28 August 2012  in  the framework of the conference  [ Computers  and  Scientific  Discovery  ](http://conferences2.imfm.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=12) [ 6 ](http://conferences2.imfm.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=12) (  CSD6  ),  which took place from  21 – 25 August in Portorož  .   
Prof. Patrick William Fowler, PhD is a visiting professor participating in the teaching process at our postgraduate programmes of Mathematics (Master's and doctoral program in Mathematical Sciences). In his lectures he focuses on computationally intensive methods.   
For further information on international  visiting  professors  and researchers  at  FAMNIT  UP  and  [ UP  ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) [ IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) , visit the [ Faculty’s website ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/visiting-professors/) . 

[ ![Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assist. Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, presents Prof. Dr. Sir Harold Kroto with a mathematical clock from UP FAMNIT after a formal reception hosted by the Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič, \(Koper, 24 August 2012\)](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc7161w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc7161w.jpg) Dean of UP FAMNIT, Assoc. Prof. Dr. Klavdija Kutnar, presents Prof. Dr. Sir Harold Kroto with a “mathematical" clock from UP FAMNIT after a formal reception hosted by the Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dr. Dragan Marušič, (Koper, 24 August 2012) 

[ ![Prof. Patrick William Fowler, PhD from the Department of Chemistry, University of Sheffield, UK, giving lectures to the postgraduate students of UP FAMNIT.](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/partick.jpg:resizebox?496x346) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/partick.jpg) Prof. Patrick William Fowler, PhD from the Department of Chemistry, University of Sheffield, UK, giving lectures to the postgraduate students of UP FAMNIT. 

####  [ Organization of the International Scientific Conference CSD6 (Portorož, Slovenia, 21 – 25 August 2012)  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc7161w.jpg)

On 21 August 2012, the sixth international scientific conference of **** **Computers in Scientific Discovery 6 ([ CSD6 ](http://conferences2.imfm.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=12) ) ** began **,** which was held in  [ Portorož ](http://www.portoroz.si/en) . For the first time, the conference was organized by the Andrej Marušič Institute of the University of Primorska. Apart from UP FAMNIT, co-organizers of the conference were also [ UP FTŠ Turistica ](http://www.turistica.si/indexEN.php) , [ IMFM ](http://www.imfm.si/view?set_language=en) and [ UL FMF ](http://www.fmf.uni-lj.si/en/) .   
The conference, which concluded on 25 August, was attended by 67 participants, 38 of whom came from abroad. We hosted some of the most prominent international researchers in the fields of chemistry, biology, computer science and mathematics, especially discrete mathematics. One of the key-note speakers was also the 1996 Nobel Prize winner for Chemistry, Prof. Sir Harold Kroto, PhD.    
On Friday, 24 August 2012, at his morning lecture entitled [ ‘Science, Lost in Translation?’ ](http://conferences2.imfm.si/contributionDisplay.py?contribId=32&confId=12) , Prof. Sir Harold Kroto, PhD presented an outline of the development of science from the Enlightenment onwards and offered his own  vision  of how important it is at this historical moment to shake off all the shackles that impede the development of science. 

[ ![Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, talking to Prof. Sir Harold Kroto, PhD.](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc7100w.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/dsc7100w.jpg) Rector of the University of Primorska, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD, talking to Prof. Sir Harold Kroto, PhD. 

####  Organization of the 3  rd  International Workshop on ‘Symmetries of Graphs and Networks’ (SYGN III) and the International PhD Summer School in Discrete Mathematics (24-30 June 2012, Rogla, Slovenia) 

This was already the third in the series of international workshops on ‘Symmetries of Graphs and Networks’ (SYGN III). Together with the International Doctoral Summer School of Discrete Mathematics, the conference was organised by UP FAMNIT and [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) in cooperation with the Centre for Discrete Mathematics of [ UL PEF ](http://www.pef.uni-lj.si/index.php?id=12) and was held at Rogla from 24 – 30 June, 2012.   
The conference was attended by [ 68 participants ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference/DM2012/registrants) - 28 Slovenian and 40 international participants from about 20 countries.  Among the participants there were also highly prominent international researchers and around 30 doctoral students.   
In the conference part of the event (SYGN II), a total of [ 9 invited speakers ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference/DM2012/invited) from prestigious international institutions presented the newest research findings in the field of symmetries of graphs and networks.   
For further information on the events, visit  [ > ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference//DM2012)

[ ![Group photo of the participants at the SYGN III international conference, held at Rogla](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/rogla-2012skupinskafoto.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/rogla-2012skupinskafoto.jpg) Group photo of the participants at the SYGN III international conference, held  at  Rogla 

####  Organization of an International Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics (13 September 2012) 

On Thursday, 13 September 2012, UP FAMNIT hosted an international workshop on its premises entitled Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics. It was organized by UP FAMNIT and [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) in collaboration with Genome Informatics, [ Faculty of Technology, Universität Bielefeld, Germany ](http://gi.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de) . The conference brought together 33 participants - 15 local and 18 international, some of whom presented the findings of their research on the use of combinatorial algorithms in bioinformatics and in related fields. On Friday, 14 September 2012, the participants had the opportunity for discussion and research.   
For further information, visit  [ > ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference/bioinfo)

[ ![Group photo of the participants of the International Scientific Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics, taken in Koper](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/kombinatorial.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/kombinatorial.jpg) Group photo of the participants of the International Scientific Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics, taken in Koper 

####  The GReGAS project 

** The first year of the [ GReGAS ](http://www.gregas.eu) project  ** ,  ** the first European mathematical project coordinated from Slovenia.  ** The collaborative research project GReGAS (  Geometric representations and symmetries of graphs, maps and other discrete structures and applications in science) is comprised of a total of 16 projects. The main objective of the project is to develop a geometric representation and symmetry of graphs, maps and other discrete structures and applications in science.   
The supporting agency of the project is [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) . The project is coordinated by Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD and Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and is conducted in the context of the Eurocordes / Eurogiga programme. It includes not only partners from Croatia, Germany, Slovakia, and Turkey, but also associated partners, high-profile mathematicians from Austria, Israel, New Zealand, Great Britain and the United States.   
The presentation of the project, which took place in November 2011, was also attended by a representative of the European Science Foundation ( [ ESF ](http://www.esf.org/) ) Aigars Ekers, PhD. 

[ ![Description....](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/gregaslogo.png:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/gregaslogo.png)

####  Publication of journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea 

The University of Primorska and the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia (DMFA) are the creators of the international journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea ( [ AMC ](http://amc.imfm.si/index.php/amc%29) ). In 2011, the journal was included in the Science Citation Index (SCI), which is a historic event for Slovenian mathematics at the national level. The Editors-in-Chief of the journal are UP FAMNIT’s professors and researchers, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD. 

[ ![Editors-in-Chief of journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/draganintomoamc.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/draganintomoamc.jpg) Editors-in-Chief of journal Ars Mathematica Contemporanea, Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD
summary:
Here's a structured summary of the key information from the document about the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska**:

---

### **Key Highlights**
1. **Leadership**  
   - **Dean**: Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Science and Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
   - **Vice-Dean for Education**: Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD  
   - **Departments' Chairs**:  
     - Department of Mathematics: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
     - Department of Information Sciences and Technologies: Prof. Janez Žibert, PhD  
     - Department of Biodiversity: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
     - Department of Applied Natural Sciences: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
     - Department of Psychology: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  

2. **Notable Projects**  
   - **GReGAS Project**:  
     - First European mathematical project coordinated from Slovenia.  
     - Focus: Geometric representations and symmetries of graphs, maps, and discrete structures with applications in science.  
     - Partners: Croatia, Germany, Slovakia, Turkey, and associated institutions in Austria, Israel, New Zealand, UK, and the US.  
     - Funded under the Eurocordes/Eurogiga program.  
   - **ARS MATHEMATICA CONTTEMPORANEA (AMC)**:  
     - International journal co-created by the University of Primorska and the Slovenian Mathematical Society.  
     - Included in the **Science Citation Index (SCI)** in 2011, a milestone for Slovenian mathematics.  
     - Editors-in-Chief: Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD.  

3. **International Collaborations & Events**  
   - **SYGN III Workshop**:  
     - Third international workshop on "Symmetries of Graphs and Networks" (24–30 June 2012, Rogla).  
     - 68 participants (28 Slovenian, 40 international) including 30 doctoral students and 9 invited speakers.  
   - **Bioinformatics Workshop**:  
     - "Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics" (13–14 September 2012, Koper).  
     - Organized with the University of Bielefeld, Germany.  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - Hosted events like the **Trilateral Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics**.  

4. **Academic Achievements**  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - FAMNIT collaborates with institutions in Slovenia, Germany, and other European countries.  
   - **Research Impact**:  
     - Contributions to discrete mathematics, bioinformatics, and geometric representations of graphs.  

---

### **Contact Information**  
**University of Primorska**  
**Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
**Glagoljaška 8**  
**SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  

- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 70 (Administration)  
- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 75 (Student Services)  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Email**: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si) | [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Additional Resources**  
- **GReGAS Project Website**: [http://www.gregas.eu](http://www.gregas.eu)  
- **AMC Journal**: [http://amc.imfm.si](http://amc.imfm.si)  
- **FAMNIT Events Archive**: [http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference)  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT's academic strengths, collaborative projects, and international engagement. For specific details about a project, event, or publication, further exploration of the provided links or direct contact with the faculty is recommended.

   - **GReGAS Project**:  
     - First European mathematical project coordinated from Slovenia.  
     - Focus: Geometric representations and symmetries of graphs, maps, and discrete structures with applications in science.  
     - Partners: Croatia, Germany, Slovakia, Turkey, and associated institutions in Austria, Israel, New Zealand, UK, and the US.  
     - Funded under the Eurocordes/Eurogiga program.  
   - **ARS MATHEMATICA CONTTEMPORANEA (AMC)**:  
     - International journal co-created by the University of Primorska and the Slovenian Mathematical Society.  
     - Included in the **Science Citation Index (SCI)** in 2011, a milestone for Slovenian mathematics.  
     - Editors-in-Chief: Prof. Dragan Marušič, PhD and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD.  

3. **International Collaborations & Events**  
   - **SYGN III Workshop**:  
     - Third international workshop on "Symmetries of Graphs and Networks" (24–30 June 2012, Rogla).  
     - 68 participants (28 Slovenian, 40 international) including 30 doctoral students and 9 invited speakers.  
   - **Bioinformatics Workshop**:  
     - "Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics" (13–14 September 2012, Koper).  
     - Organized with the University of Bielefeld, Germany.  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - Hosted events like the **Trilateral Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms in Bioinformatics**.  

4. **Academic Achievements**  
   - **Trilateral Collaboration**:  
     - FAMNIT collaborates with institutions in Slovenia, Germany, and other European countries.  
   - **Research Impact**:  
     - Contributions to discrete mathematics, bioinformatics, and geometric representations of graphs.  

---

### **Contact Information**  
**University of Primorska**  
**Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
**Glagoljaška 8**  
**SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  

- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 70 (Administration)  
- **Phone**: +386 (5) 611 75 75 (Student Services)

- **Email**: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si) | [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Additional Resources**  
- **GReGAS Project Website**: [http://www.gregas.eu](http://www.gregas.eu)  
- **AMC Journal**: [http://amc.imfm.si](http://amc.imfm.si)  
- **FAMNIT Events Archive**: [http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/konference)

#  University of Primorska Scholarship Fund 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/cooperation/study-scholarships/UP-scholarship/universityofprimorska01.jpg:resizebox?1100x826)

The Scholarship Fund of the University of Primorska supports the best students at the university. 

It is managed by the university, and supported by national, municipal, private and other financial sources. Special emphasis is given to linking students with prospective employers, who invest in the scholarship fund and also have an option to choose which students they will support with their funds. 

An invitation to students is published at the beginning of each academic year. 

You can [ read more about the scholarship fund of the University of Primorska here ](https://kariernicenter.upr.si/en/up-scholarship-fund/) .
summary: The University of Primorska Scholarship Fund supports high-achieving students, managed by the university with funding from national, municipal, private, and other sources. It prioritizes partnerships with prospective employers who invest in the fund and have the option to select recipients, fostering connections between students and industry stakeholders. Annual invitations for applications are published at the start of each academic year, with additional details available on the university’s dedicated scholarship page.

Here's a structured summary of the key information provided about the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the University of Primorska:

---

### **1. Academic Overview**
- **Graduates (2020–2021):**
  - 2020: 135 graduates
  - 2021: 145 graduates
- **Study Programs:** 
  - Offered in both Slovene and English (specific programs not listed, but include mathematics, natural sciences, and IT).
- **Research Collaboration:** 
  - Strong ties with the **Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM)** at the University of Primorska.

---

### **2. Research Output (2021)**
- **UP FAMNIT Research Group:**
  - **SCI/SSCI/Scopus (d/h):** 252 articles (98/95/35/24)
  - **A&HCI/Scopus:** 16 articles
  - **Other:** 17 articles
  - **Total:** 285 articles
- **UP IAM Research Group:**
  - **SCI/SSCI/Scopus (d/h):** 184 articles (68/75/27/14)
  - **A&HCI/Scopus:** 15 articles
  - **Other:** 7 articles
  - **Total:** 206 articles

---

### **3. Staff and Administration (2021/22)**
- **Teaching & Research Staff:**
  - Full-time: 159 (83.92 FTE)
  - Part-time: 40
  - **Total:** 199
  - **Foreign Professors/Researchers:** 53 (47 full-time, 6 part-time)
  - **Gender Distribution:**
    - Male: 123 (61.81%)
    - Female: 76 (38.19%)
- **Administrative Staff:**
  - Total: 34 (28.68 FTE)
  - **Gender Distribution:**
    - Female: 28 (82.35%)
    - Male: 6 (17.65%)
- **Age Structure:**
  - 20–30: 38
  - 31–40: 70
  - 41–50: 67
  - 51–60: 38
  - 61–70: 17
  - 71+: 3
  - **Total Staff:** 233

---

### **4. Financial Information (Fiscal Year 2021)**
- **Total Net Assets:** €5.6 million
- **Funding Sources:**
  - **MIZŠ (Education Funds):** €3,907,240
  - **ARRS (Research Funds):** €946,743
  - **Other Budgetary Sources:** €59,658
  - **European Budget (Community Programs):** €529,340
  - **Public Service (Other):** €162,990
  - **Funds from Merchandise Sales:** €32,024
  - **Total:** €5,637,995

---

### **5. Leadership**
- **Dean:** Prof. Ademir Hujdurović, PhD
- **Vice-Deans:**
  - Science & Research: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD
  - Education: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD
  - Quality Assurance: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD
- **Departments' Chairs:**

  - Information Sciences & Technologies: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD
  - Biodiversity: Assoc. Prof. Vladimir Ivović
  - Applied Natural Sciences: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD
  - Psychology: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc
- **Faculty Secretary:** Nataša Vraneš

---

### **6. Contact Information**
- **Address:** Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia
- **Phone:**
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75
- **Fax:** +386 (5) 611 75 71
- **Emails:**
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)

---

### **Key Highlights**
- **Research Strength:** FAMNIT and UP IAM combined produced over **490 scientific articles** in 2021.
- **Staff Diversity:** A balanced gender ratio (61.81% male, 38.19% female) with a focus on international collaboration.
- **Financial Health:** Strong funding from national and European sources, totaling over €5.6 million in net assets.

#  Quick Facts about Famnit 2021/2022 
##  Study Programmes 2021/22  [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2021-2022#top)

Study programmes implemented in Slovenian language: 
  * Undergraduate Programmes: [ Conservation Biology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/conservation-biology) ,  [ Biopsychology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/biopsychology) , [ Bioinformatics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/bf-first/) ,  [ Computer Science ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/computer-science/) ,  [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) ,  [ Mathematics in Economics and Finance ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/mef-first/) ,  [ Mediterranean Agriculture (VS) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/undergraduate/sk-first-vs) . 
  * Master Programmes: [ Psychology ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/applies-psychology) , [ Biopsychology ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/biopsyhology) , [ Computer Science ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/computer-science/) , [ Data Science ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/data-science) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Nature Conservation ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/nature-conservation) ,  [ Sustainable Built Environments ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/built-environment) . 
  * Doctoral Programmes: [ ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science/) , [ Computer Science (international joint programme with University of St Andrews) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science-all) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat) , [ Suicidology and Mental Health ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/suic) . 

Study programmes implemented also in English language: 
  * Undergraduate Programmes: [ Bioinformatics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/bf-first/) , [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/computer-science/) , [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) . 
  * Master Programmes: [ Data Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/data-science) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) ,  [ Sustainable Built Environments ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/built-environment) . 
  * Doctoral Programmes: [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science/) , [ Computer Science (international joint programme with University of St Andrews) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science-all) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat) , [ Suicidology and Mental Health ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/suic) . 

The European Credit Transfer System (ECTS) is applied in all study programs. 

Fields of education according to the KLASIUS-P-16 – Classification of fields of educational activities/qualifications (2021): (03) Social sciences, journalism and information science, (05) Natural sciences, mathematics and statistics, (06) Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs), (07) Engineering, manufacturing and construction, (08) Agriculture, forestry, fisheries and veterinary, (10) Services.

#  Doctoral dissertation 

The procedure for preparing a doctoral dissertation is regulated by the Rules on the preparation and defence of the doctoral dissertation at the University of Primorska. 
  * [ Rules on the preparation and defence of the doctoral dissertation  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/rulesdoctoral-dissertneuradno-precisceno-besedilo.pdf)
  * Forms:  [ Approval of the Topic of the Diploma thesis ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/ddobrazecprijavatemeen19052025.docx) ,  [ Autorship statement ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/appendix-1-dopolnitev-priloge-1-eng.pdf) (Appendix 1), [ Consent of the supervisor and co-supervisor ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/appendix-2-soglasje-mentorja-eng.pdf) (Appendix 2) 
  * [ Summary of procedures ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/ddopornetockestudent-en.pdf)
  * [ Decision of the College of Deans and Directors of Members of the UP about the permitted foreign language of the dissertation (11 September 2024) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/sklep-kdd-prevod.pdf)
  * [ Ethics in Research ](https://www.upr.si/en/5-research/ethics-in-research/)
  * [ Word template for Doctoral Dissertation ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/templatedd2024.docx)
  * [ LaTeX template for Doctoral Dissertation ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/phdtemplatefamnit-latex.zip)
  * [ Recommendations for DRIN software submission ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral-dissertation/priporocilazaprogramskoopremorin-prin-drin.pdf)
summary: The University of Primorska outlines the doctoral dissertation process through its Rules on Preparation and Defence, requiring students to submit forms such as the topic approval, authorship statement, and supervisor consent, alongside adhering to guidelines on language (permitted foreign languages decided by the College of Deans), ethics in research, and formatting templates (Word and LaTeX). The process also includes a summary of procedures and recommendations for DRIN software submission, ensuring compliance with institutional standards and academic integrity.

summary: The enrollment process for Famnit students involves meeting advancement requirements for the next academic year, selecting compulsory and elective courses (available in English and Slovene), and adhering to specific rules for Year Plus (for foreign students needing to repeat the first year due to language barriers) and pre-graduation year (absolvent) enrollment. Students who meet criteria automatically receive enrollment papers, while those failing to submit required documents by deadlines are enrolled as Pavzer (non-students without fees). Tuition and enrollment fees must be paid before enrollment, with automatic enrollment for absolvent students and Pavzer status starting October 1st. The process includes submitting an electronic enrollment form, signing it, and attaching payment receipts and a photo, with detailed instructions available in the SIS system.

#  Enrollment - Famnit students 
##  YEAR PLUS [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#top)

_**What is Year Plus?** _ Year Plus enables **foreign students** to improve their academic performance by re-enrolling in the first year due to the reason of insufficient knowledge of the Slovenian language in which the study process takes place. 

**_Target group of Year Plus_ : Foreign students who are enrolled for the first time in one of the study programmes of UP FAMNIT conducted in Slovenian language. ** They must be enrolled in the study programme before enrolling in Year Plus. 

Students that have submited the application for Year plus with the enrollment paper in the 1st year, and if the student has obtained at the end of the current academic year a total of at least 30 credits (ECTS), of which at least 6 credits (ECTS) from knowledge Slovene language and 24 ECTS from the obligations of the 1st year, enables the extension of the status in the 1st year on the basis of the application for Year plus. 

In order to use Year plus, the student has to submit a request in ŠIS under the section Enrollment requests and choose Extenstion of student status in the 1st year (Year plus - foreign students).  A student will be informed via e-mail about the opened enrollment paper if  the criteria for use of Year plus are met  and has to follow the [ enrollment instructions ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#heading7) .
summary: The enrollment process for Famnit students involves meeting advancement requirements for the next academic year, selecting compulsory and elective courses (available in English and Slovene), and adhering to specific rules for Year Plus (for foreign students needing to repeat the first year due to language barriers) and pre-graduation year (absolvent) enrollment. Students who meet criteria automatically receive enrollment papers, while those failing to submit required documents by deadlines are enrolled as Pavzer (non-students without fees). Tuition and enrollment fees must be paid before enrollment, with automatic enrollment for absolvent students and Pavzer status starting October 1st. chunk:
#  Enrollment - Famnit students 
##  PRE-GRADUATION YEAR (ABSOLVENT) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#top)

Students, enroled in the 3rd year of the study programme may enrol in the pre-graduation year if they did not repeat the year _or_ change study programme during their studies. 

Enrolment in the pre-graduation year it is possible _only_ in the first academic year after 3rd year of the undergraduate study programme or _only_ in the f  rst academic year after 2nd year of the master's study programme  . 

Students, who have the right to enrol for the pre-graduation year ( _absolvent_ ) DO NOT SUBMIT any request. The enrollment paper is opened automatically, students are informed about opened enrollment paper via e-mail. A receipt for enrollment fee is sent to student's e-mail (also available in SIS in the section _My Data / My Financial Position_ _)._

_IMPORTANT:_   
Students who DO NOT want to enrol for pre-graduation year _do not have to_ fulfill the enrolment paper and _do not have to_ pay enrolment fee. They will be enrolled as a pavzer from the 1st October on by the Student Services.
summary: The enrollment process for Famnit students involves meeting advancement requirements for the next academic year, selecting compulsory and elective courses (available in English and Slovene), and adhering to specific rules for Year Plus (for foreign students needing to repeat the first year due to language barriers) and pre-graduation year (absolvent) enrollment. Students who meet criteria automatically receive enrollment papers, while those failing to submit required documents by deadlines are enrolled as Pavzer (non-students without fees). Tuition and enrollment fees must be paid before enrollment, with automatic enrollment for absolvent students and Pavzer status starting October 1st. The process includes submitting an electronic enrollment form, signing it, and attaching payment receipts and a photo, with detailed instructions available in the SIS system.

#  Enrollment - Famnit students 
##  PAVZER [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#top)

####  A pavzer is a student who: 
- does not fulfill the advancement requirements for enrollment in the higher study year and has already repeated the year;   
- does not want to enroll in the next academic year;   
- has already used all possible enrollments. 

####  Student who is a pavzer: 
- does not have a student status,   
- participating in a study obligations in a first year of being a pavzer is free of charge, while second year or more a student has to pay regarding the faculty's [ price list ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information) ,   
- does not fulfill the enrollment paper and does not pay the enrollment fee (or tuition fee). 

A student, who want to be a pavzer in the next academic year, will be enrolled as a pavzer from 1st October on by the Student Servcies.
summary: The enrollment process for Famnit students involves meeting advancement requirements for the next academic year, selecting compulsory and elective courses (available in English and Slovene), and adhering to specific rules for Year Plus (for foreign students needing to repeat the first year due to language barriers) and pre-graduation year (absolvent) enrollment. Students who meet criteria automatically receive enrollment papers, while those failing to submit required documents by deadlines are enrolled as Pavzer (non-students without fees). Tuition and enrollment fees must be paid before enrollment, with automatic enrollment for absolvent students and Pavzer status starting October 1st. The process includes submitting an electronic enrollment form, signing it, and attaching payment receipts and a photo, with detailed instructions available in the SIS system.

#  Enrollment - Famnit students 
##  ENROLLMENT INSTRUCTIONS [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#top)

When an enrollment paper is opened, a student is informed via e-mail. Also a receipt for enrollment fee is sent to student's e-mail (also available in SIS in the section _My Data / My Financial Position_ _)._

In case a student does not fulfil the enrollment paper and submit all the attachments until the deadline (see _Schedule of enrollment_ - figure), a student will be " _enrolled_ " as a pavzer from the 1st October on by the Student Services (see [ Pavzer ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#heading5) ). 

When the enrollment is completed by the Student Services, a student will be informed via e-mail. A student can print out the certificate of enrollment in SIS (section _My data / Certificate of enrollment_ ). 

###  Enrollment procedure 
  * An enrollment paper is available in student's SIS, section _ENROLLMENT / Enrollment Paper_ . 
  * A student has to check all the data  (in case of any corrections, a student must enter them in the section _NOTES FOR STUDENT SERVICES category – available after electronic signature of the enrollment paper_ ). 
  * In case there are elective courses needed in each study programme, a student has to choose between available ones (see [ _Courses_ ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents#heading1) ). 
  * A student submits the enrollment paper by clicking the button _Submit_ . 
  * After submission a student signs the enrollment paper electronically by clicking on the _Electronic Signature_ button. 
  * A student enters an electronic signature using the mouse and confirms the signature by clicking the _Enter Signature_ button. 
  * If a tuition fee is foreseen, the student is then obliged to sign the contract in the same way, which can be accessed after the successfully signed enrolment form. 

Enrollment's paper obligatory attachment in section _ENROLLMENT / Annexes of Enrollment_ is: 
  * ertificate of payment of the enrollment fee 
  * **an electronically signed contract (if tuition fees are foreseen),**
  * ****proof of payment or receipt certifying the payment of the enrolment fee,** **
  * ******proof of payment or receipt certifying the payment of the the 1st instalment of tuition fees (if tuition fees are foreseen),** ** **
  * ********one photo (3,5 x 4,5 cm in colour, the photo should be in standard form as for the personal identity card).​** ** ** **
  *
summary: The enrollment process for Famnit students involves meeting advancement requirements for the next academic year, selecting compulsory and elective courses (available in English and Slovene), and adhering to specific rules for Year Plus (for foreign students needing to repeat the first year due to language barriers) and pre-graduation year (absolvent) enrollment. Students who meet criteria automatically receive enrollment papers, while those failing to submit required documents by deadlines are enrolled as Pavzer (non-students without fees). Tuition and enrollment fees must be paid before enrollment, with automatic enrollment for absolvent students and Pavzer status starting October 1st. The process includes submitting an electronic enrollment form, signing it, and attaching payment receipts and a photo, with detailed instructions available in the SIS system.

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **University of Primorska Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** activities for the **2017–2018 academic year**, organized by key themes:

---

### **1. Academic Achievements & Events**  
- **Student Competitions & Projects**:  
  - Students excelled in international competitions like the **NASA competition**, **International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)**, and **European Mathematical Olympiad**.  
  - Notable projects included participation in the **European Researchers’ Night** (Science for Life initiative) and the **7th Famnit Summer Camp (Math is Cool)**, which attracted 29 students from Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Serbia.  
  - The **Mathematical Advent Calendar** (a quiz for elementary and secondary students) saw record participation, with over 500 participants.  

- **Research & Collaboration**:  
  - Hosted **Research Days in Mathematics** for 29 students preparing for international math competitions.  
  - Organized the **Biological Research Camp** in Slovenian Istria, preparing students for the **28th International Biological Olympiad**.  
  - Collaborated on projects like the **ESS Call** (26 projects) and **Open Call** (9 projects) with NGOs and businesses, involving 50 students.  

- **International Engagement**:  
  - Participated in **Erasmus+** programs and the **European Researchers’ Night**.  
  - Hosted the **Famnit Summer Camp** (Math is Cool) and **Biological Research Camp** for high school students.  

---

### **2. Leadership & Administration**  
- **Dean**: **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
- **Vice-Deans**:  
  - **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
  - **Education**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
- **Department Chairs**:  
  - **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
  - **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
  - **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
  - **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
- **Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **3. Accreditation & Program Renewals**  
- Successfully renewed accreditation for **Biopsychology**, **Applied Kinesiology** (undergraduate and master’s), and **Sustainable Built Environment** (merged with FAMNIT in 2017).  
- Acquired new study fields, including **Architecture, Urbanism, and Construction**, enabling future program development.  

---

### **4. Collaboration with Industry & NGOs**  
- Partnered with **businesses and NGOs** on 26 projects (ESS Call) and 9 projects (Open Call), involving 50 students and mentors.  
- Integrated industry expertise into classrooms through guest lectures and seminars.  

---

### **5. Contact Information**  
- **University of Primorska**  
  **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
  **Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  
- **Phone**:  
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Emails**:  
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  
- **Updated**: January 5, 2018  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT’s focus on **student engagement, research, international collaboration, and interdisciplinary partnerships** during the 2017–2018 academic year. Let me know if you need further details on specific programs or events!

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **University of Primorska Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** activities for the **2017–2018 academic year**, organized by key themes:

---

### **1. Academic Achievements & Events**  
- **Student Competitions & Projects**:  
  - Students excelled in international competitions like the **NASA competition**, **International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)**, and **European Mathematical Olympiad**.  
  - Notable projects included participation in the **European Researchers’ Night** (Science for Life initiative) and the **7th Famnit Summer Camp (Math is Cool)**, which attracted 29 students from Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Serbia.  
  - The **Mathematical Advent Calendar** (a quiz for elementary and secondary students) saw record participation, with over 500 participants.  

- **Research & Collaboration**:  
  - Hosted **Research Days in Mathematics** for 29 students preparing for international math competitions.  
  - Organized the **Biological Research Camp** in Slovenian Istria, preparing students for the **28th International Biological Olympiad**.  
  - Collaborated on projects like the **ESS Call** (26 projects) and **Open Call** (9 projects) with NGOs and businesses, involving 50 students.  

- **International Engagement**:  
  - Participated in **Erasmus+** programs and the **European Researchers’ Night**.  
  - Hosted the **Famnit Summer Camp** (Math is Cool) and **Biological Research Camp** for high school students.  

---

### **2. Leadership & Administration**  
- **Dean**: **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
- **Vice-Deans**:  
  - **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
  - **Education**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
- **Department Chairs**:  
  - **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
  - **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
  - **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
  - **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
- **Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **3. Accreditation & Program Renewals**  
- Successfully renewed accreditation for **Biopsychology**, **Applied Kinesiology** (undergraduate and master’s), and **Sustainable Built Environment** (merged with FAMNIT in 2017).  
- Acquired new study fields, including **Architecture, Urbanism, and Construction**, enabling future program development.  

---

### **4. Collaboration with Industry & NGOs**  
- Partnered with **businesses and NGOs** on 26 projects (ESS Call) and 9 projects (Open Call), involving 50 students and mentors.  
- Integrated industry expertise into classrooms through guest lectures and seminars.  

---

### **5. Contact Information**  
- **University of Primorska**  
  **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
  **Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  
- **Phone**:  
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Emails**:  
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  
- **Updated**: January 5, 2018  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT’s focus on **student engagement, research, international collaboration, and interdisciplinary partnerships** during the 2017–2018 academic year. Let me know if you need further details on specific programs or events!
