chunk:
#  Quick facts about Famnit 2017/18 
##  Highlights from 2017 [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2017-2018#top)

####  Assoc. Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD awarded with the prestigious Zois Certificate of Recognition 

On Thursday, 23 November 2017, our professor and researcher **Assoc. Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD** received the **Zois Certificate of Recognition for important achievements in scientific research work in the field of discrete mathematics.**   
Zois Awards and Recognitions are the most prestigious awards for exceptional achievements in scientific research and development activities, awarded to researchers who are active in Slovenia. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/img2339-r.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

####  New scientific journal ADAM 

A new scientific journal, [ The Art of Discrete and Applied Mathematics ](https://adam-journal.eu/index.php/ADAM/index) (abbreviated as ADAM), published by UP FAMNIT and the [ Slovenian Society for Discrete and Applied Mathematics ](http://www.sdams.si/en) , was founded in 2017. It is a modern high-quality online open-source international scientific journal in the field of discrete and applied mathematics. The journal will be published twice a year, in the English language. Its main main are our professors and researchers Prof. Dragan Marušič and Prof. Tomaž Pisanski. 

ADAM joins the [ Ars Mathematica Contemporanea ](https://amc-journal.eu/index.php/amc/index) journal, which is successfully published since 2008 by UP FAMNIT, in cooperation with the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia and the Institute of Mathematics, Physics, and Mechanics of Ljubljana. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/research/publications/homepageimageenus.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

####  International cooperation: projects and collaborations 

Also in 2017, we were successful in obtaining founds for projects in the frame of different international programmes. The Department of Applied Natural Sciences successfully acquired the project **SUSGRAPE "Promoting sustainable wine-growing through ICT in the cross-border area of IT-SLO"** , as a partner institution, in the frame of Interreg Program V-A Italy-Slovenia 2014-2020.   
The Department of Biodiversity, together with partners from Slovenia and Croatia, successfully acquired the project under the Interreg Program V-A Slovenia-Croatia, entitled **LIKE - Living on the Karst Edge** . Additionally, together with UP IAM, we also acquired five new research projects on the scientific research base, which are co-financed by Slovenian Research Agency (ARRS). 

Our researchers also continue to work on bigger international projects, which have been financed from the  EU Framework Programme for Research and Innovation  . The projects [ InnoRenew CoE ](https://innorenew.eu/sl/) and Starbios2 have received founds by the program Horizon 2020, while the project [ Life Euroturtles ](http://www.euroturtles.eu/) is funded by the programme Life. 

In order to achieve the vision of the project InnoRenew CoE, in February 2017 the Research Institute [ InnoRenew CoE ](https://innorenew.eu/sl/) was established. Its goal remains to become a leading institution in the field of research of renewable materials and sustainable construction, aiming to introduce the results to industrial everyday practice. The activities of the Institute, founded by the University of Primorska, the German _Fraunhofer_ _Institute_ _for_ _Wood_ Research _WKI_ , the Slovenian National Building and Civil Engineering Institute, and the Institute for the Protection of Cultural Heritage of Slovenia, focus on two technologies: wood modification and restorative environmental and ergonomic design (REED). ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/dsc9832x.jpg-resizebox.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)   
The emphasis of the research work is on developing innovations for the industry, providing support to companies in implementing research and development innovations and establishing connections with policymakers in order to encourage and support companies and researches in the forestry sector.   
With this, InnoRenew CoE is becoming an example of excellence in international researches, to support the economy and raise awareness and to involve the public in its activities (more on [ www.innorenew.eu ](http://www.innorenew.eu) ). 

In 2017 we also managed and carried out one infrastructure programme ARRS (Slovenian Research Agency), 2 research programmes ARRS, 8 fundamental research projects ARRS, 3 applicative research projects ARRS, 11 bilateral projects in the frame of scientific research cooperation ARRS (with institutions from USA, Russian Federation, Japan, Montenegro and Austria), 3 traineeships of young researcher ARRS, 2 programmes of cooperation Interreg (between Slovenia-Italy and Slovenia-Croatia), 1 project Life and 1 project Horizon 2020, which are co-financed by European Commision ( [ more about programmes and projects ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programmes-projects) ). 

UP FAMNIT has a wide network of connections and cooperations with prestigious universities and research institutes from all over the world. Several of them are also highly ranged in Shanghai’s Academic Ranking of World Universities 2017. At UP FAMNIT foreign experts are hosted in the frame of a different projects or individual arrangements. One of the current projects is the [ GUEST UP project - Hosting foreign experts and professors at the University of Primorska ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/projects/gostup) . ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/gostup.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)   
In the last year the number of incoming experts increased to 75.   
Similar success can be seen in mobilities of our teachers and researchers: in the last 12 months more than 100 research visits were performed at foreign institutions. 

The internationality of UP FAMNIT is also shown in the increasing number of students from abroad, who decided to study at UP FAMNIT. This academic year (2017/2018) we welcomed 76 new freshmen who are not Slovenian sitizens. Students from abroad represent almost 40% of all FAMNIT freshmen. At UP FAMNIT is currently studying 132 foreign students (24,4% of all students), from 20 different countries. In addition, there are 19 more students who came to Koper through different mobility programmes. 

In June 2017, a diverse group of 20 international students participated to a summer school [ The Forest Sector’s Contribution to Sustainability of the Built Environment in Alpine Europe ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programmes-projects) , which was organized jointly with UP FAMNIT and Oregon State University, College of Forestry (USA). Students came from different parts of the world: Finland, Indonesia, China, Sweden, Ukraine, United States of America and Slovenia. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2017-2018/2017-alpine-europe-2506201738.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

####  Scientific and other publications 

Scientists from the Department of Synthetic Biology and Immunology at the National Institute of Chemistry, among which can be found also our Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD, have developed a new type of material, **protein origami** , which can be self-synthesized in cells, and it is also able to form nanometer cages by itself. The results were published in the scientific journal [ Nature Biotechnology ](https://www.nature.com/articles/nchembio.1248?foxtrotcallback=true) , which is considered to be the most prominent scientific journal in the field of biotechnology in the world. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/avtorjiki.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

**Tilen Genov** from the Department of Biodiversity was head of the research group, which has shown that individual dolphins can be distinguished by their face and thus invented a new dolphin identification method. He presented his findings together with an international team of scientists in a study, published in the international [ Marine Mammal Science ](http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/mms.12451/full) magazine, a central scientific journal for the science of marine mammals. 

In October 2017, a special edition of the Discrete Applied Mathematics magazine was published. This was the fruitful result of the international conference [ AGTAC - Algorithmic Graph Theory on the Adriatic Coast ](https://conferences.matheo.si/event/6/?ovw=True) . The magazine offers a selection of 21 scientific articles. Among them, we can find the contribution of Prof. Andrej Brodnik, PhD (UP and UL) and Marko Grgurovič (UP) on the shortest paths in the graphs entitled: [ _Solving all-pairs shortest path by single-source computations: Theory and practice._ ](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0166218X17301415)

####  Awards, prizes and achievements of our students, professors and researchers 

Assist. Prof. Iztok Savnik, PhD from the Department of Information Science and Technologies, in collaboration with Yahoo Japan Research, produced a patent entitled [ _Search method and device for RDF data_ . ](https://patents.google.com/patent/US9213738)   
The content of the patent is a method and protocol for conducting queries in a distributed database of triples, which allow a high level of parallelism on the basis of distributed and pipelined parallelism. The method and the protocol are implemented in the data-driven system for carrying out big3store queries. 

In March 2017, the University of Primorska held the Gala Academy to award successful professors, researchers and students. Awarded colleagues of UP FAMNIT were: 
  * **Assist. Prof. Klen Čopič Pucihar, PhD** , who received the award for young professors for the excellence and top achievements in the field of scientific and pedagogical work, 
  * **Assoc. prof. dr. Andreja Kutnar, PhD** , who received the Scientific Excellence Award of the University of Primorska in the field of science and technology, 
  * Vladan Jovičić, who received the »Srečko Kosovel Award« which is given to successful students of the University of Primorska. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/dsc1243x.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

At the 31st International Maritime Mammal Conference in Denmark, **Tilen Genov** from the Department of Biodiversity received the European Association of Whales and Dolphins Award for **the best short lecture** , entitled " _Polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) and free-ranging common bottlenose dolphins from the northern Adriatic Sea, in relation to demographic parameters_ ". 

Our PhD student and assistant Marko Grgurovič set a new record with a group of international developers on the platform for mass financing Kickstarter: he presented a computer game Mordhau, which in one day already reached the set sum - USD 80 000. The number of supporters at the end of the campaign was 4,375, who supported the project with USD 298,608.   
Mordhau is a computer game where up to 64 players can participate. It is currently in its final stage of production. More at: [ https://mordhau.com/ ](https://mordhau.com/) . 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/zmagovalcinateajapodjetnaprimorska2017reinkarmikakarmenkorenpame:resizebox?2000x2000) In November, the winners of the 11th competition for the best business idea of Primorska "Podjetna Primorska 2017" were announced. Also this year, students of our faculty won the first place in the category Rector's Prize with the project **Pan-Map** , which offers, through the application on the smartphone and a photo of the map, a number of additional contents of the visiting places. The project is the result of teamwork of our Assist. Prof. Klen Čopič Pucihar, PhD, Bojan and Peter Simončič, and our master degree student of Computer Science Leo Gombač. 

####  Successes of our students at national and international competitions and contests 

**From March to May, FAMNIT's students of study programme Mathematics participated in three rounds of the international internet competition »[ Open International Internet-Olympiads for Higher Education Students ](http://olymp.i-exam.ru/) «. Among 6,413 participants from 175 universities, Arber Avdullahu (1st year of Mathematics) took an excellent 4th place and thus received a silver award, while Marko Palangetić (1st year of Mathematical Sciences) received a bronze award. **

**At the national competition of students in the field of mathematics for** Jurij Vega's awards **, the highest number of points was collected by our student of Mathematics at UP FAMNIT Roman Solodukhin. With the final result, he won both the gold award and also the first prize of this year's competition.**

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/img1166.jpg:resizebox?492x400) ** **Also this year, our students participated at the oldest mathematics competition for students within EU: the[ Vojtěch Jarník International Mathematical Competition ](http://vjimc.osu.cz/) held in Ostrava, Czech Republic. Among 132 students from 36 universities, Famnit was represented by Arbër Avdullahu, Daniil Baldouski, Roman Solodukhin and Anes Valentić. Avdullahu, Baldouski and Solodukhin received the certificate of a successful participant. Solodukhin also, with 20 points scored, achieved the best ranking of Famnit's students in the second category so far. **

**At the end of April,** the University development center and university incubator of Primorska  **organized the second NASA Space Apps Challenge, the world's largest hexaton about earth and space. 25,000 participants in 69 countries on 187 locations were solving one of the five challenges prepared by NASA. Among 19 participants from Slovenia, the first award went to the project** Space Door **, which was created by our student Oliver Glavina, a student of the Master's Program Computer Science.**

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/oliverglavina1mestonahekatonu.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) **

**In August, Filip Božić, Daniil Baldouski, and Arbër Avdulah attended the[ 24th International Mathematics Competition for University Students 2017 ](http://www.imc-math.org.uk/) , held in Bulgaria. Students of the first year of Mathematics did a great job in presenting UP FAMNIT, since Avdulah received also the honor award. **

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/ump-2017-prvakiup.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ** **In October 2017 UP FAMNIT hosted the final round of the University Programming Marathon (UPM) 2017, which was organized by ACM Slovenija. Teams from all over Slovenia competed for the title of champion of UPM as well as for the titles of champions of all three Slovenian public universities.  
Out of a total of 168 competitors, 55 best competitors fought in Koper for the first place. Champions of the University of Primorska were Mikita Akulich, Daniil Baldovski and Anton Uramer. **

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/2017-primatijada-0205201714a.jpg:resizebox?538x368) ** **15 UP FAMNIT students participated at Primatijada competition, which took place between 28 April and 3 May 2017 in Montenegro. In the IT contest, 1st place was won by Leo Gombač, 2nd place went to Valentin Sojar and Patrik Kocjančič, while Peter Kozlovič was third. In the category Biology in Ecology, Nina Omejc won the second place.  
Famnit's team competed ** **also** **in various sports disciplines, with the most successful Nina Omejc and Lučka Markič, who won the 3rd place in women's table tennis.**

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/kosarka15.jpg:resizebox?454x336) Our students were successful also in the sports field. Within the sports league of the University of Primorska, they competed in three categories: basketball, volleyball, and futsal.   
In 2017 they won the 1st place in basketball, while the 2nd place was awarded to the volleyball and futsal team. **

####  Organization of International Scientific Conferences and Meetings 

In the year 2017, we continued with the organization of international scientific conferences, meetings, and summer schools in the fields of mathematics, computer science, psychology, health care and sustainable construction. This were: 
  * _[ PhD Summer School in Algebraic Graph Theory ](https://conferences.famnit.upr.si/indico/event/3/) , _
  * [ _ECCO – European Chapter on Combinatorial Optimization,_ ](http://dist.famnit.upr.si/en/workshops/ecco-xxx-conference)
  * _[ Triple I 2016: Intuition, Imagination and Innovation in Suicidology ](http://zivziv.si/triple-i-2016/) , _
  * _[ LAW’17: 8  th  Linear Algebra Workshop ](http://www.law05.si/law17/index.php?stran=organizers) , _
  * [ _2017 PhD Summer School in Discrete Mathematics,_ ](https://conferences.famnit.upr.si/event/2/)
  * [ _International Summer School_ ](http://alpine-europe.famnit.upr.si/en/) _[ ’The Forest Sector’s Contribution to Sustainability of the Built Environment in Alpine Europe’ ](http://alpine-europe.famnit.upr.si/en/) . _
  * [ _5 th  Annual Mississippi Discrete Math Workshop, _ ](http://discretews.math.msstate.edu/2017/)
  * [ _Workshop on Discrete and Computational Biomathematics and Mathematical Chemistry._ ](https://conferences.famnit.upr.si/event/5/overview)

####  Annual UP FAMNIT graduation ceremony and UP doctoral degree conferment ceremony 

On Friday, 9th June, the 7th Graduation Ceremony of UP FAMNIT took place at the Koper Theater. Diplomas were awarded to 81 undergraduate and 16 graduate students. In addition, 10 students received  rewards of the Faculty for their achievements active involvement in the Faculty life. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/img0284d.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

On 19 October  new doctors of science were promoted at the Universiy of Primorska. A  mong them were also Tatjana Romina Hartinger and Samir Hodžić, who both completed their doctoral studies in Mathematics. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2017-2018/promocija-20171019-2.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

####  Activities of promotion and popularization of Natural Sciences 

Also in 2017 we organized or participated in several events, whose common goal was the popularization of science. Round tables, seminars and other activities for different audiences were organized. Also our students were active in organizing different activities, especially the members of the Association of Biopsychology Students and the Association of Conservation Biologists BIODIVA. Students and others were offered courses in the field of computer science, biology, agriculture and other meetings with experts from the different fields of natural science. 

Within the framework of the ninth cycle of popular lectures Famnit Excursions into the Mathematical Universe on the topics of mathematics and its role in the modern world, the participants listened to different lectures, given by: 
  * Prof. Andrej Bauer, PhD (on the topic that the images are worth a thousand words), 
  * Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD (on the topic of the history of discrete geometry), 
  * Assist. Prof. Jernej Vičič, PhD (on the topic of mathematical models used in statistical machine translation), 
  * Prof. Janko Gravner, PhD (on the topic of order and disorder), 
  * Assoc. Prof. Mihael Perman, PhD (on the topic of paradoxes in probability), and 
  * Assist. Nino Bašić, PhD (on the topic of invisible polieder); 

In the first month ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2017-2018/2017-matematicnidan-31-03-201710.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) s of the year, we successfully organized three mathematical days. The first one was on the 25 January, when 120 students from Koper Gymnasium visited the Faculty. This was the first time, that we organized a mathematical day for secondary school studentpupils. The other two were on 31 March (with 56 pupils from 4 Elementary Schools) and on 14 April (with 63 pupils from two Elementary Schools). 

On Saturday, 8 April 2017, a meeting of high school teachers of biology took place at University campus Livade in Izola. The lecturers and assistants from the Department of Biodiversity presented some modern contents in the fields of genetics, epigenetics and protein structure that can be included in their work. 

At the end of April, we promoted mathematics also abroad. At the initiative of three of our students, we organized an international mathematical competition in Gjakova, Kosovo, which was attended by 43 pupils. The Gjakova Mathematics Competition 2017 was presented also by [ the local media ](http://www.syri-vision.tv/lajme-news/lokale/439-u-mbajt-gara-e-matematikes-per-nxenes-te-klaseve-te-11-ta-dhe-12-ta-video) , which shows the importance of such international cooperation between the University of Primorska and the cities which our students come from. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/news/img6200.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/news/img4782.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

At the beginning of summer, the Biological Research Camp in Slovenian Istria was successfully organized for the second year in a row. The camp was organized by the Department of Biodiversity and the Slovenian Technical Culture Association. 13 high school pupils from all over Slovenia have been discovering for four days the diversity of flora and fauna and their adaptation to life in the Mediterranean. At the same time, our researchers in Campus Livade took care of the preparation of Slovenian participants at [ 28th International Biological Olympiad ](http://ibo2017.org/) , which took place at the end of July in the UK. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/2017-priprave-biol-olimpijada-2806201707.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/2017-bioloski-raziskovalni-tabor-2606201712.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/img0962-medium.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) At the end of August, we successfully organized the 7th **Famnit Summer Camp Math is cool** , which was this year intended exclusively for secondary school students. A total of 29 young people attended the five-day educational, research and, ultimately, social events between 20 and 25 August 2017: 18 were from different parts of Slovenia, 10 from Bosnia and Herzegovina and 1 from Serbia. 

An important event involving teachers, researchers and faculty students was the [ European Researchers’ Night ](https://www.znanostzazivljenje.si/en) , which took place in the framework of the all-Slovenian project Science for Life. On Friday, 29 September 2017, participants at various locations in Koper and Izola, including the laboratories of the University Campus Livade, participated in interesting experiments, workshops, tours and socializing with researchers in the festival atmosphere. 

The academic year ended with the 7th Research Days in Mathematics, which we traditionally organize in cooperation with the Society of Mathematicians, Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia and University of Primorska Faculty of Education. On the basis of successful ranking at the national competition in mathematics or at international competitions, the faculty invited 29 pupils from various secondary schools. Young mathematic enthusiasts attended lectures in selected chapters in mathematics, intended for preparation for the International Mathematical Olympiad and other mathematical competitions. 

We concluded 2017 with the traditional Mathematical Advent Calendar – a quiz for pupils of Elementary and Secondary Schools, which was this year offered also in the English language. We reached a record number of participants since more than 500 young enthusiasts participated in the quiz. 

####  Cooperation between UP FAMNIT, business and NGOs 

After successful implementation of 17 projects in the framework of the ESS Call  “Po kreativni poti do praktičnega znanja”  in the years 2014 and 2015, we acquired funds for the implementation of five new projects in 2017 (altogether 26 projects were acquired by the University of Primorska). From March to July, 28 students, together with mentors from UP FAMNIT and mentors from collaborative companies/organizations, were involved in five projects. 

The University of Primorska also successfully acquired funds for the implementation of 9 projects in the framework of the Open Call  for projects for cooperation with NGO's.  From June to September, 22 students, together with mentors and experts from the local/regional environment, were involved in nine different projects. 

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/novice/20171208152628.jpg:resizebox?570x322) ** Cooperation with NGOs and business is also taking place in classrooms since our faculty is regularly visited by experts from practice both at lectures and seminars. Exemplary cooperation with the business is also carried out within the framework of the activities organized by the  University development center and university incubator of Primorska.  ****

####  Renewal of the accreditation of study programmes 

In 2017, the procedure for the renewal of the accreditation to three study programs - undergraduate study programs **Biopsychology** and **Applied Kinesiology** and the Master's study program **Applied Kinesiology** - was successfully completed. For all three study programs, the National Committee for Quality in Higher Education extended accreditation for an indefinite period of time. 

Prior to this, UP FAMNIT, in accordance with the Higher Education Act, has already successfully completed all the procedures for regular renewal of accreditation for eleven study programs. 

In May 2017, the Faculty of Built Environment of the University of Primorska was merged with UP FAMNIT. With this, the accredited master study program **Sustainable Built Environment** was transferred to our Faculty, which was already announced in the framework of UP FAMNIT for the new academic year (2017/18). UP FAMNIT acquired also a new field of study "(58) Architecture, Urbanism and Construction", in which we will be able to develop new study programs in the future, especially at the first and third Bologna levels. 

With the academic year 2017/18, the undergraduate and master study program Applied Kinesiology were transferred to the University of Primorska, Faculty of Health Sciences.
summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **University of Primorska Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** activities for the **2017–2018 academic year**, organized by key themes:

---

### **1. Academic Achievements & Events**  
- **Student Competitions & Projects**:  
  - Students excelled in international competitions like the **NASA competition**, **International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)**, and **European Mathematical Olympiad**.  
  - Notable projects included participation in the **European Researchers’ Night** (Science for Life initiative) and the **7th Famnit Summer Camp (Math is Cool)**, which attracted 29 students from Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Serbia.  
  - The **Mathematical Advent Calendar** (a quiz for elementary and secondary students) saw record participation, with over 500 participants.  

- **Research & Collaboration**:  
  - Hosted **Research Days in Mathematics** for 29 students preparing for international math competitions.  
  - Organized the **Biological Research Camp** in Slovenian Istria, preparing students for the **28th International Biological Olympiad**.  
  - Collaborated on projects like the **ESS Call** (26 projects) and **Open Call** (9 projects) with NGOs and businesses, involving 50 students.  

- **International Engagement**:  
  - Participated in **Erasmus+** programs and the **European Researchers’ Night**.  
  - Hosted the **Famnit Summer Camp** (Math is Cool) and **Biological Research Camp** for high school students.  

---

### **2. Leadership & Administration**  
- **Dean**: **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
- **Vice-Deans**:  
  - **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
  - **Education**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
- **Department Chairs**:  
  - **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
  - **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
  - **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
  - **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
- **Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **3. Accreditation & Program Renewals**  
- Successfully renewed accreditation for **Biopsychology**, **Applied Kinesiology** (undergraduate and master’s), and **Sustainable Built Environment** (merged with FAMNIT in 2017).  
- Acquired new study fields, including **Architecture, Urbanism, and Construction**, enabling future program development.  

---

### **4. Collaboration with Industry & NGOs**  
- Partnered with **businesses and NGOs** on 26 projects (ESS Call) and 9 projects (Open Call), involving 50 students and mentors.  
- Integrated industry expertise into classrooms through guest lectures and seminars.  

---

### **5. Contact Information**  
- **University of Primorska**  
  **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
  **Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  
- **Phone**:  
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Emails**:  
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  
- **Updated**: January 5, 2018  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT’s focus on **student engagement, research, international collaboration, and interdisciplinary partnerships** during the 2017–2018 academic year. Let me know if you need further details on specific programs or events!

---

### **1. Academic Achievements & Events**  
- **Student Competitions & Projects**:  
  - Students excelled in international competitions like the **NASA competition**, **International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)**, and **European Mathematical Olympiad**.  
  - Notable projects included participation in the **European Researchers’ Night** (Science for Life initiative) and the **7th Famnit Summer Camp (Math is Cool)**, which attracted 29 students from Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Serbia.  
  - The **Mathematical Advent Calendar** (a quiz for elementary and secondary students) saw record participation, with over 500 participants.  

- **Research & Collaboration**:  
  - Hosted **Research Days in Mathematics** for 29 students preparing for international math competitions.  
  - Organized the **Biological Research Camp** in Slovenian Istria, preparing students for the **28th International Biological Olympiad**.  
  - Collaborated on projects like the **ESS Call** (26 projects) and **Open Call** (9 projects) with NGOs and businesses, involving 50 students.  

- **International Engagement**:  
  - Participated in **Erasmus+** programs and the **European Researchers’ Night**.  
  - Hosted the **Famnit Summer Camp** (Math is Cool) and **Biological Research Camp** for high school students.  

---

### **2. Leadership & Administration**  
- **Dean**: **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
- **Vice-Deans**:  
  - **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
  - **Education**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
- **Department Chairs**:  
  - **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
  - **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
  - **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
  - **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
- **Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **3. Accreditation & Program Renewals**  
- Successfully renewed accreditation for **Biopsychology**, **Applied Kinesiology** (undergraduate and master’s), and **Sustainable Built Environment** (merged with FAMNIT in 2017).  
- Acquired new study fields, including **Architecture, Urbanism, and Construction**, enabling future program development.  

---

### **4. Collaboration with Industry & NGOs**  
- Partnered with **businesses and NGOs** on 26 projects (ESS Call) and 9 projects (Open Call), involving 50 students and mentors.  
- Integrated industry expertise into classrooms through guest lectures and seminars.  

---

### **5. Contact Information**  
- **University of Primorska**  
  **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
  **Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia**  
- **Phone**:  
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Emails**:  
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  
- **Updated**: January 5, 2018  

---

This summary highlights FAMNIT’s focus on **student engagement, research, international collaboration, and interdisciplinary partnerships** during the 2017–2018 academic year. Let me know if you need further details on specific programs or events!

summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska** for the **2014–2015 academic year**, highlighting key areas of activity, leadership, and contact details:

---

### **Leadership & Structure**  
**Dean**:  
- **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
**Vice-Deans**:  
- **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
- **Education**: Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD  
**Department Chairs**:  
1. **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
2. **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
3. **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
4. **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
5. **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
**Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **Key Research & Academic Activities**  
1. **Research Highlights**:  
   - Published in high-impact journals (e.g., *Atmospheric Environment*).  
   - Collaborated on the **EnergyVillab** project with local companies.  
   - Conducted interdisciplinary research (e.g., environmental science, mathematics, psychology).  

2. **Educational Initiatives**:  
   - Launched **Mathematics is Cool** summer camps (attended by 38 students).  
   - Organized **Mathematical Days** for primary school students.  
   - Introduced **excursions into the Mathematical Universe** (lectures on math in sports, π, and sensor networks).  
   - Offered **continuing education programs** for educators.  

3. **Community Engagement**:  
   - Hosted **Biological Evenings** with lectures on biodiversity, food safety, and Karst ecosystems.  
   - Organized **Science Days** for primary and secondary schools (over 80 participants).  
   - Conducted **Internet safety workshops** for primary school students.  

4. **Cultural & Public Outreach**:  
   - Celebrated the **200th anniversary of Slovenian mathematician Franc Močnik** with math workshops.  
   - Launched the **Plezija** poetry competition (best poem by Ivan Lisac on π day).  

---

### **Collaborations & Partnerships**  
- Partnered with **companies** (e.g., for environmental research, EnergyVillab).  
- Collaborated with **local schools** and **scientific institutions** for educational and research projects.  

---

### **Contact Information**  
**University of Primorska**  
**Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
**Address**: Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia  
**Phone**:  
- Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
- Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
**Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
**Emails**:  
- General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
- Administrative: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Notable Achievements**  
- **High-impact publications** in environmental science and mathematics.  
- **Record attendance** at Mathematics is Cool camp (38 participants).  
- **Successful collaboration** with local communities and industries.  
- **Educational outreach** programs for schools and professionals.  

For more details, visit the [FAMNIT website](http://www.famnit.upr.si).  

*(Last updated: 31.3.2015)*

**UP FAMNIT has established close cooperation in the field of research with the University of Primorska, Andrej Marušič Institute ([ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) ), where most of the UP FAMNIT academic staff conduct their research. Some professors also conduct research as part of the Science and Research Centre at the University of Primorska ( [ UP ZRS ](http://www.zrs.upr.si/en) ) and the Institute of Mathematics, Physics and Mechanics ( [ IMFM ](http://www.imfm.si/view?set_language=en) ). **

**Original Scientific Articles of the UP FAMNIT research group ("Raziskovalna skupina UP FAMNIT")_**in 2014** _ (1.1.2014-31.12.2014) (source: [ Sicris ](http://sicris.izum.si/search/grp.aspx?lang=eng&id=3598&opt=1) ): **

chunk:
#  Quick facts about Famnit 2014/15 
##  Highlights from 2014 [ top ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2014-2015#top)

####  Our teachers and researchers became new members in national and international editorial boards and committees 

[ Prof. Dragan Stevanović ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.stevanovic/) became a member of the editorial board of SCI listed journal [ Linear Algebra and Its Applications ](http://www.journals.elsevier.com/linear-algebra-and-its-applications) while [ Assist. Prof. Andreja Kutnar ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/andreja.kutnar/) became a member of the Policy and Critical Issues Committee of the American Association [ Society of Wood Science and Technology (SWST). ](http://www.swst.org/) At the annual electoral general meeting of the [ Slovenian Academy of Engineering, ](http://www.ias.si/Inzenirska-Akademija-Slovenije/) [ Prof. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/pisanski/) [ Tomaž Pisanski  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/pisanski/) was elected a regular member of the Scientific Research Group. 

####  Awards and prizes for our student, teachers and researchers 

Among the awardees of the Gala Academy held within the University of Primorska week (March 2014) were the following successful teachers, researchers and student from our Faculty: 
  * [ Prof. Diego De Leo ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/diego.deleo/) received The Gold Medal of the University of Primorska Acknowledgement, 
  * [ Prof. Cene Bavec ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/cene.bavec/) received the honorary title Professor Emeritus of the University of Primorska, 
  * [ assistant Tine Šukljan ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/tine.sukljan/) received The Pedagogic Excellence Award of the University of Primorska in the School Year 2013/2014, 
  * [ assistant Vita Poštuvan, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/vita.postuvan/) received The Scientific Excellence Prize of the University of Primorska for 2014 from the field of social sciences, 
  * [ Assist. Prof. Marko Orel ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/marko.orel/) received The Honor Role of the University of Primorska, 
  * Olga Kaliada received an Acknowledgment of the University of Primorska for the students of the University of Primorska. 

In the summer, during a research trip of UP FAMNIT ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/kitajskacastni-naziv.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) mathematicians to China, [ Prof. Dragan Marusič ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.marusic/) received the honorary title"Advisory Professor of Beijing Jiaotong University". This is the highest prize awarded by the Autonomous Beijing Jiaotong University, one of the leading Chinese state universities in the field of electrical engineering. 

####  Successful implementation of the project of internationalization of the University of Primorska - UP and the WORLD 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/logos-up-in-svet.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

In 2014 UP FAMNIT enthusiastically started with the implementation of theproject [ »UP and the WORLD«. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/project-up-world) This resulted in 41 foreign lecturers visiting the Faculty - 32 attended and delivered a lecture at our international workshops, 9 held lectures within the courses of our undergraduate (Computer Science, Mathematics, Biopsychology, Mathematics in Economics and Finance) and master's study programmes (Nature Conservation, Mathematical Sciences, Biopsychology and Mathematics with Financial Engineering) and one professor, [ Assoc. Prof. Francesco Belardo, ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/francesco.belardo/) was employed at our Department of Mathematics for one year. 

In addition to visiting professors within the above mentioned project of internationalization of the University of Primorska, [ many other foreign experts ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/gostujoci-profesorji/) visited, lectured and performed research on our Faculty. 

####  Successes of our students at national and international competitions and contests 

In February 2014 Edin Husić and Beco Merulić, ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/bolgarija1.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) both undergraduate Math students _,_ attended the International Mathematical Olympiad in Mogilev (Belarus). In strong competition of many (also doctoral) students Edin Husić finished the competition on 14  th  and Merulić on 38  th  place. 

In March and April our students competed at several disciplines of the [ Open International Internet-Olympiad ](http://www.i-olymp.com/) . Twelve undergraduate Math students participated in the first round of the contest from the field of ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/winner.png:resizebox?2000x2000) Mathematics and six of them qualified for the second round where the most successful two finished on 3  rd  (Roman Solodukhin ) and 5  th  (Marko Palangetić ) place. Six undergraduate students of Biodiversity participated at the internet olympiad in the field of Ecology. All of them successfully qualified for the second round and at the end Živa Muhič won the bronze medal. In the field of Computer Science students Aleksandar Tošić, Aleksandar Todorović, Alen Redek and Marko Tavčar won the bronze medal. According to the organizing team of the International Internet Olympiads, the University of Primorska achieved the best team result among all the participating Universities. 

In April our undergraduate Math students (Marko Palangetić, Marko Rajković, Roman Solodukhin, Ratko Darda and Anastasiya Tanana) participated at the [ Vojtěch Jarník International Mathematical Competition ](http://vjimc.osu.cz/) in the Czech Republic. All together they gained the sum of 66 points and finished in second place among all teams. The most successful competitor among our students was Anastasiya Tanana. 

In April our Computer Science students participated in the first round of the  [ University Programming Marathon. ](http://tekmovanja.acm.si/upm) Team StackOverflow (Aleksandar Todorović and Marko Tavčar) performed very well, among 48 participating teams they finished 14  th  .  In the second they improved their performance and finished the 2  nd  round on 11  th  place.  In October UP FAMNIT hosted the [ finals of the University Programming Marathon ](http://tekmovanja.acm.si/upm) [ . ](http://tekmovanja.acm.si/upm) Two UP FAMNIT teams competed, besides team StackOverflow, which made an impressive 6  th  place in overall Marathon standings, the champions of our university became team TopCoder (Vladan Jovičić, Marko Palangetić and Roman Solodukhin). 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/neuri.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) In May, the  [ 4  th  Student Congress of Neuroscience - NeuRi 2014 ](http://www.neuri.uniri.hr/) was held in Rijeka, Croatia. Our student of Biopsychology, Nina Kočar,  presented her work from the field of therapeutic games for hyperactive children and won the Audience Award. 

  

Between 29 July and 4 August 2014, Blagoevgrad (Bulgaria) hosted [ 21  st  International Mathematics Competition for University Students 2014. ](http://www.imc-math.org/) All three participating students from UP FAMNIT were very successful - Anastasiya Tanana won 1  st  prize, while Marko Rajković and Marko Palangetić won 3  rd  . 

Within the Conservation Biology course, our  3  rd  year  Biodiversity students mentored by  Assoc. Prof. Elena V. Bužan and assistant Sara Zupan participated at the contest [ E-clic Online Community of the cultural landscape ](http://e-clic.ning.com/slovenia-forum) [ . ](http://e-clic.ning.com/slovenia-forum) With his project Re-Vive, Martin Senič won 1  st  place and qualified for European competition in Estonia. Martina Tekavec won 3  rd  place with project IzKAZ and Teja Zakotnik finished 4  th  with her project GETexploring. 

The successes of Biodiversity department students continued at the Marine Biological Association’s [ 49  th  European Marine Biology Symposium ](http://www.onlinereg.ru/embs49) in St. Petersburg (Russia), where Sara Hočevar, our 2  nd  year student of Nature Conservation was awarded 3  rd  prize for best student oral presentation. 

####  UP FAMNIT successfully implemented 9 projects »Creative pathways to knowledge« 

University of Primorska successfully applied to a [ public call for funds for implementation of »Creative pathways to knowledge« ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/si/razpisi-in-objave/naslovnica/razpis/n/javni-razpis-za-sofinanciranje-projektov-po-kreativni-poti-do-prakticnega-znanja/) projects, published by the [ Slovene human resources development and scholarship fund. ](http://www.sklad-kadri.si/) Among 14 approved projects at the University level, 9 were performed at our Faculty. Projects involved 45 students from different study programmes, 7 companies/organizations and 8 mentors–UP FAMNIT teachers. 

####  The first graduate of the Master's Study Programme Nature Conservation 

On 1  st  September 2014 UP FAMNIT presented the first graduate of Master’s Study Programme [ Nature Conservation. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/nature-conservation) Tea Knap, mentored by [ Assist. Prof. Dunja Bandelj ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dunja.bandelj/) , received her Master's degree for thesis "Microsatellite analysis of olive fly populations (Bactrocera oleae Gmelin) in the Slovenian Istria". In her Master’s degree she discussed olive fly on the level of DNA molecule, which makes her study the first of the kind in Slovenia. Only four such studies were previously presented in the scientific journals worldwide. 

####  Rector welcomed a new generation of international Math students 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/sprejem14.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) Prof. Dragan Marušič, Rector of the University of Primorska, welcomed  talented  international students who enrolled in our undergraduate study programmes [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) and [ Mathematics in Economics and Finance ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/mef-first/) in this Academic year. Daniel Silađi, Nikita Akulich, Marija Tepegjozova, Miloš Tomić, Palina Kaliada and Anes Valentić are coming from Serbia, Belarus, Macedonia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. 

####  Highly esteemed international publishing houses published books of our colleagues 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/d.stevanovicelsevier.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/contemporarysloveniantimber.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) International publisher [ Springer ](http://www.springer.com/gp/) published a scientific monograph [ Contemporary Slovenian Timber Architecture for Sustainability ](http://www.springer.com/energy/energy+efficiency/book/978-3-319-03634-2) by authors Assist. Prof. Manja Kitek Kuzman and our colleague [ Assist. Prof. Andrea Kutnar ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/andreja.kutnar/) while international publisher [ Elsevier ](http://www.elsevier.com/) published a book by [ Prof. Dragan Stevanović ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.stevanovic/) - [ Spectral Radius of Graphs, ](http://store.elsevier.com/Spectral-Radius-of-Graphs/Dragan-Stevanovic/isbn-9780128020685/) dedicated to the development, proofs and open problems in the field of spectral graph theory. 

Our colleague [ Jure Pražnikar, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/jure.praznikar/) and Prof. Dušan Turk from Jožef Stefan Institute published an article [ »Free kick INSTEAD of cross-validation and maximum- likelihood refinement of macromolecular crystal structures« ](http://journals.iucr.org/d/issues/2014/12/00/issconts.html) in the journal [ Acta Crystallographica Section D Biological Crystallography ](http://journals.iucr.org/d/) , which ranks first by the impact factor in the field of crystallography (IF 2013: 7232). 

####  Organisation of international scientific conferences and meetings 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/ll-group-photo.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) In 2014 UP FAMNIT continues with organization and co-organization of international scientific conferences and other forms of scientific meetings. Under the auspices of the [ Project UP and the world ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/project-up-world) , UP FAMNIT successfully carried out four scientific  event  s in the field of mathematics ( [ International Conference on Graph Theory and Combinatorics ](https://conferences.matheo.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=7) , [ 2014 PhD Summer School and Discrete Mathematics ](https://conferences.matheo.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=2) , [ Conference Symmetries of Graphs and Networks IV ](https://conferences.matheo.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=2) , [ Ljubljana-Leoben Graph Theory Seminar ](https://conferences.matheo.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=5) ) and the conference [ Smart Cities ](https://conferences.matheo.si/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=8) . 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/rogla14-group1.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) In May, Piran held the fifth conference about the study and prevention of suicide ( [ Triple I: Intuition, Imagination and Innovation and Suicidology ](http://zivziv.si/triple-i/) ), in autumn, our colleagues as co-organizers participated in the conference COST Action FP1303 in Kranjska Gora, in the [ 1st Student Computer Science Research Conference ](http://labraj.feri.um.si/stucosrec2014/) and in the [ 3  rd  annual Mississippi Discrete Mathematics workshop ](http://rwoodroofe.math.msstate.edu/workshop2014/) in Starkvillu in USA. In addition, UP FAMNIT and UP IAM organized a one-day conference European research and the forest value chain. 

####  Publication of the magazine Ars Mathematica Contemporanea 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/mednarodno-sodelovanje/amc/amc.png:resizebox?2000x2000) University of Primorska with the  [ Association of Mathematicians,Physicists and Astronomers of Slovenia ](http://www.dmfa.si/) publish a magazine [ Ars Mathematica Contemporanea ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/amc) . In 2011 the magazine was listed on the Science Citation Index (SCI), which was a historic event for Slovenian mathematicians, in 2012 the magazine was ranked in the second quarter of SCI journals in the field of mathematics. Chief Editors of the magazine are our professors and researchers [ Prof. Dragan Marušič ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.marusic/) and [ Prof. Tomaž Pisanski ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/pisanski/) . In 2014, two new numbers of the magazine were published. 

####  A new generation of young researchers at UP IAM 

In 2014 [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) hired four new young researchers, three of them are enrolled in Doctoral Study Programmes at UP FAMNIT. Young researchers are, in the areas of mathematics, cryptography and suicidology, working under the mentorship of [ Prof. Dragan Marušič ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/dragan.marusic/) , [ Assoc. Prof. Enes Pasalic ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/enes.pasalic/) , [ Assoc. Prof. Štefko Miklavič ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/miklavic/) and [ Prof. Diego De Leo, DSc. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/diego.deleo/)

####  The implementation of study programs in English has started 

In this academic year (2014/2015) UP FAMNIT launched the [ Mathematics Study Programme in English ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/study-programmes) . Five foreign students are enrolled in the Undergraduate Study Programme Mathematics in English and three in the Doctoral Study Programme. With this step the Faculty open the door to promising young mathematicians from all over the world. 

####  Successfully completed and newly acquired research projects in 2014 

In 2014, Faculty successfully completed several projects, including two international projects (EnergyViLLab, GreGAS), two fundamental project ARRS ( [ The last contact with a health professional before suicide: What was missed? ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prj.aspx?lang=eng&id=6948&opt=1) [ Algebraic Graph Theory and Applications ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prj.aspx?lang=eng&id=6896&opt=1) ) and one project with local community ( [ Legal Identity and Development of the Municipality of Koper ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programs-projects) ). [ Energy ViLLab ](http://www.energyvillab.eu/meeting-with-alberto-cayuela-associate-director-of-ubc-sustainability-from-university-of-british-columbia/) was aimed for creating an area of good practice for the use of renewable energy, energy efficiency and sustainable mobility. [ GreGAS ](http://www.gregas.eu/) was the first mathematical project, coordinated from Slovenia. It was financed by the [ European Science Foundation ](http://www.esf.org/) under the program Eurocordes / Eurogiga. 

The Faculty was successful in the application for tenders for new projects and in 2014 began to implement four new basic ARRS projects. 
  * [ Algebraic Methods and Functional Analysis in the theory and practice of financial mathematics ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prj.aspx?opt=1&lang=eng&id=9332) , 
  * [ Algebraic Graph Theory and Applications ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programmes&projects) , 
  * [ Chemical Carcinogenesis - Computer Approach, ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prj.aspx?opt=1&lang=eng&id=9262)
  * [ The development of computational tools for modelling pharmaceutical molecules of interest. ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prj.aspx?opt=1&lang=eng&id=9267)

and one international project: 
  * [ What we Wood believe? Societal perceptions of the forest-based sector and its products towards a sustainable society ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programmes&projects)

we also acquired a new ARRS program: 
  * [ Conservation biology, from molecules to ecosystem ](http://www.sicris.si/search/prg.aspx?lang=eng&id=9193&opt=1)

in which the Faculty is included as a partner. 

In the framework of bilateral cooperation we have started to implement three new projects: 
  * [ Computer modelling of Biological Macromolecules ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/research/programmes&projects/11zr-projektitekocien15.3.2014.pdf) (partnership with Russia) 
  * [ Distribution, ecology and genetic structure of flowering plants in poljes of the Dinaric Alps: Chouardia litardierei (Liliaceae), Trifolium velebiticum (Fabaceae) and Edraianthus dalmaticus (Campanulaceae) as model flowering plants ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research/programmes&projects) (partnership with  Bosnia and Herzegovina  ) 
  * [ Using probability in Graph Theory and Networks ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/research/programmes&projects/11zr-projektitekocien15.3.2014.pdf) (partnership with USA) 

In autumn we acquired a new [ COST ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/cooperation/cost-actions) Action [ FP1407 _: Understanding wood modification through an integrated scientific and environmental impact approach (ModWoodLife),_ ](http://www.cost.eu/COST_Actions/fps/Actions/FP1407) which has a special weight, because it is, in the history of COST Actions, the first action in the field of forest-wood, which has a Slovenian coordinator - our colleague [ Assist. Prof. Andrea Kutnar. ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/andreja.kutnar/)

####  Cooperation between UP FAMNIT and the economy 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/karierni-dan1.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) In February 2014 UP FAMNIT held 1  st  career day at which potential employers, in the field of agriculture, environmental protection and nature, were presented to the students: [ JP Komunala Koper d.o.o.  ](http://www.komunalakoper.si/) , [ JZ Krajinski Park Strunjan  ](http://www.parkstrunjan.si/) , [ DOPPS BirdLife Slovenia  , ](http://ptice.si/en/) [ KZ Agraria Koper z. ](http://www.kz-agraria.si/documents/kontakti/kontakti_27.aspx) [ o.o.  ](http://www.kz-agraria.si/documents/kontakti/kontakti_27.aspx) in [ Kmetijsko svetovalna služba Koper  ](http://www.kmetijskizavod-ng.si/o-zavodu/oddelki/kmetijsko-svetovanje/kss-koper) (KGZ Nova Gorica). 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/actualpodpis.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) On 14 March 2014, UP FAMNIT and [ Actual I.T. ](http://www.actual-it.si/) signed an Agreement of Mutual Cooperation. By identifying areas of cooperation, institutions upgraded their multiannual connection, which was based, so far, mainly on scholarships for Computer Science students. 

In June, the letter of intent was signed between University of Primorska and [ Kmetijska zadruga Koper ](http://www.kz-agraria.si/) .  The letter of intent provides additional efforts in the fields of developing new technologies, products and services, education and scientific research, in order to develop knowledge, achieve market success and create new Slovenian brands.  The signing of this letter was particularly important for our students of the Undergraduate Study Programme  Mediterranean agriculture, because they are already involved with  [ Kmetijska zadruga Koper ](http://www.kz-agraria.si/) in the implementation of academic practice. 

In collaboration with Franka Cepak, MSc from [ Port of Koper ](http://www.luka-kp.si/eng/) , superiors of two departments at UP IAM and our teachers and researchers [ Assoc. Prof. Janez Žibert ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/janez.zibert/) and [ Jure Pražnikar, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/jure.praznikar/) prepared an article, [ _Long_ _-term analysis of elemental content and airborne particulate matter by PIXE and positive matrix factorization: Annual trends and seasonal variability During 2003 and 2008_ ](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1352231014004415) , which was accepted for publication in [ Atmospheric Environment ](http://www.journals.elsevier.com/atmospheric-environment/) (vol. 94 , September 2014, pages 723-733), a journal with a high impact factor and so expanded the successful cooperation with this company. 

UP FAMNIT actively participated with many companies, as part of this year successfully completed project [ EnergyVillab. ](http://www.energyvillab.eu/koper/)

####  Activities for promotion and popularization of the Natural Sciences 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/biodan.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

With the desire to approach science to the general public of all generations, in 2014 UP FAMNIT colleagues organized a number of well-attended events. 

In the context of [ Biological evenings at UP FAMNIT ](http://bioloski-veceri.famnit.upr.si/sl/napovednik) , Department of Biodiversity have organized three lectures: Consumer protection in terms of providing safe food (lecturer Elizabeth Mićović, PhD), Protection and proper management of Karst grasslands in the areas Natura 2000 (lecturer Jernej Figelj) and Biodiversity of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi, archaea and bacteria in natural CO2 springs (lecturer Nataša Šibanc). 

**![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/izleti-logo.png:resizebox?2000x2000) On ** FAMNIT [ Excursions into the Mathematical Universe ](http://izleti.famnit.upr.si/sl/) , the participants listened to a series of lectures: [ Prof. Sebastian Brešarj ](http://matematika-racunalnistvo.fnm.uni-mb.si/clani.aspx?id1=13) "Sensor networks and Wedding Planning", [ Assoc. Prof. Klavdija Kutnar ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/klavdijak/) '' The number π '', [ Sebastian Frelih, PhD ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/bostjanf/) '' Mathematics in sport '' and [ Assist. Prof. Arjan Brezigar Masten ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/brezigar.arjana/) ''Are you guys more talented in mathematics than girls?" Within those Excursions, we organized a competition called Plezija in Slovenian, which resulted in quite a few original poems, among all of them the best was declared on 14.3.2014 (day π) and belonged to Ivan Lisac. As a novelty in the academic year 2014/15 this cycle of lectures was offered as one of the programs of continuing education and training for professionals in education. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/os.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000) In February 2014, professors and assistants from UP FAMNIT Department of Information Sciences and Technologies visited Primary School Koper and Primary School Anton Ukmar and have given lectures on the safe use of the Internet. 

In March, Faculty organized the [ **second Mathematical day for Primary School students** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/novice/2-matematicni-dan-za) **and welcomed pupils from** Primary School Sostro, Primary School Oscar Kovačič ( _Lubiana_ ), Primary School Jožef Moškrič ( _Lubiana_ ), Primary School Ketteja in Murna ( _Lubiana_ ) and Primary School Ivana Roba ( _Sempeter near Nova Gorica_ ). In April, colleagues of the Department of Biodiversity organized a [ Science day for primary and secondary schools, ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/novice/bioloski-naravoslovn) which was attended by more than 80 pupils. 

![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/resources/images/o-fakulteti/o-nas/2014-2015/mat-je-kul.jpg:resizebox?2000x2000)

In the summer, [ 4  th  camp Mathematics is Cool ](http://tabor.famnit.upr.si/sl/) was successfully implemented. For the first time the camp was held separately for primary and secondary schools. It was attended by 38 young mathematics enthusiasts, the highest attendance ever. 

To celebrate the 200th anniversary of the birth of a famous Slovenian mathematician [ Franc Močnik ](http://sl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franc_Mo%C4%8Dnik_%28matematik%29) , assistants Ana Zalokar and [ Karla Ferjančič ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/karla.pockaj/) together with student Tadej Vodopivec visited Primary School Cerkno in September. They held three mathematical workshops for pupils from 6  th  to 9  th  grade.
summary:
Here's a structured summary of the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska** for the **2014–2015 academic year**, highlighting key areas of activity, leadership, and contact details:

---

### **Leadership & Structure**  
**Dean**:  
- **Prof. Klavdija Kutnar, PhD**  
**Vice-Deans**:  
- **Science & Research**: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
- **Education**: Prof. Martin Milanič, PhD  
**Department Chairs**:  
1. **Mathematics**: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
2. **Information Sciences & Technologies**: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
3. **Biodiversity**: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
4. **Applied Natural Sciences**: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
5. **Psychology**: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
**Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **Key Research & Academic Activities**  
1. **Research Highlights**:  
   - Published in high-impact journals (e.g., *Atmospheric Environment*).  
   - Collaborated on the **EnergyVillab** project with local companies.  
   - Conducted interdisciplinary research (e.g., environmental science, mathematics, psychology).  

2. **Educational Initiatives**:  
   - Launched **Mathematics is Cool** summer camps (attended by 38 students).  
   - Organized **Mathematical Days** for primary school students.  
   - Introduced **excursions into the Mathematical Universe** (lectures on math in sports, π, and sensor networks).  
   - Offered **continuing education programs** for educators.  

3. **Community Engagement**:  
   - Hosted **Biological Evenings** with lectures on biodiversity, food safety, and Karst ecosystems.  
   - Organized **Science Days** for primary and secondary schools (over 80 participants).  
   - Conducted **Internet safety workshops** for primary school students.  

4. **Cultural & Public Outreach**:  
   - Celebrated the **200th anniversary of Slovenian mathematician Franc Močnik** with math workshops.  
   - Launched the **Plezija** poetry competition (best poem by Ivan Lisac on π day).  

---

### **Collaborations & Partnerships**  
- Partnered with **companies** (e.g., for environmental research, EnergyVillab).  
- Collaborated with **local schools** and **scientific institutions** for educational and research projects.  

---

### **Contact Information**  
**University of Primorska**  
**Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies**  
**Address**: Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia  
**Phone**:  
- Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
- Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
**Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
**Emails**:  
- General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
- Administrative: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Notable Achievements**  
- **High-impact publications** in environmental science and mathematics.  
- **Record attendance** at Mathematics is Cool camp (38 participants).  
- **Successful collaboration** with local communities and industries.  
- **Educational outreach** programs for schools and professionals.  

For more details, visit the [FAMNIT website](http://www.famnit.upr.si).  

*(Last updated: 31.3.2015)*

#  Compulsory and elective courses in the postgraduate MASTER'S study programmes 2025/26 

In this section you can find information about the compulsory and elective courses in the next academic year 2025/26. 

The following information is available for the Master's study programmes in English. The study programmes in Slovene are available on the [ Slovene website ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//sl/studenti/vpis-famnitstudenti/izvedba-mag) . 

Students choose their elective courses in the enrollment paper in ŠIS, according to the [ study programme ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master) : 
  * [ Mathematical Sciences - in English ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrollment-famnitstudents/courses-mast/01mz2-en25261507.pdf) _(published: 15 July 2025)_
  * [ Data Science - in English ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrollment-famnitstudents/courses-mast/01pz2-en25261507.pdf) _(published: 15 July 2025)_
  * [ Sustainable Built Environments - in English ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrollment-famnitstudents/courses-mast/01tgo2en25261507.pdf) _(published: 15 July 2025)_

####  Electiveness at the University of Primorska (UP) 

The UP enables students to select and complete courses at other faculties of the UP. 

Students must carefully read the content restrictions of elective courses of their study programme. Content for each study programme is available on the UP FAMNIT website (within the presentation of the study programme). 

Information about the electiveness (rules, list of offered courses, application form, deadlines) are available [ HERE ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/electiveness) .
summary: The document outlines the compulsory and elective courses for the 2025/26 Master's study programs at FAMNIT, available in English with Slovene versions on a separate website. Students select elective courses via ŠIS based on program-specific guidelines provided for Mathematical Sciences, Data Science, and Sustainable Built Environments. It also details UP's electiveness policy, allowing students to enroll in courses from other UP faculties, with rules, course listings, and application procedures accessible via a dedicated link.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/final-works](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/final-works)

#  Final works in undergraduate, master's and doctoral studies 

On this subpage we publish information on the preparation procedure and deadlines for the submission of the diploma thesis, master's thesis and doctoral dissertation. 

[ Detector of similar content ](https://ds.aai.arnes.si/simplesaml/saml2/sp/idpdisco.php?entityID=https%3A%2F%2Fdpv.openscience.si%2Fsp&return=https%3A%2F%2Fdpv.openscience.si%2FShibboleth.sso%2FLogin%3FSAMLDS%3D1%26target%3Dcookie%253A1709804624_8467) : choose University of Primorska and log in with the same username and password as you use for eduroam and UNIS. 

P _rocedure in the case of preparation of a report by the administration of UP FAMNIT_
1. The lecturer confirms that the thesis is suitable for submission and can be checked for content similarity, 
2. The student sends the thesis to [ zakljucna.dela@famnit.upr.si ](mailto:zakljucna.dela@famnit.upr.si) , 
3. UP FAMNIT administrative assistant enters the electronic format of the thesis into the DPV and generates a report. The report is then sent to both the supervisor and the student, 
4. The mentor reviews the report in accordance with the regulations and instructions for completing studies at UP FAMNIT, 

[ Preparation procedure and deadlines for submitting diploma thesis at the undergraduate level ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Diploma-thesis)

[ Preparation procedure and deadlines for submitting master's thesis ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Masters-thesis)

[ Preparation procedure for submitting doctoral dissertation ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral-dissertation)
summary: The document outlines the procedures and deadlines for submitting final works (diploma theses, master's theses, and doctoral dissertations) at the University of Primorska's Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (FAMNIT). It details a process where lecturers confirm thesis suitability, students submit their work to a designated email, and administrative staff generate similarity reports via the DPV system, which are then reviewed by supervisors. Links to specific guidelines for each degree level are provided, emphasizing adherence to institutional regulations and deadlines.

Document location: [https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/register](https://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/register)

#  Registration 

###  **Important Info:**

**Registration deadline extended to** : **15 March 2018**

**Acceptance notification: 1 April 2018**

**Tuition payment deadline: 15 April 2018**

**Tuition fees:**
  * 450 Euros, for students seeking credits through the University of Primorska (6 ECTS) 
  * ~2,250 U$D, for students seeking credits through the Oregon State University (5 credits) 

###  **What is covered by the tuition fee?**
  * isMCS organistion costs 
  * Handouts 
  * Field trip expenses (transportation costs, entrance fees) 
  * 2-nights accommodation costs during the field course to Losinj Island, Croatia (bed & breakfast) 
  * Ice-breaker party 
  * Farewell dinner 

###  **What is not covered by the tuition fee?**
  * Travel to and from the School venues 
  * Accommodation and food in Koper 
  * Medical insurance 

###  **Student Grants**

The University of Primorska offers two tuition grants, which will be assigned to the two best applicants as determined by the isMCS Student Committee, and will cover the student’s tuition fees in full. If selected, you will be informed about the tuition grant award by e-mail, no later than 1 April 2018. To be considered for the tuition grant, please check the appropriate box in the Registration Form. 

###  **Registration Process**

There are two ways to register for isMCS: 
  1. Students seeking credits through the Oregon State University (5 US credits):   
  
To register, please proceed with your registration on this **_[ link ](http://international.oregonstate.edu/office-global-opportunities/programs/multiple-countries-italy-slovenia/osu-faculty-led-marine-conservation-international-school) _ ** and click on the “Apply Now” button.   
  2. Students seeking credits through the University of Primorska (6 ECTS):   
  
To register, please fill on-line **_[ Registration Form ](http://ismcs.famnit.upr.si/en/register/registration-form-1) . _ ** After successful registration, you will receive a confirmation e-mail to the address you specified in the form. The registration deadline for isMCS 2018 is extended to **15 March 2018.**

###  **Student Selection**

Due to restrictions in the number of participants, applicants will be selected on a competitive basis. Selection is based upon information provided in the Registration Form. Student selection is done by the isMCS Student Committee, following criteria of professional excellence. You will be informed about the acceptance by e-mail, no later than **1 April 2018** . 

###  **Cancellation Policy**

Cancellation must be received in writing via email. A processing fee of 100 EUROs will be charged for cancellations received until 15 May 2018. Refund requests will not be accepted after 15 May 2018. No refunds will be issued for no-shows. Allow up to four weeks for refunds to be processed.
summary: The isMCS program requires registration by **15 March 2018** for students seeking credits through the University of Primorska (6 ECTS, 450 Euros) or Oregon State University (5 credits, ~2,250 USD), with acceptance notifications by **1 April 2018** and tuition payments due by **15 April 2018**. Tuition fees cover organizational costs, materials, field trip expenses, accommodation on Losinj Island, and social events, but not travel, Koper lodging, or medical insurance. Two full-tuition grants are awarded to top applicants. Registration is via OSU’s portal or UP’s form, with competitive selection by the Student Committee. Cancellations before **15 May 2018** incur a 100 Euro fee, while no refunds are issued after this date or for no-shows.
