#  ŠIS REQUESTS 
##  [ INSTRUCTIONS FOR REQUEST SUBMISSION (pdf)  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/requests/navodilaprosnjeang.pdf) [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests#top)


Requests for courses are active at the beginning of each semester.  The submission deadline is determined each academic year by the Commission for Study and Study Affairs.  A student submits the request in ŠIS. 

###  _[ Changing the elective course ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A student can choose between the courses, available in the current academic year. The list of courses is published [ here ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrollment-famnitstudents) . 

####  Courses chosen in the _current_ academic year: 
- a student has to clearly write the name of the course he wants to change and the name of the course he want to take,   
- a _mandatory attachment_ to the request is the consent of the professor of the course a student want to take. 

####  Courses chosen in the _past_ academic years: 

Changing the course, chosen in previous academic years is only possible in exceptional, justified cases:   
- health, social or other unforeseeable circumstances: a _mandatory attachments_ are the documents that confirm the reasons stated in the request,   
-  reasons related to the implementation of the course  : a _mandatory attachment_ is the recommendation of the study programme coordinator.   
  
A _mandatory attachment_ to the request is the consent of the professor of the course a student want to take. 

###  _[ Taking the courses from the higher year ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

Students who are re-enrolled in the year (repetition, use of Year Plus, extended status) and individuals who have lost their student status can apply to fulfill the obligations of the senior year, as long as they meet the conditions listed below.  Students enrolled for the first time in the 1st or 2nd year are not entitled to take courses from the higher year, with the exception of students who are planning an Erasmus exchange in the 2nd or 3rd year. 

The conditions for submitting an application are as follows: 
  * completed all prescribed study obligations for the last enrolled year and previous years 
  * courses are conducted at the UP FAMNIT faculty 
- a student has to clearly write the name of the course he wants to take,   
- a _mandatory attachment_ to the request is the consent of the professor of the course. 

When submitting the request, the student is obliged to attach additional proof if all completed study obligations are not entered in ŠIS (certificate and explanation from the course leader/lecturer about the passed exam). 

###  _[ Taking (removing) additional study obligations ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

The student can perform additional study obligations outside the program. Additional study obligations outside the program are not counted in the average of the enrolled study program. 

A student has to clearly write the name of the course he wants to take. A _mandatory attachment_ is the consent of the professor of that course. 

###  _[ Changing the course language  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

The student must take courses in the language of the study program in which he/she is enrolled.  Changing the language of the course is only possible for elective courses taught in one language. 

In the application, the student clearly writes the reason and which elective course he/she wants to change, and must attach the consent of the  course leader/lecturer  to the request.  The application is submitted under the category _Change of elective course_ . 


Requests for enrollment are available in SIS in accordance with the  _Schedule of enrollment:_

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/requests/terminski-plan-vpisov-ang-2025.png:resizebox?1300x650)

A student can submit only ONE of the following requests in ŠIS at a time (see photo below) 

![](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/education/requests/2.2prosnjezavpisorganigramen.png:resizebox?2000x2000)

_IMPORTANT:_ The Committee for Study and Student Affairs will automatically examine the next most favorable enrollment solutions for the student, in case the submitted requests is denied (see Requests organization chart).  A student can submit the request before he/she receives all the exam results. In case a student fulfills the advancement requirements afterwards, he/she withdraw the request for enrollment and must informs the Student Services about it. 

_EXAMPLE_ :  A student submits a request for enrollment in the higher year without all obligations and the request is denied by the Committee for Study and Student Affairs. The committee then examine the next favorable enrollment solution for the student, i.e. extension of the student status.  In case a student has the right to extend the status, he will have opened enrollment paper.  In case a student has no right to extend the student status, he will have an option to repeat the year (only in case he did not repeat the year or changed the study programme so far).  In case also this option in not available for the student, he will be a pavzer in the next academic year. 

###  _[ Enrollment in the higher year without all obligations ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

Exceptionally, student may enroll in a higher year, even if he / she has not fulfilled all the obligations set out in the study program for enrollment in a higher year, when he / she has justified reasons, such as: maternity, illness, exceptional family and social circumstances, students with special needs, active participation in top professional, cultural and sports events, active participation at the University. 

The student must submit an application in his / her ŠIS for enrollment in a higher year without completed study obligations. Under the justification, he briefly writes down why he did not complete his study obligations and why he wants to enrol in a higher study year. 

__Attachments:_ _ The application must be accompanied by relevant evidence showing the reasons given in the statement of reasons. 

###  _[ Extension of student status ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

In accordance with the Higher Education Act (Article 70), a student may apply for an extension of student status during his / her studies, but for a maximum of one year and must therefore have justified reasons. 

In order to extend his / her status in ŠIS, the student must submit an application for the extension of the student's status and state in the justification that he / she wants to extend the status and the reasons why he / she wants to extend the student's status. 

__Attachments_ _ : The application must be accompanied by relevant evidence showing the reasons given in the statement of reasons. 

###  _[ Extension of students status in the st year (Year plus - foreign students  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

If the student meets the conditions for using Leta Plus, he submits an application to ŠIS. The student receives an e-mail about the prepared registration form and follows the instructions for registration. 

###  _[ Repeating the year (re-enrollment)  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A student who has not completed all the obligations set out in the study program for enrollment in a higher year may, taking into account the provisions of the Higher Education Act, repeat the year once during their studies.Requirements for repeating the year for each study programme are availabe at the description of each study programme (in the section _Continuation of studies according to the transfer criteria_ ). 

Undergraduate study programmes: [ https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate)

Master's study programmes: [ https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master)

Doctoral study programmes: [ https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral)

A study programmes with the requirements for repeating the year: 
  * PMA, PRIN, PZ: a student may repeat a year once during his / her studies if he / she collects at least 18 ECTS of the enrolled year; 
  * VN, TGO: a student may repeat a year once during his / her studies if he / she achieves at least 24 credits of the enrolled year. 
  * __Attachments_ _ : Not required. 

###  _[ Study language change ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A student who wishes to change the language of instruction for the study program they were originally enrolled in can be granted this change _only once during their entire period of study_ in the enrolled program. 

A student who wishes to change the language of instruction of the enrolled study program must provide reasons for the change. 

__Attachments_ _ : Not required. 

###  _[ Request for parallel enrollment ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A request for parallel enrollment is submitted by the student, who wants to take a parallel study. A requirement for taking the parallel study is an average grade at least 8 and positively examined requet.    
  
__Attachments_ _ : Not required. 


Requests are active throughout the academic year. 

###  _[ Withdrawal from an exam registration ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

If the student does not withdraw from the exam on time due to insurmountable circumstances (illness or other insurmountable circumstances), he must submit a request to the ŠIS within five days from the date of the exam at the latest and submit the relevant supporting documents. 

In the request, the student clearly writes the name of the exam from which he/she wants to withdraw, gives valid reasons and must attach proof that supports the stated reasons. 

###  _[ Extension of the thesis topic ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A student can apply for an extension of the validity of the topic of the Master's thesis for a maximum of one year for justified reasons.  The student attaches to the application Form 2: Application for extending the validity of the topic of the master's thesis, as well as the written consent of the supervisor.  The form is available [ here ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Masters-thesis) . 

###  _[ Recognition of examinations (previously acquired skills) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

A student who has previously formally acquired knowledge for the process of possible recognition submits a request to ŠIS.  In the application, he clearly writes the title of the subject he has previously completed and the title of the subject he proposes to be recognized at UP FAMNIT.  As proof, it is mandatory to attach a certificate of completion of the obligation and the curriculum of the completed course (confirmed with the stamp of the previous faculty). 

###  _[ Completing exams in advance ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

On the basis of legitimate reasons and the written consent of the course provider, a student may take an exam or exams from the courses of the year in which he is enrolled early.  Justifiable reasons include going abroad for studies or professional practice, hospitalization during the exam period, childbirth, and participation in a extraodrinary sports competition or extraordinary cultural event, etc.  The student must attach the consent of the course instructor to the application as proof. 

###  _[ Statement on the withdrawal ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

If the student wishes to withdraw from UP FAMNIT, he submits a request to the ŠIS, to which he attaches the Statement of withdrawal form available [ here ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Regulations%20and%20forms) as an attachment. 

###  _[ Other requests ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/requests) _

Under this category, the student submits requests related to the reduction or exemption of tuition fees / enrollment contributions or other contributions. The form is available [ here ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/Regulations%20and%20forms) .
summary: The document provides guidelines for submitting academic requests through ŠIS (Student Information System) at FAMNIT, covering course changes, enrollment adjustments, and other academic matters. Students must justify their requests, attach required documents (e.g., professor consent, proof of circumstances), and adhere to deadlines set by the Committee for Study and Student Affairs. Key requests include altering course selections, enrolling in higher years without full obligations, extending student status, repeating years, changing study languages, and handling exam withdrawals or thesis extensions. Each request has specific conditions, such as academic performance thresholds, special circumstances, or program-specific rules, with detailed instructions and forms available for submission.

Here's a structured summary of the key information about the **Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)** at the **University of Primorska** (as of 2020/21):

---

### **1. Academic Staff and Structure**
- **Total Teaching and Research Staff**: 182 (Full-time: 144, Part-time: 38)  
  - **Foreign Professors/Researchers**: 45 (Full-time: 38, Part-time: 7)  
- **Administrative Staff**: 30 (Full-time equivalent: 26.2 FTE)  
- **Gender Distribution**:  
  - Teaching/Research: 106 males (58.24%), 76 females (41.76%)  
  - Administrative: 24 females (80%), 6 males (20%)  
- **Age Distribution**:  
  - 20–30: 37  
  - 31–40: 72  
  - 41–50: 58  
  - 51–60: 32  
  - 61–70: 12  
  - 71+: 1  
  - **Total**: 212 staff  

---

### **2. Research Output (2020)**
- **FAMNIT Research Group**:  
  - **SCI/SSCI/Scopus (d/h)**: 189 (71/63/39/16)  
  - **A&HCI/Scopus**: 9  
  - **Other**: 12  
  - **Total**: 210 articles  
- **UP IAM Research Group**:  
  - **SCI/SSCI/Scopus (d/h)**: 125 (43/46/31/5)  
  - **A&HCI/Scopus**: 9  
  - **Other**: 5  
  - **Total**: 139 articles  

---

### **3. Financial Information (Fiscal Year 2020)**
- **Total Net Assets**: €5.01 million  
- **Funding Sources**:  
  - **MIZŠ (Education Funds)**: €3,329,361  
  - **ARRS (Research Funds)**: €774,646  
  - **Other Budgetary Sources**: €75,686  
  - **European Budget**: €587,896  
  - **Public Service**: €146,023  
  - **Merchandise Sales**: €98,336  
  - **Total**: €5,011,947  

---

### **4. Leadership and Departments**
- **Dean**: Prof. Ademir Hujdurović, PhD  
- **Vice-Deans**:  
  - Science & Research: Prof. Marko Orel, PhD  
  - Education: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - Quality Assurance: Prof. Elena Bužan, PhD  
- **Department Chairs**:  
  - Mathematics: Prof. Bojan Kuzma, PhD  
  - Information Sciences & Technologies: Prof. Tomaž Pisanski, PhD  
  - Biodiversity: Assoc. Prof. Vladimir Ivović  
  - Applied Natural Sciences: Prof. Dunja Bandelj, PhD  
  - Psychology: Prof. Diego De Leo, Dsc  
- **Faculty Secretary**: Nataša Vraneš  

---

### **5. Collaboration and Partnerships**
- Close ties with the **Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM)** for research.  
- Research collaboration with **University of Primorska** and other institutions.  

---

### **6. Contact Information**
- **Address**: Glagoljaška 8, SI-6000 Koper, Slovenia  
- **Phone**:  
  - Administration: +386 (5) 611 75 70  
  - Student Services: +386 (5) 611 75 75  
- **Fax**: +386 (5) 611 75 71  
- **Emails**:  
  - General: [info@famnit.upr.si](mailto:info@famnit.upr.si)  
  - Administration: [referat@famnit.upr.si](mailto:referat@famnit.upr.si)  

---

### **Key Highlights**
- **Research Strength**: FAMNIT and UP IAM collectively published over 350 scientific articles in 2020.  
- **Diversity**: Balanced gender representation (41.76% female staff) and a broad age range.  
- **International Collaboration**: 45 foreign professors/researchers contribute to global research networks.  
- **Financial Stability**: Strong funding from education and research grants, with a focus on EU projects.

#  Quick facts about Famnit 2020/21 
##  Study Programmes 2020/21  [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/quick-facts/2020-2021#top)

Study programmes implemented in Slovenian language: 
  * Undergraduate Programmes: [ Biodiversity  /  Conservation Biology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/conservation-biology) ,  [ Biopsychology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/biopsychology) , [ Bioinformatics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/bf-first/) ,  [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/cs-first/) ,  [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) ,  [ Mathematics in Economics and Finance ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/mef-first/) ,  [ Mediterranean Agriculture (VS) ](http://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/undergraduate/sk-first-vs) , [ Mediterranean Agriculture (UN) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/sk-first/) . 
  * Master Programmes: [ Applied Psychology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/applies-psychology) , [ Biopsyhology ](http://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/biopsyhology) , [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/computer-science/) , [ Data Science ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/data-science) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Nature Conservation ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/nature-conservation) ,  [ Sustainable Built Environments ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/built-environment) . 
  * Doctoral Programmes: [ ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science/) , [ Computer Science (international joint programme with University of St Andrews) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science-all) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat) . 

Study programmes implemented also in English language: 
  * Undergraduate Programmes: [ Bioinformatics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/bf-first/) , [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/cs-first/) , [ Mathematics ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate/math-first/) . 
  * Master Programmes: [ Data Science ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/master/data-science) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/mathematical-sciences/) ,  [ Sustainable Built Environments ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master/built-environment) . 
  * Doctoral Programmes: [ Computer Science ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science/) , [ Computer Science (international joint programme with University of St Andrews) ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/computer-science-all) , [ Mathematical Sciences ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/mathematical-sciences/) , [ Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat) . 

The European Credit Transfer System (ECTS) is applied in all study programs. 

Fields of education according to the KLASIUS-P-16 – Classification of fields of educational activities/qualifications (2020): (03) Social sciences, journalism and information science, (05) Natural sciences, mathematics and statistics, (06) Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs), (07) Engineering, manufacturing and construction, (08) Agriculture, forestry, fisheries and veterinary, (10) Services.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  General information 

Name of the programme: **Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments**   
Type of programme: Doctoral **, 3rd Bologna cycle**   
**Degree awarded:** “doktor znanosti / doktorica znanosti”   
Language: Slovene, English   
Location: Koper   
Duration: **3 years** (6 semesters)   
ECTS-credits: **180**   
Mode of study: part-time
summary:
**Doctoral Program in Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments**  
**University of Primorska (FAMNIT)**  

---

### **1. Program Overview**  
The Doctoral Program in Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments at the University of Primorska (FAMNIT) is designed to equip students with advanced knowledge and research skills in sustainable materials, environmental health, and interdisciplinary problem-solving. Graduates will contribute to global knowledge through innovative research and practical applications in architecture, urban planning, and environmental science.  

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**  
- **Eligibility**: Applicants must hold a Master’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field (e.g., civil engineering, environmental science, architecture, toxicology, or related disciplines).  
- **Transition from Previous Program**: Students transitioning from the previous program must complete all compulsory courses of the first year and meet advancement criteria (see **Advancement Requirements**).  
- **Language Proficiency**: Proficiency in English is required for coursework and research.  

---

### **3. Course Structure**  
**Core Courses**:  
- **Compulsory Courses (Year 1)**:  
  - Scientific Research Methods  
  - Renewable Materials in Built Environments  
  - Environmental Health and Toxicology  
  - Sustainable Urban Planning  
  - Modeling and Simulation in Environmental Systems  

- **Elective Courses**:  
  - Students may choose from accredited programs in Slovenia or abroad, focusing on architecture, urban planning, toxicology, environmental health, etc.  
  - **External Electives**: Up to 12 ECTS (6–12 ECTS per course, 1–2 courses). Requires syllabus approval from the study program coordinator.  

**Individual Research Work**:  
- Conducted under mentorship, with guidance from a supervisor.  
- Focuses on the student’s doctoral topic, integrating interdisciplinary knowledge.  

---

### **4. Doctoral Dissertation Requirements**  
- **Original Contribution**: The dissertation must represent a new, substantial contribution to global knowledge in renewable materials for healthy built environments.  
- **Publication Requirement**:  
  - At least **two articles** published (or accepted for publication) in **SCI-listed journals** (first or lead authorship).  
  - Articles must be in the field of renewable materials, environmental health, or related disciplines.  
- **Defense**: The dissertation must be publicly defended in accordance with the **Rules on the Preparation and Defense of the Doctoral Dissertation** (see [link](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral-dissertation/)).  

---

### **5. Advancement and Completion of Studies**  
**Advancement Requirements**:  
- **Year 2**: Complete all Year 1 compulsory courses (60 ECTS) and achieve **50 ECTS** by the end of Year 1.  
- **Year 3**: Complete Year 1 obligations (60 ECTS), earn **40 ECTS** from Year 2, and confirm the doctoral dissertation topic.  
- **Exceptions**: Justified reasons (e.g., family circumstances, illness, professional commitments) may allow enrollment in the next year without fulfilling all obligations.  

**Completion of Studies**:  
- **Total Credits**: Minimum **180 ECTS** (60 ECTS for dissertation preparation and defense).  
- **Final Requirements**:  
  - Successfully defend the doctoral dissertation.  
  - Publish two SCI-listed articles.  

---

### **6. Graduate Competencies**  
**General Competencies**:  
- Autonomous analysis of factors (mechanical, physical, sociological, ethical) affecting renewable materials.  
- Interdisciplinary problem-solving and integration of knowledge from diverse fields.  
- Independent research, innovation, and project management.  
- Communication and presentation skills for diverse stakeholders (scientific, economic, social).  
- Application of research skills to professional and educational contexts.  

**Subject-Specific Competencies**:  
- Critical evaluation of renewable materials in sustainable built environments.  
- Development and application of new research methods and technologies.  
- Comprehensive understanding of built environment disciplines (planning, construction, sustainability).  
- Ability to analyze, synthesize, and predict solutions for complex environmental challenges.  
- Critical assessment of industry trends and technological advancements.  

---

### **7. Graduate Employment Opportunities**  
- **Academic Research**: Positions in universities, research institutions, or public sector labs.  
- **Industry Roles**: R&D in construction, environmental consulting, or sustainable material development.  
- **Policy and Planning**: Roles in urban planning, environmental policy, or sustainable development initiatives.  
- **Entrepreneurship**: Innovation in green technologies or sustainable design.  

---

### **8. Tuition and Funding**  
- **Tuition Fee**: Annual fees are outlined in the [FAMNIT Price List](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information).  
- **Co-Funding**: Available to eligible students under the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.  
  - Criteria: Academic excellence, financial need, and alignment with institutional priorities.  
  - Details: [Co-Funding Information](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).  

---

### **9. Additional Notes**  
- **External Electives**: Students may pursue remote courses from accredited institutions.  
- **Mentorship**: Close collaboration with a supervisor is essential for research progress.  
- **Interdisciplinary Collaboration**: Encouraged through partnerships with architecture, environmental science, and public health programs.  

---

**Contact**: For admissions, course details, or research opportunities, contact the FAMNIT Doctoral Program Office.  

---  
This document provides a comprehensive overview of the program structure, requirements, and outcomes for prospective students. For specific queries, refer to the official FAMNIT resources or contact the university directly.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  About the programme [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

The Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments doctoral program offers a sophisticated set of pertinent, long-term perspectives on the emerging field of renewable materials for healthy built environments. Doctoral students receive a highly interdisciplinary education that encourages exploration of breakthrough topics and opens the door to a collaborative international workspace. Students leave the program as experts in the field who thoroughly understand theoretical concepts, hold broadly technical knowledge and independently develop new knowledge. The program equips students with advanced technological skill to solve the field’s most complex, demanding theoretical and practical problems.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Educational and professional goals [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)
  * To educate top experts in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments with in-depth understanding of theoretical concepts, wide technical knowledge and the ability to independently develop new knowledge. 
  * To provide the development of the capabilities for interdisciplinary, interconnected operation in the international scientific-research field and solving complex, the most demanding theoretical and practical problems in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments, using modern technological tools. 
  * To introduce a holistic approach in the search for creative and sustainable solutions in engineering and in the development of practical solutions for engineering professions. 
  * To train doctoral students for analytical and synthetic thinking in the detection, argumented presentation and problem solving in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments.
summary:
**Doctoral Program in Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments**  
**University of Primorska (FAMNIT)**  

---

### **1. Program Overview**  
The Doctoral Program in Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments at the University of Primorska (FAMNIT) is designed to equip students with advanced knowledge and research skills in sustainable materials, environmental health, and interdisciplinary problem-solving. Graduates will contribute to global knowledge through innovative research and practical applications in architecture, urban planning, and environmental science.  

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**  
- **Eligibility**: Applicants must hold a Master’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field (e.g., civil engineering, environmental science, architecture, toxicology, or related disciplines).  
- **Transition from Previous Program**: Students transitioning from the previous program must complete all compulsory courses of the first year and meet advancement criteria (see **Advancement Requirements**).  
- **Language Proficiency**: Proficiency in English is required for coursework and research.  

---

### **3. Course Structure**  
**Core Courses**:  
- **Compulsory Courses (Year 1)**:  
  - Scientific Research Methods  
  - Renewable Materials in Built Environments  
  - Environmental Health and Toxicology  
  - Sustainable Urban Planning  
  - Modeling and Simulation in Environmental Systems  

- **Elective Courses**:  
  - Students may choose from accredited programs in Slovenia or abroad, focusing on architecture, urban planning, toxicology, environmental health, etc.  
  - **External Electives**: Up to 12 ECTS (6–12 ECTS per course, 1–2 courses). Requires syllabus approval from the study program coordinator.  

**Individual Research Work**:  
- Conducted under mentorship, with guidance from a supervisor.  
- Focuses on the student’s doctoral topic, integrating interdisciplinary knowledge.  

---

### **4. Doctoral Dissertation Requirements**  
- **Original Contribution**: The dissertation must represent a new, substantial contribution to global knowledge in renewable materials for healthy built environments.  
- **Publication Requirement**:  
  - At least **two articles** published (or accepted for publication) in **SCI-listed journals** (first or lead authorship).  
  - Articles must be in the field of renewable materials, environmental health, or related disciplines.  
- **Defense**: The dissertation must be publicly defended in accordance with the **Rules on the Preparation and Defense of the Doctoral Dissertation** (see [link](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral-dissertation/)).  

---

### **5. Advancement and Completion of Studies**  
**Advancement Requirements**:  
- **Year 2**: Complete all Year 1 compulsory courses (60 ECTS) and achieve **50 ECTS** by the end of Year 1.  
- **Year 3**: Complete Year 1 obligations (60 ECTS), earn **40 ECTS** from Year 2, and confirm the doctoral dissertation topic.  
- **Exceptions**: Justified reasons (e.g., family circumstances, illness, professional commitments) may allow enrollment in the next year without fulfilling all obligations.  

**Completion of Studies**:  
- **Total Credits**: Minimum **180 ECTS** (60 ECTS for dissertation preparation and defense).  
- **Final Requirements**:  
  - Successfully defend the doctoral dissertation.  
  - Publish two SCI-listed articles.  

---

### **6. Graduate Competencies**  
**General Competencies**:  
- Autonomous analysis of factors (mechanical, physical, sociological, ethical) affecting renewable materials.  
- Interdisciplinary problem-solving and integration of knowledge from diverse fields.  
- Independent research, innovation, and project management.  
- Communication and presentation skills for diverse stakeholders (scientific, economic, social).  
- Application of research skills to professional and educational contexts.  

**Subject-Specific Competencies**:  
- Critical evaluation of renewable materials in sustainable built environments.  
- Development and application of new research methods and technologies.  
- Comprehensive understanding of built environment disciplines (planning, construction, sustainability).  
- Ability to analyze, synthesize, and predict solutions for complex environmental challenges.  
- Critical assessment of industry trends and technological advancements.  

---

### **7. Graduate Employment Opportunities**  
- **Academic Research**: Positions in universities, research institutions, or public sector labs.  
- **Industry Roles**: R&D in construction, environmental consulting, or sustainable material development.  
- **Policy and Planning**: Roles in urban planning, environmental policy, or sustainable development initiatives.  
- **Entrepreneurship**: Innovation in green technologies or sustainable design.  

---

### **8. Tuition and Funding**  
- **Tuition Fee**: Annual fees are outlined in the [FAMNIT Price List](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information).  
- **Co-Funding**: Available to eligible students under the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.  
  - Criteria: Academic excellence, financial need, and alignment with institutional priorities.  
  - Details: [Co-Funding Information](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).  

---

### **9. Additional Notes**  
- **External Electives**: Students may pursue remote courses from accredited institutions.  
- **Mentorship**: Close collaboration with a supervisor is essential for research progress.  
- **Interdisciplinary Collaboration**: Encouraged through partnerships with architecture, environmental science, and public health programs.  

---

**Contact**: For admissions, course details, or research opportunities, contact the FAMNIT Doctoral Program Office.  

---  
This document provides a comprehensive overview of the program structure, requirements, and outcomes for prospective students. For specific queries, refer to the official FAMNIT resources or contact the university directly.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Admission requirements [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

Admission to the 1st year shall be granted to applicants having: 
  * a Master's degree (second cycle); or 
  * a degree from a study programme with 300 ECTS-credits; or 
  * a degree from a pre-Bologna reform undergraduate study programme. 

The Faculty highly recommends prior education in the areas of built environment, civil engineering, wood science and architecture. 

Admission may be also granted to applicants who completed comparable studies abroad, and who, in accordance with the law, in the process of recognition of foreign education, have been granted the right to study in the study programme Renewable materials for healthy built environments. Individual applications of candidates for enrolment are managed by the UP FAMNIT commission. 

In case of ENROLMENT RESTRICTIONS in the 1st year, candidates will be chosen on the basis of: 
  * the success at previous study (average grade, final grade) - 70%, 
  * the grade of the oral examination - 30%. 

The selection procedure will also evaluate the candidate's presentation of the previous research work and his previous achievements in the scientific and professional field (published scientific and professional articles, awards, prizes and other). The scoring method is defined by the UP FAMNIT commission. 

Admission may also be gained by an applicant having completed a comparable study abroad. Prior to enrolment the applicant must apply for the recognition of completed education.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Continuation of studies according to the transfer criteria [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

Transfers between study programmes are possible on the basis of the Higher Education Act, Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes and in accordance with other regulations of this field. 

The transition between study programmes is the enrolment in the higher year of the study programme, in case of leaving the education at the initial study programme and continuing the study process at another study program of the same degree. The transition takes into account the comparability of the study programmes and the completed study obligations of the candidate in the initial study program. 

Access to year 2 or year 3 of the doctoral study programme Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is open to candidates of a related third-cycle doctoral degree programme, provided that the following conditions have been met: 
  * the candidate fulfils the requirements for admission to the study programme of Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments; 
  * completion of the first study programme which the candidate is transferring from ensures the acquisition of comparable competencies as those envisaged by the study programme of Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments; and 
  * other conditions in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes have also been met (a comparable course structure, course requirements completed). 

Entry into Year 2 of the doctoral degree programme of Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is also open to graduates of a related pre-Bologna reform Master’s degree programme. 

Individual applications for transfer shall be considered by the relevant committee of UP FAMNIT. Apart from comparability between both fields of study, the committee shall also consider comparability between the study programmes, in accordance with the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes. The applicant may also be required to complete differential exams as defined by the relevant Faculty committee. 

Enrolment on the basis of the Criteria for Transferring between Study Programmes is also open to candidates of a related study programme abroad who have been, in the process of recognition of their studies abroad, legally granted the right to continue their educational training in the study programme of Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments. 

In the case of limited enrolment, applicants shall be selected on the basis of the average grade of all completed study obligations obtained during the study programme they are transferring from.

# Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments ## Course structure [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top) The main components of the study programme are the following: * compulsory courses, * elective courses, * seminar, * individual research work, * doctoral dissertation. The content and structure of the study programme are presented below. [ Short descriptions of compulsory and elective courses are available HERE ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/doctoral/renew-mat/02hbeopisipredmetovang250320.pdf) [ . ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/master/nature-conservation/10vnopisipredmetovang04082016.pdf) Table 1: Structure of the study programme
Year of study Study obligation ECTS-credits (ECTS)
ECTS ECTS/Year of study
1. Compulsory course 30 60
Individual research work 15
Preparation of doctoral disposition - seminar 15
2. Individual research work 40 60
Internal elective course 20
3. Individual research work (preparation and defense of doctoral disertation) 60 60
TOTAL 180
Table 2: Compulsory courses of the 1st year of study
No. Course ECTS Form of contact hour
L SE LW Total
1. Scientific writting and presentation 5 30 - - 30
2. Design and analysis of planned experiments 5 30 - - 30
3. Renewable materials for healthy built environments 20 90 60 30 180
4. Preparation of doctoral disposition - seminar 15 - 30 - 30
Legend: L = lecture, SE = seminar, T= tutorial, LW = laboratory work ECTS = ECTS-credits Table 3: Elective courses
No. Course ECTS Form of contact hour
L SE T LW Total
1. Selected topics in wood science and technology 10 45 - - 20 65
2. Selected topics in wood modification and functionalization of renewable materials 10 45 45 - 10 100
3. Selected topics in advanced manufacturing / process control of engineered renewable materials for use in sustainable buildings 10 45 45 - 30 120
4. Selected topics in renewable material engineering and sustainable construction 10 45 45 - - 90
5. Selected topics in the characterisation of renewable materials 10 45 40 - 10 95
6. Selected topics in regenerative sustainability 10 45 20 - - 65
7. Selected topics in human health in the built environment 10 45 20 - - 65
8. Selected topics in IoT and the built environment 10 45 15 30 - 90
9. Selected topics in modeling 10 45 50 35 - 130
10. Holistic design of contemporary timber buildings 10 45 15 - - 60
11. The built environment and role of engineers 10 45 15 - - 60
As part of their individual research work in the 2nd year, students may choose external elective courses from accredited higher education study programmes in Slovenia or abroad, from the fields of architecture, urban planning, toxicology, environmental health, etc., carried out by appropriately habilitated higher education instructors. In order to choose an external subject, the student must first submit the syllabus of the desired elective course to the study programme coordinator for approval. Students may carry out external elective courses remotely. The student is advised to select external electives in the range of 6 - 12 ECTS by selecting one or two subjects in the range of 6 ECTS. #### Individual research work Individual research work represents scientific research work of a student on his doctoral topic, which the student performs under the guidance and in cooperation with his mentor. #### Doctoral dissertation (PhD Thesis) The doctoral dissertation represents a new substantial contribution to the global knowledge in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments. The work must be published (or accepted for publication) in an international journal from the field before the defense of the doctoral thesis, namely in at least two articles in journals from the SCI list (first or lead authorship). The procedure for preparing a doctoral dissertation is regulated by the [ Rules on the preparation and defence of the doctoral dissertation at the University of Primorska ](https://www.famnit.upr.si//en/education/doctoral-dissertation/) .

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Advancement requirements and completion of studies [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

####  Advancement requirements 

A student can enroll in the 2nd year of study if he / she has completed all compulsory courses of the 1st year and has reached 50 ECTS-credits. A student can enroll in the 3rd year if he / she has completed all study obligations of the 1st year (60 ECTS-credits), acquired at least 40 ECTS-credits from the 2nd year and his / her topic of the doctoral dissertation has been confirmed. 

The procedure for registering the topic of the doctoral dissertation is in accordance with the provisions of the [ university regulations governing the preparation and defence of doctoral dissertations ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/studenti/pravilniki-obrazci#heading3) . 

Exceptionally, a student may enroll in the next year of study, even if he / she has not fulfilled all the required obligations, in case of justified reasons, such as: motherhood, longer illness, exceptional family and social circumstances, recognized status persons with special needs, active participation in top professional, cultural and sport events, active participation in the bodies of the University. 

A student who achieves above-average study results is allowed to advance more quickly. The decision is taken by the UP FAMNIT Senate and St Andrews University upon the candidate's request and the reasoned opinion of the aforementioned committee responsible. The decision determines the manner of faster progress. 

A student who has not fulfilled all the obligations of the study programme for enrollment in the next year of study may, subject to the provisions of the Higher Education Act, repeat the year at the time of study. 

####  Completion of studies 

The doctoral dissertation represents a new substantial contribution to the global knowledge in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments. The work must be published (or accepted for publication) in an international journal from the field before the defense of the doctoral thesis, namely in at least two articles in journals from the SCI list (first or lead authorship). 

In order to complete the study programme and obtain the scientific title, the student must complete all the requirements of the study program and successfully publicly defend the doctoral dissertation. The student must acquire at least 180 ECTS-credits, of which 60 ECTS-credits are for the preparation and successful defense of the doctoral disertation.

---

### **1. Program Overview**  
The Doctoral Program in Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments at the University of Primorska (FAMNIT) is designed to equip students with advanced knowledge and research skills in sustainable materials, environmental health, and interdisciplinary problem-solving. Graduates will contribute to global knowledge through innovative research and practical applications in architecture, urban planning, and environmental science.  

---

### **2. Admission Requirements**  
- **Eligibility**: Applicants must hold a Master’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field (e.g., civil engineering, environmental science, architecture, toxicology, or related disciplines).  
- **Transition from Previous Program**: Students transitioning from the previous program must complete all compulsory courses of the first year and meet advancement criteria (see **Advancement Requirements**).  
- **Language Proficiency**: Proficiency in English is required for coursework and research.  

---

### **3. Course Structure**  
**Core Courses**:  
- **Compulsory Courses (Year 1)**:  
  - Scientific Research Methods  
  - Renewable Materials in Built Environments  
  - Environmental Health and Toxicology  
  - Sustainable Urban Planning  
  - Modeling and Simulation in Environmental Systems  

- **Elective Courses**:  
  - Students may choose from accredited programs in Slovenia or abroad, focusing on architecture, urban planning, toxicology, environmental health, etc.  
  - **External Electives**: Up to 12 ECTS (6–12 ECTS per course, 1–2 courses). Requires syllabus approval from the study program coordinator.  

**Individual Research Work**:  
- Conducted under mentorship, with guidance from a supervisor.  
- Focuses on the student’s doctoral topic, integrating interdisciplinary knowledge.  

---

### **4. Doctoral Dissertation Requirements**  
- **Original Contribution**: The dissertation must represent a new, substantial contribution to global knowledge in renewable materials for healthy built environments.  
- **Publication Requirement**:  
  - At least **two articles** published (or accepted for publication) in **SCI-listed journals** (first or lead authorship).  
  - Articles must be in the field of renewable materials, environmental health, or related disciplines.  
- **Defense**: The dissertation must be publicly defended in accordance with the **Rules on the Preparation and Defense of the Doctoral Dissertation** (see [link](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral-dissertation/)).  

---

### **5. Advancement and Completion of Studies**  
**Advancement Requirements**:  
- **Year 2**: Complete all Year 1 compulsory courses (60 ECTS) and achieve **50 ECTS** by the end of Year 1.  
- **Year 3**: Complete Year 1 obligations (60 ECTS), earn **40 ECTS** from Year 2, and confirm the doctoral dissertation topic.  
- **Exceptions**: Justified reasons (e.g., family circumstances, illness, professional commitments) may allow enrollment in the next year without fulfilling all obligations.  

**Completion of Studies**:  
- **Total Credits**: Minimum **180 ECTS** (60 ECTS for dissertation preparation and defense).  
- **Final Requirements**:  
  - Successfully defend the doctoral dissertation.  
  - Publish two SCI-listed articles.  

---

### **6. Graduate Competencies**  
**General Competencies**:  
- Autonomous analysis of factors (mechanical, physical, sociological, ethical) affecting renewable materials.  
- Interdisciplinary problem-solving and integration of knowledge from diverse fields.  
- Independent research, innovation, and project management.  
- Communication and presentation skills for diverse stakeholders (scientific, economic, social).  
- Application of research skills to professional and educational contexts.  

**Subject-Specific Competencies**:  
- Critical evaluation of renewable materials in sustainable built environments.  
- Development and application of new research methods and technologies.  
- Comprehensive understanding of built environment disciplines (planning, construction, sustainability).  
- Ability to analyze, synthesize, and predict solutions for complex environmental challenges.  
- Critical assessment of industry trends and technological advancements.  

---

### **7. Graduate Employment Opportunities**  
- **Academic Research**: Positions in universities, research institutions, or public sector labs.  
- **Industry Roles**: R&D in construction, environmental consulting, or sustainable material development.  
- **Policy and Planning**: Roles in urban planning, environmental policy, or sustainable development initiatives.  
- **Entrepreneurship**: Innovation in green technologies or sustainable design.  

---

### **8. Tuition and Funding**  
- **Tuition Fee**: Annual fees are outlined in the [FAMNIT Price List](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/general-information).  
- **Co-Funding**: Available to eligible students under the **Decree on Co-Financing of Doctoral Studies**.  
  - Criteria: Academic excellence, financial need, and alignment with institutional priorities.  
  - Details: [Co-Funding Information](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrolment#heading4).  

---

### **9. Additional Notes**  
- **External Electives**: Students may pursue remote courses from accredited institutions.  
- **Mentorship**: Close collaboration with a supervisor is essential for research progress.  
- **Interdisciplinary Collaboration**: Encouraged through partnerships with architecture, environmental science, and public health programs.  

---

**Contact**: For admissions, course details, or research opportunities, contact the FAMNIT Doctoral Program Office.  

---  
This document provides a comprehensive overview of the program structure, requirements, and outcomes for prospective students. For specific queries, refer to the official FAMNIT resources or contact the university directly.

chunk:
#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Graduate competencies [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

###  General competencies 
  * The ability to autonomously identify, analyze, critically assess and reflect the situation, anticipate the consequences of factors (mechanical, physical, sociological, psychological, ethical) that influence the use of renewable materials for healthy built environments. 
  * To be qualified for planning, synthesizing and interdisciplinary solving of complex problems in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments, with the ability to integrate knowledge from different fields, for a comprehensive problem solving. 
  * To gain knowledge and skills for independent research work, gain new insights, solve concrete work problems using modern scientific methods and procedures, search for new solutions and manage the most demanding scientific-research and other projects. 
  * The ability to participate in various interdisciplinary expert groups and integrate various scientific and professional areas. 
  * To be capable of communication, argumentation of solutions and presentation of research findings to different stakeholders (in the scientific, economic and social environment). 
  * To acquire skills for identifying situations and applying skills and knowledge gained from scientific and research work to professional solutions, as well as various educational programs and implementation of the educational process. 

###  Subject-specific competencies 
  * To understand the tasks and work of civil engineers and spatial planners. 
  * The ability to address complex problems in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments with interdisciplinary research work. 
  * The ability to critically evaluate and address research results, develop and apply new research methods, and transfer and integrate new technologies into practice. 
  * The ability to critically evaluate the use of wood and other natural materials in a sustainable built environment. 
  * To manage a broad overview of the areas related to the built environment, construction, planning and sustainable measures and integrate knowledge to solve complex issues. 
  * To develop a comprehensive knowledge of the broad field of the built environment, which will enable them to efficiently deploy and apply advanced topics in various areas of practice and research work. 
  * The ability to describe and formulate in writing the given situation. 
  * The ability to express themselves, define problems in project applications or research plans in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments. 
  * The ability to present scientific results in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments to various audiences. 
  * Through the understanding and applications of modern technology, they will be able to solve building and other problems related to the use of wood in the built environment. 
  * The ability to handle and evaluate the analysis of the selected problem. 
  * The ability to derive logical decisions and deduce new conclusions from the given data. 
  * To autonomously face problems in the field of renewable materials and a healthy built environment and formulate their solutions logically and analytically. 
  * The ability to analyze, synthesize and predict solutions and consequences of factors in disciplines related to the built environment, considering sustainable development. 
  * The ability to critically assess the developments in the field of renewable materials for healthy built environments. 
  * The ability to independently search, acquire expertise and integrate new knowledge with existing knowledge. 
  * The ability to search for new information, interpret and evaluate, sort and place them in the context of the built environment disciplines.

#  Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments 
##  Graduate employment opportunities [ top ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral/renew-mat#top)

Graduates of the Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments doctoral program can pursue research careers in academia, the public sector or private laboratories. The wide range of theoretical and practical knowledge gained from the program can also prepare students for diverse employment in research and development or operations across a wide range of industries. The opportunity to participate in practical research during the course of study gives students a distinct advantage as they can connect with industry significantly earlier and more efficiently.

chunk:
Document location: [https://iam.upr.si/en/research](https://iam.upr.si/en/research)

**[ UP IAM ](https://www.sicris.si/public/jqm/org.aspx?lang=slv&opdescr=search&opt=2&subopt=500&code1=org&code2=auto&psize=10&hits=1&page=1&count=1&id=2466&slng=slv&search_term=1669&order_by=) ** is **_the only research institute_ ** operating **__ ** within the University of Primorska (UP). Since its establishment, it has carried out both national and international projects. Alongside its core projects, it has also implemented applied projects, which represent a strong link with the economy and other stakeholders, the users of research results. 

The **key advantages** for research work at UP IAM are: 
  * scientific excellence, 
  * interdisciplinary integration, 
  * strong international links, 
  * strong links with the local economy, 
  * strong links with UP FAMNIT, enabling teaching and knowledge transfer. 
* * *

UP IAM focuses its research and development activities in four fields: 

**MATHEMATICS**   
The UP IAM research group is one of the four leading research groups in the field of Algebraic Graph Theory worldwide (the other three are in China, Australia and South Korea). Researchers from the Department were involved in the organisation of the 8th European Congress of Mathematics ( **[ 8ECM ](https://www.8ecm.si/) ** ), held in June 2021, the most important mathematical event hosted by Slovenia and held under the honorary patronage of the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Mr Borut Pahor. 

**INFORMATION SCIENCES AND TECHNOLOGIES**   
The Department of Information Sciences and Technologies has been a key participant in the nationally important task of introducing eHealth. Within the **[ CORA Centre ](https://cora.iam.upr.si/sl/) ** , it is mainly focused on the development of applications relevant for the optimal operation of the UP. 

**TECHNOLOGY**   
The field of technology is mainly linked to sustainable aspects of natural resource use and environmental protection. A key achievement is the InnoRenew (Teaming) project, under which the Centre of Excellence for Research and Innovation in Renewable Materials and Healthy Living Environments ( **[ InnoRenew CoE ](https://innorenew.eu/) ** ) was established in 2016. Another important partnership is the more than ten-year cooperation with the **[ Port of Koper d.d. ](https://www.luka-kp.si/en/) ** , one of the most important economic operators in the local environment. 

**PUBLIC HEALTH**   
The area of Public Health focuses on mental health and suicidology, i.e. the study of a fundamental Slovenian public health problem. The **[ Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research ](https://zivziv.si/slovene-centre-for-suicide-research/) ** (SCSR) is strongly involved in both research and practice in suicide prevention, responding quickly and effectively to the needs of the environment, especially young people. 
* * *

The research work of UP IAM is particularly closely linked to **[ UP Famnit ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en) ** . In fact, the two members have concluded and are actively implementing a Memorandum of Mutual Cooperation in areas of common interest.
summary: The University of Primorska's Institute of Mathematics, Informatics, and Mechanics (UP IAM) is the sole research institute at the university, renowned for its scientific excellence, interdisciplinary approach, and strong ties to both international academia and the local economy, including partnerships with UP FAMNIT and key stakeholders. Its research spans four core areas: Mathematics (notable for leadership in Algebraic Graph Theory and hosting the 8th European Congress of Mathematics), Information Sciences and Technologies (driving eHealth initiatives through the CORA Centre), Technology (focusing on sustainable resource management and the InnoRenew CoE), and Public Health (addressing mental health and suicidology via the Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research). These efforts are closely integrated with UP FAMNIT through a Memorandum of Mutual Cooperation, enhancing knowledge transfer and applied research impact.

##  Rules of the Faculty UP FAMNIT

Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty)

#  About the Faculty 

[ ![](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/images/about-faculty/welcomefamnit.jpg:resizebox?360x360) ](http://www.hippocampus.si/ISBN/978-961-7023-07-7/index.html)

The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) is a member of the [ University of Primorska  ](http://www.upr.si/) and was founded in 2006 ( [ see the booklet for more information ](http://www.hippocampus.si/ISBN/978-961-6832-87-8/index.html) )  . 

The Faculty offers [ courses  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education) at all three levels of higher education and conducts [ research ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research) in the fields of mathematics, computer science and information technology, and in the natural sciences. The Faculty works closely with the  University of Primorska, Andrej Marušič Institute (  [ UP IAM ](http://www.iam.upr.si/sl/) )  , where most of the academic staff of UP FAMNIT are currently conducting research activities. 

We have 1.035 students enrolled in study programmes for the 2023/24 academic year, of which 768 were in undergraduate programmes, 215 in master's programmes, and 52 are enrolled in doctoral programmes. The undergraduate and master's programmes are all offered on a full-time basis, while the doctoral programmes are offered only on a part-time basis. Courses are held in Koper and Izola (Livade 1.0).  [ Welcome to Famnit  ](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dg_ocsS3mrU)

The Faculty employs 161 university teachers, colleagues and researchers ( [ staff  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/staff/) ) working in [ five departments  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/departments) , and 38 professional/technical and administrative staff. 

The basic activities of the Faculty include  [ education  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education) and [ research  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/research) , while the Faculty is also the organiser and co-organiser of successful [ international conferences and other scientific meetings  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/conferences/) . 

The Faculty is actively involved in the  international field of higher education and research  , and has established a wide network of research links with prominent foreign universities.  We like to emphasise that the UP FAMNIT research group **is one of the two leading research groups in the field of algebraic graph theory in the world.** (The other three groups are located in China, Australia and South Korea.) These efforts by the Faculty have helped place the University of Primorska as an internationally recognised research institution. 

The Faculty also holds **lectures for the general public** (  Excursions into the mathematical universe  ,  Biological evenings  ), [ **summer schools and camps** ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/summer-schools) (  Math is Cool  Summer Camp  , Biology  Camp  ) as well as **lectures and[ workshops ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/workshops) , ** aimed primarily at **secondary school and primary school** pupils in their final year (  Orada  - the Computer Science Workshop for secondary school pupils, lectures and workshops in the field of natural science). In September, before the start of the year, we organise **workshops** for first year students, **called an Introduction to studying.**

The Dean, [ Prof. Ademir Hujdurović  ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/ademir.hujdurovic/) is the Head of the Faculty, while the  [ Faculty Leadership  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/staff/) also consists of the Vice-Deans, the Heads of departments and the Faculty General Secretary  [ .  ](http://www.famnit.upr.si/sl/zaposleni-in-sodelavci/)
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) at the University of Primorska, established in 2006, offers undergraduate, master's, and doctoral programs in mathematics, computer science, information technology, and natural sciences, with courses delivered in Koper and Izola. It conducts research in collaboration with the University of Primorska and the Andrej Marušič Institute, emphasizing its status as one of the world’s leading research groups in algebraic graph theory. The faculty employs 161 academic staff across five departments and supports 1,035 students, with part-time doctoral programs. Beyond education and research, UP FAMNIT organizes international conferences, public lectures, summer schools, and workshops for secondary and primary school students, fostering outreach and engagement. Led by Dean Prof. Ademir Hujdurović, the faculty also hosts introductory workshops for first-year students, reinforcing its commitment to academic excellence and community involvement.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/mission-and-vision](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/about-faculty/mission-and-vision)

#  Mission and Vision 

##  Mission 

When the Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) was founded in 2006, the University of Primorska balanced its scientific focus with the natural sciences. 

Faculty study programmes are complementary in nature and strive to create a space where the universal scientific language (mathematics) in its optimal communication field (computer science) co-creates integrated science. The goal is to impart quality interdisciplinary knowledge to students and graduates, who will then be able to confidently use the apparatuses of different scientific disciplines. 

Faculty development is based on high quality mono- and interdisciplinary study programmes of mathematics, computer sciences, informatics, natural sciences and technical sciences, with connections to other sciences. 

The study programmes are based on modern teaching techniques supported by information technologies. Teaching and study processes are based on proactive methods, which stimulate students to critically evaluate knowledge and skills gained. Special focus is placed on linking education and research. Students are involved in research activities at the faculty and at the University of Primorska, Andrej Marušič Institute (UP IAM). Today, it is not enough to be top-notch just within one scientific field, but rather to be interdisciplinary. The fundamental questions asked by humanity are too complex to be answered with the tools of only one profession. To this end, UP Famnit and UP IAM cooperate closely in their research endeavours. These institutions develop natural sciences jointly with an aim to achieve world-class excellence. 

The faculty also lives – without emphasising it specifically – what should be automatically engraved in every university aware of its universal character: the transcending of gender-based, ethnic, cultural and other limits. UP FAMNIT is heavily involved in the international university space. Research links have been established with China, South Korea, USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Spain, Russia, Israel and other states, while we plan to further expand our international research cooperation in the future. 

##  Vision 

UP FAMNIT’s vision, in line with the [ Mid-term development strategy of the University of Primorska 2021 – 2027 ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/about-faculty/mission-and-vision/up-srednjerocna-razvojna-strategija-2021-27---en.pdf) , foresees that the faculty will become an international leading centre within at least one more professional field (besides mathematics and information and communication technologies) and add one more interdisciplinary professional niche with world-wide importance (bioinformatics, e-health, biopsychology, suicidology). 

In line with this, the faculty staff aims to double scientific publishing in international scientific journals. All higher educational staff will publish at least one article and on average at least two annually, while the number of scientific articles in the most prestigious international journals and the number of monographs published by distinguished publishing houses will rise. 

An important part of UP FAMNIT’s vision is to become the regional, national and/or global centre for some fields of natural sciences and technical sciences and to establish working partnerships with the private sector, which would include a joint technological-development park. 

UP FAMNIT will prepare new postgraduate study programmes as a continuum and upgrade of its undergraduate study programmes.
summary: The Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (UP FAMNIT) was established in 2006 to integrate scientific disciplines through interdisciplinary study programs emphasizing mathematics, computer science, and natural sciences, fostering critical thinking and research engagement. Its mission prioritizes global collaboration, diversity, and international partnerships, while its vision aims to establish the faculty as an international leader in emerging fields like bioinformatics and e-health, expand scientific publishing, strengthen industry collaborations, and develop advanced postgraduate programs to enhance its regional and global academic impact.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.iam.upr.si/en/research](https://www.iam.upr.si/en/research)

**[ UP IAM ](https://www.sicris.si/public/jqm/org.aspx?lang=slv&opdescr=search&opt=2&subopt=500&code1=org&code2=auto&psize=10&hits=1&page=1&count=1&id=2466&slng=slv&search_term=1669&order_by=) ** is **_the only research institute_ ** operating **__ ** within the University of Primorska (UP). Since its establishment, it has carried out both national and international projects. Alongside its core projects, it has also implemented applied projects, which represent a strong link with the economy and other stakeholders, the users of research results. 

The **key advantages** for research work at UP IAM are: 
  * scientific excellence, 
  * interdisciplinary integration, 
  * strong international links, 
  * strong links with the local economy, 
  * strong links with UP FAMNIT, enabling teaching and knowledge transfer. 
* * *

UP IAM focuses its research and development activities in four fields: 

**MATHEMATICS**   
The UP IAM research group is one of the four leading research groups in the field of Algebraic Graph Theory worldwide (the other three are in China, Australia and South Korea). Researchers from the Department were involved in the organisation of the 8th European Congress of Mathematics ( **[ 8ECM ](https://www.8ecm.si/) ** ), held in June 2021, the most important mathematical event hosted by Slovenia and held under the honorary patronage of the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Mr Borut Pahor. 

**INFORMATION SCIENCES AND TECHNOLOGIES**   
The Department of Information Sciences and Technologies has been a key participant in the nationally important task of introducing eHealth. Within the **[ CORA Centre ](https://cora.iam.upr.si/sl/) ** , it is mainly focused on the development of applications relevant for the optimal operation of the UP. 

**TECHNOLOGY**   
The field of technology is mainly linked to sustainable aspects of natural resource use and environmental protection. A key achievement is the InnoRenew (Teaming) project, under which the Centre of Excellence for Research and Innovation in Renewable Materials and Healthy Living Environments ( **[ InnoRenew CoE ](https://innorenew.eu/) ** ) was established in 2016. Another important partnership is the more than ten-year cooperation with the **[ Port of Koper d.d. ](https://www.luka-kp.si/en/) ** , one of the most important economic operators in the local environment. 

**PUBLIC HEALTH**   
The area of Public Health focuses on mental health and suicidology, i.e. the study of a fundamental Slovenian public health problem. The **[ Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research ](https://zivziv.si/slovene-centre-for-suicide-research/) ** (SCSR) is strongly involved in both research and practice in suicide prevention, responding quickly and effectively to the needs of the environment, especially young people. 
* * *

The research work of UP IAM is particularly closely linked to **[ UP Famnit ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en) ** . In fact, the two members have concluded and are actively implementing a Memorandum of Mutual Cooperation in areas of common interest.
summary: The University of Primorska's Institute of Mathematics, Informatics, and Mechanics (UP IAM) is the sole research institute at the university, renowned for its scientific excellence, interdisciplinary approach, and strong ties to both international academia and the local economy, including partnerships with UP FAMNIT and the Port of Koper. Its research spans four key areas: Mathematics (notable for leadership in Algebraic Graph Theory and hosting the 8th European Congress of Mathematics), Information Sciences and Technologies (driving eHealth initiatives through the CORA Centre), Technology (focusing on sustainable resource management via the InnoRenew CoE and collaborations with the Port of Koper), and Public Health (addressing mental health and suicidology through the Slovenian Centre for Suicide Research). These efforts underscore UP IAM's role in bridging academic research with practical applications and societal needs.

chunk:
Document location: [https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education)

#  Education 

UP FAMNIT offers undergraduate and postgraduate study programmes in various fields, i.e. mathematics, computer science, natural sciences and biotechnical sciences. 

The European Credit Transfer System (ECTS) is applied to all study programmes, which makes it possible to take elective courses. Students can select courses from within their chosen study programme, from study programmes offered by other university faculties and member institutions, or from other higher education institutions in Slovenia and abroad. 

Studies are based on modern teaching methods and are carried out in various forms, such as lectures, seminars, exercises (field work, laboratories), tutorials and independent study, supported by information and communication technology. Teaching and learning processes are based on proactive methods that encourage students to critically evaluate their acquired knowledge and skills. 

The Faculty focuses on the integration of education and research and includes students in research activities of UP FAMNIT and the [ Andrej Marušič Institute ](http://www.iam.upr.si/en/) research centre, also a member of the University of Primorska. 

In the academic year 2024/25 the Faculty offers seven [ undergraduate ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/undergraduate) , seven [ Master’s ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/master) and five [ Doctoral ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/doctoral) study programmes. At undergraduate level (first Bologna cycle) the Faculty offers six academic study programmes and one higher education professional study programme which last three years (180 ECTS-credits) and enable graduates to seek employment or continue their studies in Master’s study programmes (second Bologna cycle). The postgraduate level (second and third cycle) offers Master’s (two years, i.e. 120 ECTS-credits) and doctoral (three or four years, i.e. 180 or 240 ECTS-credits) study programmes. 

The Faculty Senate has appointed a [ coordinator for each study programme ](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/coordinators) . These faculty members are in charge of coordinating and overseeing the implementation of the study programmes. 

**Data for the Academic Year 2024/25**
  * Study programmes: 19 (7 undergraduate and 12 postgraduate) 
  * Students: 1035 (768 undergraduate and 267 postgraduate) 
  * International students: 544 (440 undergraduate and 104 postgraduate)
summary: UP FAMNIT offers undergraduate, Master’s, and doctoral study programs in mathematics, computer science, natural sciences, and biotechnology, structured under the ECTS system to allow flexible course selection across disciplines and institutions. Teaching emphasizes modern methods, critical thinking, and integration with research through partnerships like the Andrej Marušič Institute. For the 2024/25 academic year, the faculty provides seven undergraduate (3-year, 180 ECTS), seven Master’s (2-year, 120 ECTS), and five doctoral (3–4-year, 180–240 ECTS) programs, supported by 19 total study programs and a student body of 1,035, including 544 international students. Each program is coordinated by faculty members ensuring quality and alignment with academic goals.
